<item>
            <title>[LANG-1663] Wrong exception in various NumberUtils method documentations</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1663</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The documentation of various methods in &lt;em&gt;NumberUtils&lt;/em&gt;&#160;says&#160;an &lt;em&gt;IllegalArgumentException&lt;/em&gt;&#160;is thrown in case of a &lt;em&gt;null&lt;/em&gt; argument , e.g., see &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/197d50434748bfb2db935266cfe740fc01a607ee/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/math/NumberUtils.java#L1194&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/197d50434748bfb2db935266cfe740fc01a607ee/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/math/NumberUtils.java#L1194&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, these methods throw a &lt;em&gt;NullPointerException&lt;/em&gt; in this case. The following methods are affected:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;long min(final long... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;int min(final int... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;short min(final short... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;byte min(final byte... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;static double min(final double... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;float min(final float... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;long max(final long... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;int max(final int... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;short max(final short... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;byte max(final byte... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;double max(final double... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;float max(final float... array)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;void validateArray(final Object array)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13382950">LANG-1663</key>
            <summary>Wrong exception in various NumberUtils method documentations</summary>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1657] DiffBuilder: Type constraint for method append(..., DiffResult) too strict</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1657</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The&#160;DiffBuilder&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; has a method&#160;append which allows to append an existing DiffResult for a property. The example illustrates this the following way:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Person &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;implements&lt;/span&gt; Diffable&amp;lt;Person&amp;gt; {
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; name;
   Address address; &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;implements&lt;/span&gt; Diffable&amp;lt;Address&amp;gt;
&lt;/span&gt;   ...
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; DiffResult diff(Person obj) {
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DiffBuilder(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;, obj, ToStringStyle.SHORT_PREFIX_STYLE)
       .append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;name&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.name, obj.name)
       .append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;address&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.address.diff(obj.address))
       .build();
   }
 }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, the signature of the method was recently changed to:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; DiffBuilder&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fieldName, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; DiffResult&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; diffResult)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;As a consequence, the example code won&apos;t compile anymore when using generics because the a &lt;em&gt;DiffBuilder&amp;lt;Person&amp;gt;&lt;/em&gt; will only accept &lt;em&gt;DiffResult&amp;lt;Person&amp;gt;&lt;/em&gt; but not &lt;em&gt;DiffResult&amp;lt;Address&amp;gt;&lt;/em&gt; for its append method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The signature should be:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &amp;lt;O&amp;gt; DiffBuilder&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fieldName, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; DiffResult&amp;lt;O&amp;gt; diffResult)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;or:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; DiffBuilder&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fieldName, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; DiffResult&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; diffResult)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;instead.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13377154">LANG-1657</key>
            <summary>DiffBuilder: Type constraint for method append(..., DiffResult) too strict</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1655] Fixed an issue where characters were separated in the NFD system</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1655</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;String origin =&#160;&quot;&#51082;&#51648;&#47560; &#45324; &#55120;&#47536; &#50612;&#46176;&#49324;&#51060; &#50812;&#49552;&#51004;&#47196; &#44536;&#47536; &#48324; &#54616;&#45208;&quot;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;String.stripAccents(origin)&lt;/b&gt; is expected to return &lt;b&gt;origin&lt;/b&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;but it returns this.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;&#12615;&#12643;&#12616;&#12616;&#12643;&#12609;&#12623; &#12596;&#12627;&#12596; &#12622;&#12641;&#12601;&#12643;&#12596; &#12615;&#12627;&#12599;&#12636;&#12609; &#12613;&#12623;&#12615;&#12643; &#12615;&#12631;&#12643;&#12596;&#12613;&#12631;&#12596;&#12615;&#12641;&#12601;&#12631; &#12593;&#12641;&#12601;&#12643;&#12596; &#12610;&#12629;&#12601; &#12622;&#12623; &#12596;&#12623;&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The above string is a separate consonant and vowel of korean.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This issue happens on NFD systems. (linux, windows)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13370131">LANG-1655</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1654] isAnyBlank method of StringUtils doesn&apos;t do null check</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1654</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;my string-a is null. i tried calling StringUtis.isNoneBlank(a) method which gives true when string a is null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;i debugged it and found that isNoneBlank() in turn calls isAnyBlank() method which gives false when the string a is null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;image-wrap&quot; style=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13023239/13023239_image-2021-03-31-17-15-47-453.png&quot; style=&quot;border: 0px solid black&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and in&#160;isNoneBlank() method ,it returns ! isAnyBlank(css) so it gives me true where it should give false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We have used&#160;commonsLangVersion = &apos;2.6&apos; version in gradle and the package imported is&#160;org.apache.commons.lang3&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;image-wrap&quot; style=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13023236/13023236_image-2021-03-31-16-51-10-002.png&quot; style=&quot;border: 0px solid black&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Let me know in case of any query.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13368856">LANG-1654</key>
            <summary>isAnyBlank method of StringUtils doesn&apos;t do null check</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>

                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 31 Mar 2021 11:23:14 +0000</created>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17314672" author="suchait24" created="Mon, 5 Apr 2021 05:19:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have tried using 3.12 latest version of library doesn&apos;t seems to be an issue in it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;you still think this is an issue ?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17314673" author="zmpathak" created="Mon, 5 Apr 2021 05:24:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=suchait24&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;suchait24&quot;&gt;Suchait Gaurav&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Well I&apos;m not sure for 3.12 version . In my project, we use version 2.6 which causes the issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1653] API visibility issues: Internal types are exposed in public API</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1653</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There are a few cases where public classes expose internal &lt;tt&gt;private&lt;/tt&gt; types. These internal types prevent usage of the methods or fields exposing them.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Affected:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.lang3.ThreadUtils&lt;/tt&gt;: Exposes private type &lt;tt&gt;AlwaysTruePredicate&lt;/tt&gt; through field &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/d1e9e598c9bcbf91afa174fa9b6c2ef30bbc8157/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/ThreadUtils.java#L148&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;ALWAYS_TRUE_PREDICATE&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
The field should probably instead have the type &lt;tt&gt;ThreadPredicate&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDatePrinter&lt;/tt&gt;: The following protected methods expose private types:
	&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/d1e9e598c9bcbf91afa174fa9b6c2ef30bbc8157/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDatePrinter.java#L385&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;selectNumberRule&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Exposes private &lt;tt&gt;NumberRule&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/d1e9e598c9bcbf91afa174fa9b6c2ef30bbc8157/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDatePrinter.java#L185&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;parsePattern&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Exposes private &lt;tt&gt;Rule&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13368395">LANG-1653</key>
            <summary>API visibility issues: Internal types are exposed in public API</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1650] Release notes link is broken</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1650</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The link to &quot;relase notes&quot; on the module page at &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/&lt;/a&gt; is broken. It points at &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/release-notes/RELEASE-NOTES-3.12.txt&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/release-notes/RELEASE-NOTES-3.12.txt&lt;/a&gt; but such file does not exist.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13366066">LANG-1650</key>
            <summary>Release notes link is broken</summary>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1648] MethodUtils.getAnnotation fails with &quot;Found multiple candidates for method ...&quot;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1648</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I will use jackson &lt;tt&gt;ObjectMapper&lt;/tt&gt; as an example, but this will happen on any class with multiple &quot;candidates&quot; methods (no exact matches)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;

Method method = ObjectMapper.&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class.&lt;/span&gt;getDeclaredMethod(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;writeTree&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;?&amp;gt;[] {JsonGenerator.class, JsonNode.class});
MethodUtils.getAnnotation(method, NonNull.class, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;will fail with&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Exception in thread &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;main&quot;&lt;/span&gt; java.lang.IllegalStateException: Found multiple candidates &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; method writeTree(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode) on &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;com.fasterxml.jackson.core.ObjectCodec : [&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;abstract&lt;/span&gt; void com.fasterxml.jackson.core.ObjectCodec.writeTree(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator,com.fasterxml.jackson.core.TreeNode) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;abstract&lt;/span&gt; void com.fasterxml.jackson.core.TreeCodec.writeTree(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator,com.fasterxml.jackson.core.TreeNode) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException,com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException]Exception in thread &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;main&quot;&lt;/span&gt; java.lang.IllegalStateException: Found multiple candidates &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; method writeTree(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode) on &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;com.fasterxml.jackson.core.ObjectCodec : [&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;abstract&lt;/span&gt; void com.fasterxml.jackson.core.ObjectCodec.writeTree(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator,com.fasterxml.jackson.core.TreeNode) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;abstract&lt;/span&gt; void com.fasterxml.jackson.core.TreeCodec.writeTree(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator,com.fasterxml.jackson.core.TreeNode) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException,com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException] 
    at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.MethodUtils.getMatchingMethod(MethodUtils.java:784) 
    at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.MethodUtils.getAnnotation(MethodUtils.java:988)
    ...&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The problem is that &lt;tt&gt;getAnnotation()&lt;/tt&gt; is using &lt;tt&gt;getMatchingMethod()&lt;/tt&gt; to search for any overriden method in the superclasses&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;getMatchingMethod()&lt;/tt&gt; will not return overriden methods in superclass, but any similar method: same name and with &lt;tt&gt;isAssignable()&lt;/tt&gt; parameters.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;getMatchingMethod()&lt;/tt&gt; in itself is correct, even if a &lt;tt&gt;getMatchingMethod*s*()&lt;/tt&gt; that could return multiple matchng methods might be usefull&lt;br/&gt;
 but &lt;tt&gt;getAnnotation()&lt;/tt&gt; should not use it, instead it should simply use&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
acls.getDeclaredMethod(method.getName(), method.getParameterTypes())
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;or &lt;tt&gt;getMethod()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 because it is only interested in overridden methods (same name and exactly same parameters)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13363023">LANG-1648</key>
            <summary>MethodUtils.getAnnotation fails with &quot;Found multiple candidates for method ...&quot;</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="lelmarir">Michele Preti</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 8 Mar 2021 14:13:24 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 8 Mar 2021 14:16:26 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.12.0</version>
                                                    <component>lang.*</component>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>

                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0|z0oewg:</customfieldvalue>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>

    </item>


<item>
            <title>[LANG-1646] NumberUtils fails to create requested type for floating point zero</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1646</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This currently fails:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0F&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0D&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This passes:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0.F&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0.D&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0e0F&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0e0D&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This is due to the incorrect extraction of the mantissa for a floating point value when there is no exponent or decimal place as it includes the trailing format specifier (F or D). The input string is then not detected as being all zeros and the returned type is BigDecimal.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13362588">LANG-1646</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils fails to create requested type for floating point zero</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="aherbert">Alex Herbert</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="aherbert">Alex Herbert</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 5 Mar 2021 12:36:08 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 5 Mar 2021 16:13:31 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 5 Mar 2021 16:13:31 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.12.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.12.1</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.math.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17296058" author="alexherbert" created="Fri, 5 Mar 2021 14:42:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Upon further investigation recognition of zero uses the value of the exponent. This does not matter if the magnitude is zero.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This passes:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        assertEquals(0.0, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.parseDouble(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0.0e-2000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertTrue(NumberUtils.isCreatable(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0.0e-2000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;These all fail:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0.0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0.0e-2000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0.0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0.0e-2000F&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.valueOf(0.0), NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0.0e-2000D&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;So method must check the magnitude is zero but ignore the exponent. This will allow it to return a number when isCreatable returns true.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17296141" author="alexherbert" created="Fri, 5 Mar 2021 16:13:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In master&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Commit ID:&#160;a2b2b35ac3b969686c647e57f5ca3bacc63f2c56&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1645] NumberUtils.createNumber/createBigInteger fails on hexidecimal integers prefixed with +</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1645</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Java Language Specification allows an optional sign prefix for a number as + or -.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A + sign before a hex integer is not recognised by createNumber and createBigInteger but is recognised by isCreatable, createInteger and createLong. The two later functions delegate to Java&apos;s decode() function that handles an optional leading +.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following demonstrates the tests that fail but would pass if the leading &apos;+&apos; is removed.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    @Test
    void testCreatePositiveHexInteger() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Hex is only supported &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; integers so no test &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; hex floating point formats
&lt;/span&gt;        assertTrue(NumberUtils.isCreatable(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertTrue(NumberUtils.isCreatable(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertTrue(NumberUtils.isCreatable(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));

        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.decode(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), NumberUtils.createInteger(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;.decode(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), NumberUtils.createLong(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));

        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigInteger(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, 16),
                     NumberUtils.createBigInteger(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
            assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigInteger(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, 16),
                         NumberUtils.createBigInteger(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
            Assertions.fail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;This should be possible but it is not&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (NumberFormatException ex) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// This should not happen
&lt;/span&gt;        }

        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.decode(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;),
                     NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0xF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
            assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.decode(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;),
                         NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
            Assertions.fail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;This should be possible but it is not&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (NumberFormatException ex) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// This should not happen
&lt;/span&gt;        }

        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;.decode(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;),
                     NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0xFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
            assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;.decode(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;),
                         NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
            Assertions.fail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;This should be possible but it is not&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (NumberFormatException ex) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// This should not happen
&lt;/span&gt;        }

        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigInteger(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, 16),
                     NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
            assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigInteger(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, 16),
                         NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
            Assertions.fail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;This should be possible but it is not&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (NumberFormatException ex) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// This should not happen
&lt;/span&gt;        }
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A simple fix is to check for a leading &apos;+&apos; character and advance all processing past this character.&lt;br/&gt;
 &#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13362326">LANG-1645</key>

                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="aherbert">Alex Herbert</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="aherbert">Alex Herbert</reporter>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1642] NumberUtils.isCreatable failed to check weather a string is number</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1642</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When checks the string is a valid number by using &lt;b&gt;NumberUtils.isCreatable&lt;/b&gt; it is returning false.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13355411">LANG-1642</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils.isCreatable failed to check weather a string is number</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Segikwiye">Jean-Pierre</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 29 Jan 2021 10:33:29 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 29 Jan 2021 23:27:57 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 29 Jan 2021 23:27:50 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.9</version>
                                                    <component>lang.math.*</component>
                        <due></due>

                            <comment id="17275422" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 29 Jan 2021 23:27:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Numbers with leading zeros are treated as octal.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12314020" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummary">
                        <customfieldname>Development</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12312720" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea">
                        <customfieldname>Docs Text</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>You can find an example here:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;String value =&amp;quot;000298&amp;quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;String value2 =&amp;quot;0003000&amp;quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;assertThat( NumberUtils.isCreatable(value)).isTrue(); =&amp;gt;false&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;assertThat( NumberUtils.isCreatable(value2)).isTrue(); =&amp;gt; true</customfieldvalue>

                        </customfieldvalues>

                        <customfieldname>Last public comment date</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            20 weeks, 4 days ago
                        </customfieldvalues>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1641] Over Stack Issue</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1641</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; is the demo
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;package&lt;/span&gt; com.wcs233;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.util.Date;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.util.TimeZone;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateFormatUtils;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastTimeZone;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;GmtTimeZoneIssue {

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; timeZoneString = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;GMT+7:00&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; ISO8601_DATE_FORMAT = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ssZZ&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; i = 0; i &amp;lt; 100; i++) {
            Date date = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Date();

            TimeZone timeZone = FastTimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneString);

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; dateString = DateFormatUtils.format(date, ISO8601_DATE_FORMAT, timeZone);

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(dateString);
        }
    }
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;when running the code above , there is over stack risk&lt;br/&gt;
1. When invoking FastTimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneString), a new GmtTimeZone will be created&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
GmtTimeZone(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; negate, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; hours, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; minutes) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (hours &amp;gt;= HOURS_PER_DAY) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(hours + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; hours out of range&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (minutes &amp;gt;= MINUTES_PER_HOUR) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(minutes + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; minutes out of range&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; milliseconds = (minutes + (hours * MINUTES_PER_HOUR)) * MILLISECONDS_PER_MINUTE;
        offset = negate ? -milliseconds : milliseconds;
        zoneId = twoDigits(
            twoDigits(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringBuilder(9).append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;GMT&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).append(negate ? &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;-&apos;&lt;/span&gt; : &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;+&apos;&lt;/span&gt;), hours)
                .append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;:&apos;&lt;/span&gt;), minutes).toString();

    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;the every GmtTimeZone instance , the zoneIds instance are different , even through the values are the same.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;2. When invoking DateFormatUtils.format(), there is a ConCurrentHashMap in FormatCache with key is MultipartKey. when invoking FormatCache.getInstance(), first get from cInstanceCache, if value is null, putIfAbsent, but because GmtTimeZone instances are different, when invoking GmtTimeZone.equals, the logic is &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; equals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; other) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!(other &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; GmtTimeZone)) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; zoneId == ((GmtTimeZone) other).zoneId;
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;every zoneId address are different so, equals function return false, but actually the zoneId values are the same.&lt;br/&gt;
so FastDateFormat will be put into cInstanceCache in FormatCache again and again, which will increase the capability of the map, and cause over stack risk, also, it will cause application  run much slower.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13354302">LANG-1641</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1638] commons-lang3-3.11 - Date </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1638</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;December 27th to 31st 2020 gets converted into 2021 while trying to use&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;`DateFormatUtils.format` method.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateFormatUtils;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateUtils;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;DateEx {

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;... args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; Exception{

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; startDateStr = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2020-12-31&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;


        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; startDate = DateFormatUtils
                .format(DateUtils.parseDate(startDateStr, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;YYYY-MM-dd&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;YYYY-MM-dd-HH.MM.SS.mmmmmm&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;startDate with Timestamp - &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + startDate);

    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Actual Output -&#160;&#160;2021-12-31-00.12.00.000000&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Expected Output -&#160;2020-12-31-00.12.00.000000&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can someone look into it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Version :-&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Java -&amp;gt;&#160;1.8.0_212-b10&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Common-lang3 -&amp;gt; 3.11&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Production&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13348983">LANG-1638</key>
            <summary>commons-lang3-3.11 - Date </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/reopened.png" description="This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.">Reopened</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="shailenda.soni">Shailendra Soni</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 4 Jan 2021 18:08:19 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 5 Jan 2021 11:49:07 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.11</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17258424" author="michael-o" created="Mon, 4 Jan 2021 18:55:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Are you aware of this? There is subtile notion between &lt;tt&gt;y&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;Y&lt;/tt&gt;. Lowercase denotes the current year while the latter denotes the week year, must can be previous on next one based on the ISO calender for week years.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17258431" author="shailenda.soni" created="Mon, 4 Jan 2021 19:00:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=michael-o&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;michael-o&quot;&gt;Michael Osipov&lt;/a&gt;&#160;Thanks for update. I did not know about it. One more learning curve.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17258495" author="michael-o" created="Mon, 4 Jan 2021 21:05:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;OK, found the bug:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;case&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;y&apos;&lt;/span&gt;:
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;case&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;Y&apos;&lt;/span&gt;:
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; width&amp;gt;2 ?LITERAL_YEAR_STRATEGY :ABBREVIATED_YEAR_STRATEGY;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It basically assumes that they are the same, but they are not: &lt;tt&gt;private static final Strategy LITERAL_YEAR_STRATEGY = new NumberStrategy(Calendar.YEAR);&lt;/tt&gt;. There is no calendar field for week year since it is a calculated value in the &lt;tt&gt;GregorianCalendar&lt;/tt&gt;: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk8u/blob/a1d853a5d797f38f7be8c260f4a83c1b3fe48adc/jdk/src/share/classes/java/util/GregorianCalendar.java#L2073-L2152&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk8u/blob/a1d853a5d797f38f7be8c260f4a83c1b3fe48adc/jdk/src/share/classes/java/util/GregorianCalendar.java#L2073-L2152&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17258535" author="shailenda.soni" created="Mon, 4 Jan 2021 22:03:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So I have tested with Lowercase and it gives me expected result.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Output with Lowercase &lt;em&gt;y&lt;/em&gt; -&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
2020-12-31-00.12.00.000000&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;It looks good to me.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17258850" author="michael-o" created="Tue, 5 Jan 2021 11:49:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;You have made a typo, but I believe you have uncovered a bug here.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1637] FastDatePrinter formatting using YY pattern yields junk digits</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1637</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; GregorianCalendar cal = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; GregorianCalendar(2020, 12, 31, 0, 0, 0);  
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; DatePrinter printer2Digits = getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;YY&quot;&lt;/span&gt;); 
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;21&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, printer2Digits.format(cal));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;the above test fails&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13348612">LANG-1637</key>
            <summary>FastDatePrinter formatting using YY pattern yields junk digits</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

                            <comment id="17257064" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 31 Dec 2020 17:42:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ugonen&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ugonen&quot;&gt;Uri Gonen&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="17257066" author="ugonen" created="Thu, 31 Dec 2020 17:49:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt; done. &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;  &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/688&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/688&lt;/a&gt; &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257125" author="michael-o" created="Fri, 1 Jan 2021 01:24:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This ticket is invalid, read last paragraph of &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDateFormat.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDateFormat.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257133" author="garydgregory" created="Fri, 1 Jan 2021 02:42:15 +0000"  >&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;Javadoc cites for the year pattern:&#160;&lt;em&gt;For formatting, if the number of pattern letters is 2, the year is truncated to 2 digits; otherwise it is interpreted as a number.&lt;/em&gt;&#160;Starting with Java 1.7 a pattern of &apos;Y&apos; or &apos;YYY&apos; will be formatted as &apos;2003&apos;, while it was &apos;03&apos; in former Java versions. FastDateFormat implements the behavior of Java 7.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257351" author="ugonen" created="Sat, 2 Jan 2021 12:26:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=michael-o&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;michael-o&quot;&gt;Michael Osipov&lt;/a&gt; not sure why you closed this ticket. I stated that the the test above fails, i.e., the year is &lt;b&gt;not&lt;/b&gt;&#160;truncated to 2 digits &lt;b&gt;properly&lt;/b&gt; as stated in the javaoc. formatting date with year 31 Dec 2020 with pattern YY should result in&#160;&apos;21&apos; but instead&#160;you get &apos;&#250;1&apos;&#160;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257356" author="michael-o" created="Sat, 2 Jan 2021 12:44:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We didn&apos;t close anything yet. We indicated that any amount of &lt;tt&gt;Y&lt;/tt&gt; will give you four digits. Why on &lt;tt&gt;hu_HU&lt;/tt&gt; you get this result one needs to investigate.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257362" author="ugonen" created="Sat, 2 Jan 2021 13:06:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/688&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/688&lt;/a&gt;&#160;was closed based on this JIRA, not sure why&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;what do you mean by &quot;hu_HU&quot; ?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257609" author="michael-o" created="Sat, 2 Jan 2021 23:36:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am going thorugh this now.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257612" author="michael-o" created="Sat, 2 Jan 2021 23:45:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I can confirm that there is indeed a bug. Looking into...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257618" author="michael-o" created="Sun, 3 Jan 2021 00:26:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;OK, this was a misunderstanding. Sorry for that. Here is the problem: &lt;tt&gt;Y&lt;/tt&gt; denotes the ISO week year, not necessary the current year. &lt;tt&gt;TwoDigitYearField.INSTANCE&lt;/tt&gt; is passed to to &lt;tt&gt;WeekYear&lt;/tt&gt; ctor. It calls the former rule with &lt;tt&gt;calendar.getWeekYear()&lt;/tt&gt;.  The problem is that &lt;tt&gt;TwoDigitYearField#appendTo(Appendable, int)&lt;/tt&gt; expects a value between 0 and 99 because it uses &lt;tt&gt;#appendDigits()&lt;/tt&gt; which operates on two-digit numbers only. Everything else is undefined. Since it is an internal method it expects the input to be always valid.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257625" author="michael-o" created="Sun, 3 Jan 2021 01:02:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Here is a possible patch:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;$ git diff
diff --git a/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDatePrinter.java b/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDatePrinter.java
index 658e3cacb..2bbd7e22b 100644
--- a/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDatePrinter.java
+++ b/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDatePrinter.java
@@ -1293,7 +1293,7 @@ public int estimateLength() {

@Override
 public void appendTo(final Appendable buffer, final Calendar calendar) throws IOException {
- mRule.appendTo(buffer, calendar.getWeekYear());
+ mRule.appendTo(buffer, (estimateLength() == 2 ? calendar.getWeekYear() % 100 : calendar.getWeekYear() ));
 }

@Override
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257626" author="michael-o" created="Sun, 3 Jan 2021 01:04:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;WeekYear&lt;/tt&gt; assumes that the wrapped rule handles years only.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257774" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 3 Jan 2021 14:15:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Your comments in&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1637?focusedCommentId=17257618&amp;amp;page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17257618&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1637?focusedCommentId=17257618&amp;amp;page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17257618&lt;/a&gt; are very helpful especially regarding what method expects valid input. May you also update the Javadoc?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17257781" author="ugonen" created="Sun, 3 Jan 2021 14:54:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=michael-o&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;michael-o&quot;&gt;Michael Osipov&lt;/a&gt;&#160;what are the advantages of your proposal? what is the point of&#160;TwoDigitYearField class other than to take a year(from either calendar or integer) and make a 2 digit year string out of it?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17258570" author="michael-o" created="Mon, 4 Jan 2021 22:57:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ugonen&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ugonen&quot;&gt;Uri Gonen&lt;/a&gt;, when we put my proposal aside there are two ways to solve it: (a) Take your proposal or reject any value &amp;gt;= 100 because the rule knows that it uses &lt;tt&gt;appendsDigits()&lt;/tt&gt; and the contract requires the value to be as such. The estimated length says 2, but one passes &amp;gt;2.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17260058" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 6 Jan 2021 20:58:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ugonen&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ugonen&quot;&gt;Uri Gonen&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In git master, please verify and close this ticket.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;TY!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17260516" author="ugonen" created="Thu, 7 Jan 2021 14:01:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;verified.&#160; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=michael-o&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;michael-o&quot;&gt;Michael Osipov&lt;/a&gt;&#160;thank you for your feedback and responsiveness&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1631] Add short circuits in CharSequenceUtils if a character is not defined</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1631</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Crash when the&#160;the char to be searched value it&apos;s out of range &amp;gt;= &#160;&apos;\u0000&apos; &amp;lt;=&#160;&apos;\uFFFF&apos;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;Getting the next error --&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Not a valid Unicode code point: 0xFFFFF936&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Basically the problem is that when it is verified that the character to search is less than MIN_SUPPLEMENTARY_CODE_POINT, the search is not exited of the loop. It continues searching but this time values less than or equal to Character.MAX_CODE_POINT&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1630] NPE lowerCase and upperCase when locale is null </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1630</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When the parameter Local is null where are getting NPE in the following method:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;upperCase&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;lowerCase&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;




&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Add control&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (locale == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) { 
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Locale must not be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;); 
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13347300">LANG-1630</key>
            <summary>NPE lowerCase and upperCase when locale is null </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="arturobernalg">Arturo Bernal</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 22 Dec 2020 08:19:44 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 22 Dec 2020 16:16:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 22 Dec 2020 08:36:17 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="1200">20m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17253497" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 22 Dec 2020 13:30:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This was implemented differently FYI.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1629] DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod is infinite repetition when parameter is negative number</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1629</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;if parameter number(&lt;b&gt;startMillis&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;endMillis&lt;/b&gt;) is negative number then below while loop is infinite repetition. (278 line ~)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; formatPeriod(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; startMillis, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; endMillis, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; format, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; padWithZeros,
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; TimeZone timezone) {
    Validate.isTrue(startMillis &amp;lt;= endMillis, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;startMillis must not be greater than endMillis&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);


    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Used to optimise &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; differences under 28 days and
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// called formatDuration(millis, format); however &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; did not work
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// over leap years.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// TODO: Compare performance to see &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; anything was lost by
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// losing &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; optimisation.
&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Token[] tokens = lexx(format); 
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// ...
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (start.get(Calendar.YEAR) != target) {
    days += start.getActualMaximum(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR) - start.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR);

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Not sure I grok why &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; is needed, but the brutal tests show it is
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (start &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; GregorianCalendar &amp;amp;&amp;amp;
            start.get(Calendar.MONTH) == Calendar.FEBRUARY &amp;amp;&amp;amp;
            start.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) == 29) {
        days += 1;
    }

    start.add(Calendar.YEAR, 1);

    days += start.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR);
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;How about putting in a validation to determine whether it&apos;s negative or positive?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;thank you &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

                            <comment id="17252155" author="kinow" created="Sat, 19 Dec 2020 10:25:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=helloJuhyun&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;helloJuhyun&quot;&gt;LeeJuHyun&lt;/a&gt; ,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Would you be able to provide a code snippet to reproduce the issue? I tried with `DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod(-1, 1, &quot;&quot;, true, TimeZone.getDefault());` and `DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod(-1, -1, &quot;&quot;, true, TimeZone.getDefault());` using the code on `master`, but I couldn&apos;t reproduce the issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt;How about putting in a validation to determine whether it&apos;s negative or positive?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If someone is able to reproduce your issue (preferably with a unit test, to add to DurationFormatUtilsTest.java), then I think we should validate it to prevent infinite-loops.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And in case you are interested on working on this feature, feel free to submit a pull request &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
