&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I used &lt;b&gt;formatPeriod&lt;/b&gt; method that has a &lt;b&gt;3 parameters&lt;/b&gt;(250 line in DurationFormatUtils class)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; formatPeriod(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; startMillis, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; endMillis, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; format) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; formatPeriod(startMillis, endMillis, format, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, TimeZone.getDefault());
    } &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and my code snippet is like that ..&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; startDate = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;20201219&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; startTime = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;203000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; endDate = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;00000000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; endTime = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;000000&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; stime = MyClass.toBaseDate(startDate, startTime).getTime(); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// 1608377400000
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; etime = MyClass.toBaseDate(endDate, endTime).getTime();     &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// -62170189200000
&lt;/span&gt;
DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod(stime, etime, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;HH:mm:ss&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;/* This is my Project code */&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; Date toBaseDate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; yyyymmdd, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; hhmmss) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; toBasicDate(yyyymmdd, hhmmss, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyyMMdd HHmmss&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    }
    
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; Date toBaseDate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; yyyymmdd, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; hhmmss, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; format) {
        Date date = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Date();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt;(!StringUtil.isEmpty(yyyymmdd)) {
            DateFormat df = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; SimpleDateFormat(format);
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
                date = df.parse(yyyymmdd + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + hhmmss);
            } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt;(ParseException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; date;    
} &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;== result ==&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;stime = 1608377400000&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;etime =&#160;-62170189200000&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if stime is 1608377400000, then an error(infinite-loops) occurs regardless of whether etime is 1 or -1.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m using&#160;&lt;b&gt;DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod&lt;/b&gt; in my project.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;stime&lt;/b&gt; and &lt;b&gt;etime&lt;/b&gt;&#160;can be obtained from &lt;b&gt;toBaseDate&lt;/b&gt; method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;usually startDate, startTime, endDate, endTime is formatting data.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(*Date = yyyyMMdd, *Time = HHmmss , not zero)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;but last week, the formatting data is wrong.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(endDate = &quot;00000000&quot;, endTime = &quot;000000&quot;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;so,&#160;&lt;b&gt;DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod&lt;/b&gt; method has become an infinite-loops.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I modified my code to solve this problem, but ultimately, the infinite-loops occurring in &lt;b&gt;DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod&lt;/b&gt; could not be solved.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m trying to solve this problem, but as a junior developer, the code is difficult for me.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you very much &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="17252264" author="kinow" created="Sat, 19 Dec 2020 20:36:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the detailed response &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=helloJuhyun&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;helloJuhyun&quot;&gt;LeeJuHyun&lt;/a&gt; . See &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=aviprogrammer&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;aviprogrammer&quot;&gt;Avijit Chakraborty&lt;/a&gt; &apos;s reply above. I am still not able to reproduce the issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We want to confirm there&apos;s nothing wrong with `DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod`, so I think we can remove your project code to create a really minimalistic way to reproduce the issue, if I understand your example right.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt;if stime is 1608377400000, then an error(infinite-loops) occurs regardless of whether etime is 1 or -1.&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt;I&apos;m using DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod in my project.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s what I am using, and I suspect &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=aviprogrammer&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;aviprogrammer&quot;&gt;Avijit Chakraborty&lt;/a&gt; is trying something similar.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testLang1629NegativeValues() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; stime = 1608377400000l;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; etime = -62170189200000l;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; formattedPeriod = DurationFormatUtils.formatPeriod(stime, etime, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;HH:mm:ss&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        assertNotNull(formattedPeriod);
    } &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tried that unit test, but if fails with the validation before any loop takes place.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tried with values -1 and 1 for etime, but it didn&apos;t help.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt;I&apos;m trying to solve this problem, but as a junior developer, the code is difficult for me.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That&apos;s all right. Slowly code like this should get easier for you. When reporting issues to projects (open source, or internally for $work), reporting&lt;br/&gt;
a detailed explanation is always helpful &#8212; as you did here. But it is equally important to make sure the developers are able to reproduce the issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Try the unit test above. Change the values to represent the parameter values that you think will trigger the loop. If you find a set of parameters, you can&lt;br/&gt;
share the values and we should be able to reproduce your issue. Please, try to avoid your project code if possible, this way we know that the issue is really&lt;br/&gt;
in Apache Commons Lang.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you are not able to get the issue to happen with this test case, it is very likely the problem lies elsewhere in your code base. In that case,&lt;br/&gt;
you may want to sit with someone else that works on that project to code-review or rubber-duck-debug it. A debugger might help you identify what&lt;br/&gt;
is going on too.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Good luck, and keep us posted. If you are not able to reproduce it we should close the issue, but you are free to tell us later if you realize what was&lt;br/&gt;
happening.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Cheers&lt;br/&gt;
Bruno&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17252594" author="hellojuhyun" created="Mon, 21 Dec 2020 03:45:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi! &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=kinow&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;kinow&quot;&gt;Bruno P. <item>
            <title>[LANG-1628] Javadoc for RandomStringUtils.random() letters, numbers parameters is wrong</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1628</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;For two of the random() methods, these:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public static String random(int&#160;count, int&#160;start, int&#160;end, boolean&#160;letters, boolean&#160;numbers, char...&#160;chars)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public static String random(int&#160;count, int&#160;start, int&#160;end, boolean&#160;letters, boolean&#160;numbers, char[]&#160;chars, Random random)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;the javadoc for letters, numbers parameters is&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;letters&lt;/tt&gt; - only allow letters?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;numbers&lt;/tt&gt; - only allow numbers?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;when it should be like in other random() methods:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;letters&lt;/tt&gt; - if &lt;tt&gt;true&lt;/tt&gt;, generated string may include alphabetic characters&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;numbers&lt;/tt&gt; - if &lt;tt&gt;true&lt;/tt&gt;, generated string may include numeric characters&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13346542">LANG-1628</key>
            <summary>Javadoc for RandomStringUtils.random() letters, numbers parameters is wrong</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1627] BooleanUtils.xor not behaving as expected with any odd number of true&apos;s</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1627</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I was expecting a xor function that takes a variable number of arguments to &lt;b&gt;return true if and only if exactly one among all of the arguments is true&lt;/b&gt;, regardless of the number of arguments.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This holds true given three false&apos;s:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void threeFalse() {
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt;[] bools = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt;[]{&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.FALSE, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.FALSE, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.FALSE};
 assertFalse(BooleanUtils.xor(bools));
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
 It also holds true given 4 true&apos;s, as well as for any even number of trues.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void fourTrue() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt;[] bools = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt;[]{&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.TRUE, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.TRUE, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.TRUE, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.TRUE};
        assertFalse(BooleanUtils.xor(bools));
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The above tests pass.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But with any odd number of true&apos;s that doesn&apos;t hold anymore:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void threeTrue() {
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt;[] bools = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt;[]{&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.TRUE, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.TRUE, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;.TRUE};
 assertFalse(BooleanUtils.xor(bools));
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This test fails.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That was totally unexpected to me.&lt;br/&gt;
 But as it turns out, even&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;true ^ true ^ true&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;evaluates to true. That was unexpected too to me, at a first sight.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The thing is that xor (I mean the original boolean operator) is a binary operator, so if you want to make it n-ary, one simple solution is to apply it in two by two: ((a ^ b) ^ c) ^ d&lt;br/&gt;
 And that&apos;s what is done in the implementation of the method BooleanUtils#xor.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But that brings to BooleanUtils.xor(true, true, true) == true, and at the same time BooleanUtils.xor(true, true, true, true) == false, which just doesn&apos;t sound right to me.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Whether or not you agree with me that that is a bug of the method, please at least update the Javadoc, because right now it is not providing the user enough information. Look:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Performs an xor on a set of booleans.
         BooleanUtils.xor(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;)   = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;
         BooleanUtils.xor(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;) = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;
         BooleanUtils.xor(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;)  = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Cheers&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13346456">LANG-1627</key>
            <summary>BooleanUtils.xor not behaving as expected with any odd number of true&apos;s</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="alb-i986">Alberto Scotto</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 16 Dec 2020 23:18:21 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 29 Dec 2020 19:33:30 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.11</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17252209" author="aviprogrammer" created="Sat, 19 Dec 2020 16:05:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=alb-i986&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;alb-i986&quot;&gt;Alberto Scotto&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I had a look into the code of BooleanUtils#xor() methods and at first glance, the implementations looked correct to me.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When Exclusive OR is applied to 2 inputs then the output becomes true when only one of the inputs is true.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The definition of multi-input exclusive OR gates says that the final output&#160;is a 1 when the number of 1s at its inputs is odd, and a 0 when the number of incoming 1s is even. I referred to &lt;a href=&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XOR_gate#More_than_two_inputs&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XOR_gate#More_than_two_inputs&lt;/a&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So, going by this definition (true ^ true ^ true) = true sounds good.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Although I agree with you that the Javadoc of these 2 methods can be improved by including the fact that output will be true if the number of incoming trues are odd.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17256142" author="alb-i986" created="Tue, 29 Dec 2020 19:33:30 +0000"  >&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XOR_gate#More_than_two_inputs&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XOR_gate#More_than_two_inputs&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Interesting! So there exists one such boolean function which works as I expect.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BTW, my use case is the following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have a web service which accepts a request with a number of fields, say 3, with the constraint that exactly one among the 3 fields must be not null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think it&apos;s a pretty common scenario,&#160;so it would make sense to add this other semantic of xor to BooleanUtils. We may call it xorOneHot. I would be keen on keeping &quot;xor&quot; in the name so that users can find it when using autocompletion and are looking for &quot;xor&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m working on an implementation already. Just shout if you&apos;d like me to submit a PR.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1615] ArrayUtils contains() and indexOf()  fails to handle Float.NaN</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1615</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The ArrayUtils.contains (float [], Float.NaN) and ArrayUtils.indexOf (float [], Float.NaN) methods do not handle correctly when the array contains Float.NaN. It should return that finds the element, but instead returns -1.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;For example, consider the following:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testContainsFloatNaN() {
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;float&lt;/span&gt;[] a = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;float&lt;/span&gt;[] { &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NEGATIVE_INFINITY, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NaN, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.POSITIVE_INFINITY };
 assertTrue(ArrayUtils.contains(a, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.POSITIVE_INFINITY));
 assertTrue(ArrayUtils.contains(a, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NEGATIVE_INFINITY));
 assertTrue(ArrayUtils.contains(a, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NaN)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Error
&lt;/span&gt;}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And&#160;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testIndexOfFloatNaN() {
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;float&lt;/span&gt;[] array = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;float&lt;/span&gt;[] { &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NEGATIVE_INFINITY, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NaN,       &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.POSITIVE_INFINITY, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NaN }; 
 assertEquals(0, ArrayUtils.indexOf(array, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NEGATIVE_INFINITY));
 assertEquals(1, ArrayUtils.indexOf(array, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.NaN)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Error
&lt;/span&gt; assertEquals(2, ArrayUtils.indexOf(array, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.POSITIVE_INFINITY));
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13340685">LANG-1615</key>
            <summary>ArrayUtils contains() and indexOf()  fails to handle Float.NaN</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1613] BigDecimal is created when you pass it the min or max values of Double</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1613</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I was doing tests and I have found that if you try to create a number using NumberUtils.createNumber and pass it the minimum possible value of a Double and concatenating &quot;D&quot; it returns a decimal&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
assertTrue(NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;4.9e-324D&quot;&lt;/span&gt;) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;); assertTrue(NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;4.9e-324F&quot;&lt;/span&gt;) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1612] testGetAllFields and testGetFieldsWithAnnotation sometimes fail</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1612</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The&#160;testGetAllFields() and&#160;testGetFieldsWithAnnotation() functions in FieldUtilsTest are flaky because they contain assertArraysEquals() on two arrays that may not be exactly equal. The arrays are guaranteed to contain the exact same elements, but the elements may be ordered differently, causing the assertion to sometimes fail.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;More specifically,&#160;FieldUtils.getAllFields() does not necessarily return an array in the order that the current tests assume.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Github PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/640&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/640&lt;/a&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13339389">LANG-1612</key>
            <summary>testGetAllFields and testGetFieldsWithAnnotation sometimes fail</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="xint5">XinT</reporter>

                            <label>pull-request-available</label>
                            <label>test</label>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1610] StringUtils.unwrap throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1610</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Calling&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.unwrap(&quot;ababa&quot;, &quot;aba&quot;);&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;throws java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13337739">LANG-1610</key>
            <summary>StringUtils.unwrap throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tonyliang">Tony Liang</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 28 Oct 2020 20:25:15 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 17 Nov 2020 20:14:43 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 17 Nov 2020 20:14:43 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>3.12.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1608] Tests are not executed</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1608</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;After an upgrading &lt;b&gt;junit-jupiter&lt;/b&gt; from 5.6.2 to 5.7.0 the surefire plugin cannot execute tests.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The reason is that&#160;&lt;b&gt;org.junit-pioneer:junit-pioneer:0.9.2&lt;/b&gt;&#160;transitively pulls incompatible version of&#160;&lt;b&gt;org.junit.platform:junit-platform-commons:1.7.0&lt;/b&gt;. Here is a &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/junit-pioneer/junit-pioneer/issues/343&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;link&lt;/a&gt; to the issues.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also here are the notes on &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/junit-pioneer/junit-pioneer#dependencies&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Dependencies&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
 &#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13335868">LANG-1608</key>
            <summary>Tests are not executed</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>

                            <comment id="17215878" author="alexherbert" created="Sat, 17 Oct 2020 12:30:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is fixed locally by using the JUnit bom to ensure all JUnit dependencies are compatible:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;  &amp;lt;dependencyManagement&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;dependencies&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;dependency&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;groupId&amp;gt;org.junit&amp;lt;/groupId&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;artifactId&amp;gt;junit-bom&amp;lt;/artifactId&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;version&amp;gt;5.7.0&amp;lt;/version&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;type&amp;gt;pom&amp;lt;/type&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;scope&amp;gt;import&amp;lt;/scope&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;/dependency&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;/dependencies&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;/dependencyManagement&amp;gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have create a fork to test if this fix passes the CI checks.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1607] To aid with CVE-2019-16303, consider upgrading RandomStringUtils default RNG</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1607</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16303&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16303&lt;/a&gt;&#160; , the&#160;org.apache.commons.lang3.RandomStringUtils&#160;randomAlphanumeric() function is used to generate random strings.&#160; Because of weaknesses of the default RNG, this allows baddies to predict other randomAlphnumeric() results, which in this large family of client programs, results in severe vulnerabilities.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;While the class is not documented to be &quot;cryptographically safe&quot;, it would be prudent to upgrade the default RNG used in these classes to be crypto-usable level, such as with the java.security.SecureRandom nextBytes().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See e.g. this github PR, which is being replicated THOUSANDS of times, in order to work around this problem in countless users of this library.&#160; &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/elderdb/neptune/pull/1&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/elderdb/neptune/pull/1&lt;/a&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13328301">LANG-1607</key>
            <summary>To aid with CVE-2019-16303, consider upgrading RandomStringUtils default RNG</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="fche">Frank Ch. Eigler</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 18 Sep 2020 19:32:31 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 21 Sep 2020 22:52:09 +0000</updated>
                                                                                <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17198749" author="erans" created="Sat, 19 Sep 2020 14:43:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As the actual bug was fixed, and this is rather a &quot;wish&quot;, I suggest that you post this proposal to the &quot;dev&quot; ML.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17199606" author="jlleitschuh" created="Mon, 21 Sep 2020 19:04:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt; See e.g. this github PR, which is being replicated THOUSANDS of times&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1606] StringUtils.countMatches returns incorrect value while handling intersecting substrings</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1606</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Steps to reproduce:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;1. Call the method like that:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; count = StringUtils.countMatches(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;abaabaababaab&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;aba&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Actual result: the value of count variable equals 3&lt;br/&gt;
 Expected result: the value of count variable equals 4&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The substrings are highlighted in red:&lt;br/&gt;
 &lt;font color=&quot;#ff0000&quot;&gt;aba&lt;/font&gt;abaababaab&lt;br/&gt;
 aba&lt;font color=&quot;#ff0000&quot;&gt;aba&lt;/font&gt;ababaab&lt;br/&gt;
 abaaba&lt;font color=&quot;#ff0000&quot;&gt;aba&lt;/font&gt;baab&lt;br/&gt;
 abaabaab&lt;font color=&quot;#ff0000&quot;&gt;aba&lt;/font&gt;ab&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Method returns incorrect value because of this code:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; ((idx = CharSequenceUtils.indexOf(str, sub, idx)) != INDEX_NOT_FOUND) {
    count++;
    idx += sub.length();
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This looks like a greedy algorithm - but increasing the idx variable by the length of substring could lead to the problems like in example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Let&apos;s say that idx = 6, so we try to find a substring in the highlighted suffix:&lt;br/&gt;
 abaaba&lt;font color=&quot;#ff0000&quot;&gt;ababaab&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We found the substring, so idx now becomes idx + 3 = 9. So now this suffix will be used for searching substring in it:&lt;br/&gt;
 abaabaaba&lt;font color=&quot;#ff0000&quot;&gt;baab&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 But because of increasing the value of idx by 3 we won&apos;t find the substring (abaabaab&lt;font color=&quot;#ff0000&quot;&gt;aba&lt;/font&gt;ab) which intersects with the already found substring on the last step.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Basically, this method will work incorrectly with any substrings that intersect with each other.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is also a unit test with incorrect expected value:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
assertEquals(4,
     StringUtils.countMatches(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;oooooooooooo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;ooo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;If this behavior (counting substrings that do not intersect) is intended, please update the JavaDoc to reflect it. Right now it looks like that:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Counts how many times the substring appears in the larger string.
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Link for the PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/615&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/615&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13325477">LANG-1606</key>
            <summary>StringUtils.countMatches returns incorrect value while handling intersecting substrings</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="GaliFFun">Rustem Galiev</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 1 Sep 2020 08:31:37 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 12 Sep 2020 22:24:16 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 12 Sep 2020 22:24:16 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.11</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.12.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>

                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="2400">40m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17188393" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 1 Sep 2020 12:10:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There are two ways to count matches: overlapping or non-overlapping.&lt;br/&gt;
The code currently correctly counts non-overlapping matches.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I agree that the Javadoc is not clear on this, however I don&apos;t think it is actually wrong&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Given that users may rely on the current behaviour, generally it is the Javadoc that must be changed rather than the code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17194897" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 12 Sep 2020 22:24:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Clarified Javadoc; added more tests to agree with Javadoc&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1600] ToStringBuilder behavior for collections changed with 3.11</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1600</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The fix in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1542&quot; title=&quot;ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString - Wrong JSON format when object has a List/Array of Enum&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1542&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1542&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; (git commit &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/1dddec8ba867bc31233ba194f0753ea35818cbfd&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;1dddec8&lt;/a&gt;) had side effects and did not just affect json styles, but &lt;tt&gt;DEFAULT_STYLE&lt;/tt&gt;, &lt;tt&gt;SHORT_PREFIX_STYLE&lt;/tt&gt;, and possibly others as well.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, collections are now treated differently when empty:&lt;br/&gt;
Square brackets for empty list vs. curly brackets for non-empty lists.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;h3&gt;&lt;a name=&quot;Testcase&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;Test case&lt;/h3&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ToStringBuilder(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;(), ToStringStyle.SHORT_PREFIX_STYLE)
        .append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Collections.emptyList())
        .append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Collections.singleton(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;))
        .append(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Arrays.asList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;))
        .build();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;h3&gt;&lt;a name=&quot;%7B%7BSHORTPREFIXSTYLE%7D%7D&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;tt&gt;SHORT_PREFIX_STYLE&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Result for version 3.11:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-none&quot;&gt;
Object[foo0=[],foo1={1},foo2={1,2}]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Expected (also as-is for 3.10)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-none&quot;&gt;
Object[foo0=[],foo1=[1],foo2=[1, 2]]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;h3&gt;&lt;a name=&quot;%7B%7BDEFAULTSTYLE%7D%7D&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;tt&gt;DEFAULT_STYLE&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Result for version 3.11&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-none&quot;&gt;
java.lang.Object@7960847b[foo0=[],foo1={1},foo2={1,2}]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Expected (also as-is for 3.10)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-none&quot;&gt;
java.lang.Object@7960847b[foo0=[],foo1=[1],foo2=[1, 2]]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-none&quot;&gt;
java -version
openjdk version &quot;1.8.0_242&quot;
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (AdoptOpenJDK)(build 1.8.0_242-b08)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (AdoptOpenJDK)(build 25.242-b08, mixed mode)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;commons-lang3-3.10.jar via maven central&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;commons-lang3-3.11.jar via maven central&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13324174">LANG-1600</key>
            <summary>ToStringBuilder behavior for collections changed with 3.11</summary>

                            <comment id="17182892" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 24 Aug 2020 02:07:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=amphied&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;amphied&quot;&gt;Michael F&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17183568" author="amphied" created="Mon, 24 Aug 2020 19:42:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I propose to restore the handling of collections to its pre-3.11 state.&lt;br/&gt;
I created &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/610&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;pr#610&lt;/a&gt; which pushes the recently-introduced changes for JSON-style down to &lt;tt&gt;JsonToStringStyle&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I added a bunch of test cases to cover non-empty collections, maps, and arrays in various styles.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1597] Invocation fails because matching varargs method found but then discarded</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1597</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;getMatchingAccessibleMethod(Class&amp;lt;?&amp;gt;, String, Class&amp;lt;?&amp;gt;...)&lt;/tt&gt; is able to find proper match for a method to call but then discards it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Consider the situation you have a varargs method like &lt;tt&gt;Baz.foo(X... X)&lt;/tt&gt;. We call &lt;tt&gt;getMatchingAccessibleMethod(Baz.class, &quot;foo&quot;, z&lt;/tt&gt; where &lt;tt&gt;z instance of Z extends Y extends X&lt;/tt&gt;. &lt;tt&gt;getMatchingAccessibleMethod&lt;/tt&gt; finds &lt;tt&gt;foo&lt;/tt&gt; as the candidate, but then discards it because for varargs, it requires either the argument is directly is of type X or that the supertype of the argument X. It does not properly check the entire inheritance hierarchy in this code (3.11):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (bestMatch != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; &amp;amp;&amp;amp; bestMatch.isVarArgs() &amp;amp;&amp;amp; bestMatch.getParameterTypes().length &amp;gt; 0 &amp;amp;&amp;amp; parameterTypes.length &amp;gt; 0) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;?&amp;gt;[] methodParameterTypes = bestMatch.getParameterTypes();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; methodParameterComponentType = methodParameterTypes[methodParameterTypes.length - 1].getComponentType();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; methodParameterComponentTypeName = ClassUtils.primitiveToWrapper(methodParameterComponentType).getName();

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; lastParameterType = parameterTypes[parameterTypes.length - 1];
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; parameterTypeName = (lastParameterType==&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) ? &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; : lastParameterType.getName();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; parameterTypeSuperClassName = (lastParameterType==&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) ? &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; : lastParameterType.getSuperclass().getName();

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (parameterTypeName!= &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; &amp;amp;&amp;amp; parameterTypeSuperClassName != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !methodParameterComponentTypeName.equals(parameterTypeName)
                    &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !methodParameterComponentTypeName.equals(parameterTypeSuperClassName)) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
            }
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13322643">LANG-1597</key>
            <summary>Invocation fails because matching varargs method found but then discarded</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="rec">Richard Eckart de Castilho</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 14 Aug 2020 00:58:54 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 18 Nov 2020 07:02:21 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.11</version>
                                                    <component>lang.reflect.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17234281" author="arturobernalg" created="Wed, 18 Nov 2020 06:02:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=rec&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;rec&quot;&gt;Richard Eckart de Castilho&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Could you provide a test case in order to reproduce and check the issue?&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;regards&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17234309" author="rec" created="Wed, 18 Nov 2020 07:02:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As a quick measure, I can only provide the code where I wanted to rely on the method but had to work around the bug:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; isFeatureStructureValue = FeatureStructure.class
                    .isAssignableFrom(aValue.getClass());
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; isFeatureStructureVarArgValue = aValue.getClass().isArray()
                    &amp;amp;&amp;amp; FeatureStructure.class
                            .isAssignableFrom(aValue.getClass().getComponentType());

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Workaround &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1597
&lt;/span&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (isFeatureStructureValue || isFeatureStructureVarArgValue) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// MethodUtils.invokeStaticMethod has a &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;bug&quot;&lt;/span&gt; that vararg methods are only
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// properly found/matched &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; the parameter value type or the supertype of the
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// parameter value matches the varargs type. So here we have FeatureStructure...
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// as the varargs definition, but we may want to set a value of type Annotation
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// and from Annotation to FeatureStructure is a &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; way through the inheritance
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// hierarchy.
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Note: &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; bug exists at least up to commons-lang3 3.11 - it might be fixed
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// in later versions.
&lt;/span&gt;                MethodUtils.invokeStaticMethod(FSUtil.class, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;setFeature&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,
                        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;[] { aFS, aName, aValue },
                        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;[] { FeatureStructure.class, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;.class,
                                FeatureStructure[].class });
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt;;
            }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>

                        <customfieldname>Date of First Response</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1596] ArrayUtils.toPrimitive(Object) does not support boolean and other types</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1596</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ArrayUtils.toPrimitive(Object) supports only Integer, Long, Short, Double and Float. Boolean, Byte, and Character are not supported.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This causes e.g. also calls to MethodUtils.invokeStaticMethod(...) to fail if e.g. a Boolean array is provided as the argument for a primitive boolean vararg because getVarArgs does expect ArrayUtils to do the right thing:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (varArgComponentType.isPrimitive()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// unbox from wrapper type to primitive type
&lt;/span&gt;            varArgsArray = ArrayUtils.toPrimitive(varArgsArray);
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13322641">LANG-1596</key>
            <summary>ArrayUtils.toPrimitive(Object) does not support boolean and other types</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1592] The random number generated by RandomUtils exceeds the exclusive parameter</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1592</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void test() {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (RandomUtils.nextLong(12900000000001L, 12900000000016L) != 12900000000016L) {

    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;should not be invoked&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;image-wrap&quot; style=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13008058/13008058_image-2020-07-21-14-35-27-870.png&quot; height=&quot;182&quot; width=&quot;315&quot; style=&quot;border: 0px solid black&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13318404">LANG-1592</key>
            <summary>The random number generated by RandomUtils exceeds the exclusive parameter</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="aherbert">Alex Herbert</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pingcai">huang pingcai</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 21 Jul 2020 06:36:28 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 23 Jul 2020 08:20:37 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 23 Jul 2020 08:20:37 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.11</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.12.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="2400">40m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17161822" author="alexherbert" created="Tue, 21 Jul 2020 07:37:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This occurs as the method is using the &lt;tt&gt;nextDouble(double min, double max)&lt;/tt&gt; method then casting back to a &lt;tt&gt;long&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A correct implementation would be to work only with the &lt;tt&gt;long&lt;/tt&gt; datatype:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; nextLong(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; startInclusive, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; endExclusive) {
    Validate.isTrue(endExclusive &amp;gt;= startInclusive,
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Start value must be smaller or equal to end value.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    Validate.isTrue(startInclusive &amp;gt;= 0, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Both range values must be non-negative.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (startInclusive == endExclusive) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; startInclusive;
    }

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; startInclusive + nextLong(endExclusive - startInclusive);
}

/**
 * Create a random &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; in the range 0 inclusive to {@code n} exclusive.
 *
 * @param n the upper limit (exclusive)
 * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; the &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt;
 */
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; nextLong(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; n) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; bits;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; val;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;do&lt;/span&gt; {
        bits = RANDOM.nextLong() &amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; 1;
        val  = bits % n;
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (bits - val + (n - 1) &amp;lt; 0);

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; val;
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17163334" author="alexherbert" created="Thu, 23 Jul 2020 08:20:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In git master&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1544] MethodUtils.invokeMethod NullPointerException in case of null in args list</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1544</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;MethodUtils:774&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if (classArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.equals(toClassArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
 continue;
}
&lt;p&gt; else if (ClassUtils.isAssignable(classArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, toClassArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, true)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;cause NPE if classArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; is null. Can you please extend the if condition with a null check, like this?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if (classArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; != null &amp;amp;&amp;amp; classArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.equals(toClassArray&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;offset&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;))&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13305831">LANG-1544</key>
            <summary>MethodUtils.invokeMethod NullPointerException in case of null in args list</summary>

                            <comment id="17228450" author="arturobernalg" created="Mon, 9 Nov 2020 09:29:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=RobertBudda&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;RobertBudda&quot;&gt;Robert Konior&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have tried to reproduce the error but I can&apos;t.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testMethodABG() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IllegalAccessException, InstantiationException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException, ClassNotFoundException {
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt; c = &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.forName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;org.apache.commons.lang3.builderClass1&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; o = c.newInstance();
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(o);
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; value = (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;) MethodUtils.invokeMethod(o, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;testMethod&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Results from getValue: &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + value);
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Class1 {

 &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; testMethod() {
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;ABG&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
 }

}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17253134" author="mdbuck77" created="Mon, 21 Dec 2020 21:31:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The issue seems to manifest itself when MethodUtils#getMatchingMethod() is called with one or more of the incoming parameterTypes as null and the target class to find the method has more than one method that is a possible candidate. This causes the private distance method to be invoked which causes the NPE.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please see PR &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/680&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17253559" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 22 Dec 2020 15:13:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The description needs a stack trace to make it easier for everyone to match up with exceptions seen in the wild.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17253730" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 22 Dec 2020 20:14:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=nagy_peter&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;nagy_peter&quot;&gt;Peter Nagy&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In git master; please verify and close this ticket.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1543] [JSON string for maps] ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString doesnt render nested maps correctly.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1543</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Nested Maps are not converted correctly as JSON using ToStringBuilder.reflectToString commons-lang3:3.10 . Please find below the example to reproduce:-&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Class:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Student {    
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; name;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; Map&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; education;

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//getters and setters...
&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; toString() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;, ToStringStyle.JSON_STYLE);
    }}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Driver test:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        Student p = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Student();
        p.setName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;como&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        
        Map&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; educationMap = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; HashMap&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;();
        educationMap.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;primary&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;school&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        educationMap.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;graduation&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;B.S.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        
        p.setEducation(educationMap);
        
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(p.toString());
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The toString() prints&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
{&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;education&quot;&lt;/span&gt;:{graduation=B.S., primary=school},&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;name&quot;&lt;/span&gt;:&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;como&quot;&lt;/span&gt;}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;but I expect as JSON it should print as below (with proper key,value pairs as field names and values)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
{&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;education&quot;&lt;/span&gt;:{&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;graduation&quot;&lt;/span&gt;: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;B.S.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;primary&quot;&lt;/span&gt;:&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;school&quot;&lt;/span&gt;},&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;name&quot;&lt;/span&gt;:&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;como&quot;&lt;/span&gt;}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Suggested fix:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I can create a Pull request for this issue handling Maps appending logic.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1542] ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString - Wrong JSON format when object has a List/Array of Enum</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1542</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m trying to log an object to console with JSON style using&#160;&lt;tt&gt;ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;from&#160;&lt;tt&gt;commons-lang3:3.10&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;but it seems generated a wrong JSON format.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Problem happening when I have a list of enums in my field list.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
This is the class:
 &#160;   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Person {
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; id;
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; name;
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; List&amp;lt;MyEnum&amp;gt; listEnums;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//getter and setter
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; toString(){
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;, ToStringStyle.JSON_STYLE); 
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And&#160;&lt;tt&gt;MyEnum&lt;/tt&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&#160;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;enum&lt;/span&gt; MyEnum {
     FOOD,
     SPORT,
     BOOK,
     MUSIC
 }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;When I call&#160;&lt;tt&gt;toString()&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;of Person object. It shows like this&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&#160;{
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;id&quot;&lt;/span&gt;: 1,
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;name&quot;&lt;/span&gt;: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Karl&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;listEnums&quot;&lt;/span&gt;: [FRIDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY]
 }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What I expected is:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&#160;{
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;id&quot;&lt;/span&gt;: 1,
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;name&quot;&lt;/span&gt;: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Karl&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;listEnums&quot;&lt;/span&gt;: [&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;FRIDAY&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;MONDAY&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;TUESDAY&quot;&lt;/span&gt;]
 }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Open JDK 1.8&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13305137">LANG-1542</key>
