                            <comment id="17190884" author="dongjoon" created="Fri, 4 Sep 2020 18:44:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Could you add `3.9` to the Affected version, please?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
$ jshell -c commons-lang3-3.9.jar
|  Welcome to JShell -- Version 11.0.8
|  For an introduction type: /help intro

jshell&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;enum&lt;/span&gt; MyEnum { FOOD };
|  created &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;enum&lt;/span&gt; MyEnum

jshell&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Person { List&amp;lt;MyEnum&amp;gt; list = Arrays.asList(MyEnum.FOOD); }
|  created &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Person

jshell&amp;gt; org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Person(), org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.ToStringStyle.JSON_STYLE)
$4 ==&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;{\&quot;&lt;/span&gt;list\&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;:[FOOD]}&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>

&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;* &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Uses &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;ReflectionToStringBuilder&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to generate a&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;* &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;toString&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; for the specified object.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;

&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;* @param object  the Object to be output&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;* @param style  the style of the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;toString&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to create, may be &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;null&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;* @return the String result&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;* @see ReflectionToStringBuilder#toString(Object,ToStringStyle)&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;*/&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;public static String reflectionToString(final Object object, final ToStringStyle style) {&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;return ReflectionToStringBuilder.toString(object, style);&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;}</customfieldvalue>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1541] ArrayUtils.contains() fails to handle Double.NaN</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1541</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ArrayUtils.contains(double[], double) does not handle Double.NaN correctly. That is, ArrayUtils.contains() returns false, even if the given array contains Double.NaN.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;For example, consider the following:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt;[] a = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;double&lt;/span&gt;[]{&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.NEGATIVE_INFINITY, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.NaN, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.POSITIVE_INFINITY};
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(ArrayUtils.contains(a, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.POSITIVE_INFINITY)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(ArrayUtils.contains(a, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.NEGATIVE_INFINITY)); // &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(ArrayUtils.contains(a, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.NaN)); // &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt; ?&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13304085">LANG-1541</key>
            <summary>ArrayUtils.contains() fails to handle Double.NaN</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1532] FastDateFormat.getInstance() generates java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1532</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We recently updated from version 3.9 to 3.10 and our Android app now crashes on old Android versions (Android 5 or 6).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The stack trace (from your library) is:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org.apache.commons.lang3.-$$Lambda$Validate$0cAgQbsjQIo0VHKh79UWkAcDRWk
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.Validate.notNull(Validate.java:225)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FormatCache.getInstance(FormatCache.java:72)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat.getInstance(FastDateFormat.java:179)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Android 5 and Android 6&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13298566">LANG-1532</key>
            <summary>FastDateFormat.getInstance() generates java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="gmbett">Germ&#225;n Bett</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>android</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 15 Apr 2020 13:18:33 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 15 Apr 2020 14:33:10 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.10</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>2</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17084084" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 15 Apr 2020 13:32:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Do these old versions of Android support Java 8 lambdas?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17084106" author="gmbett" created="Wed, 15 Apr 2020 13:56:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Google introduced support for Java 8 lambdas some time ago (and in theory, it supports event older versions than Android 5):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developer.android.com/studio/write/java8-support&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://developer.android.com/studio/write/java8-support&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We also use lambdas in our project and they work fine but, for some reason, this library doesn&apos;t.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17084127" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 15 Apr 2020 14:30:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;What Android API level does your app use?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17084128" author="gmbett" created="Wed, 15 Apr 2020 14:31:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I did a sample app to discard any other possible thing and I found the real problem. In version 3.10 inside Validate.notNull(final T object, final String message, final Object... values) you are now using Objects.requireNonNull(T obj, Supplier&amp;lt;String&amp;gt; messageSupplier). This method is not supported in old versions of Android (it was introduced in API 24 or Android 7)&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17084130" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 15 Apr 2020 14:33:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Indeed, this SO post hints at API level 24:&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43774969/noclassdeffounderror-when-i-use-lambda-to-traverse-string-array&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43774969/noclassdeffounderror-when-i-use-lambda-to-traverse-string-array&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>

                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1531] escapeXml10 does not escape newline and tab characters to #xA</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1531</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;escapexml10 in StringEscapeUtils does not escape newline(line feed) and tab characters to #xA but it should escape them as specified in &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#sec-line-ends&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#sec-line-ends&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13297656">LANG-1531</key>
            <summary>escapeXml10 does not escape newline and tab characters to #xA</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="devson">devson</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 10 Apr 2020 17:47:30 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 18 Nov 2020 17:16:24 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.8.1</version>
                    <version>3.10</version>
                                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17234292" author="arturobernalg" created="Wed, 18 Nov 2020 06:27:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=devson&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;devson&quot;&gt;devson&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;The Class is deprecated&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/arturobernalg/commons-lang/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringEscapeUtils.java#L43&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/arturobernalg/commons-lang/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringEscapeUtils.java#L43&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please refer to&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-text/javadocs/api-release/org/apache/commons/text/StringEscapeUtils.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-text/javadocs/api-release/org/apache/commons/text/StringEscapeUtils.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&#160;we can close this issues&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regards&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1528] replaceEachRepeatedly gives IllegalStateException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1528</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ChurchilllaanTest1 fails, ChurchilllaanTest2 doesn&apos;t, why?&lt;br/&gt;
 Please allow the ttl to be overridden.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void ChurchilllaanTest1() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; input = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Churchilllaan&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[][] replaceMap = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[][] {
                { &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;llaan&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;laan&quot;&lt;/span&gt; },
        };
        
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; output = StringUtils.replaceEachRepeatedly(
                                         input, 
                                         getColumn(0, replaceMap),
                                         getColumn(1, replaceMap)); 
        Assert.assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Churchilaan&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, output);
    }

@Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void ChurchilllaanTest2() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; input = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Churchilllaan&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[][] replaceMap = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[][] {
                { &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;llaan&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;laan&quot;&lt;/span&gt; },
                { &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;c&quot;&lt;/span&gt; },
        };
        
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; output = StringUtils.replaceEachRepeatedly(
                                         input, 
                                         getColumn(0, replaceMap),
                                         getColumn(1, replaceMap)); 
        Assert.assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;churchilaan&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, output);
    }

  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] getColumn(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; colIndex, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[][] from) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; Arrays.stream(from).map(x -&amp;gt; x[colIndex]).toArray(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[]::&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt;);
    }

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1524] TypeUtils.toString StackOverflowError for an inner class in the inner class parameterized enclosing class.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1524</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;StackOverflowError occurred on toString for an inner class in the inner class parameterized enclosing class.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;source:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Test&amp;lt;T &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; Inner&amp;gt; {
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Inner {
  }

  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(TypeUtils.toString(Inner.class));
  }
}&#160;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;result:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Exception in thread &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;main&quot;&lt;/span&gt; java.lang.StackOverflowErrorException in thread &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;main&quot;&lt;/span&gt; java.lang.StackOverflowError at java.lang.&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.getEnclosingMethodInfo(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.java:1072) at java.lang.&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.getEnclosingClass(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.java:1272) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.classToString(TypeUtils.java:1751) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1663) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1891) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.appendAllTo(TypeUtils.java:1882) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.typeVariableToString(TypeUtils.java:1775) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1672) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1891) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.appendAllTo(TypeUtils.java:1882) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.classToString(TypeUtils.java:1758) at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.classToString(TypeUtils.java:1752)
...&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1518] MethodUtils.getAnnotation() with searchSupers = true does not work if super is generic</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1518</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Foo&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; {
	@Nonnull
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; void test(T i) {
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + i);
	}
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Bar &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; Foo&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; {
	@Override
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; void test(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt; i) {
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;bar&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + i);
	}
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException {
	Method testMethod = Bar.&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class.&lt;/span&gt;getDeclaredMethod(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.class);
	
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(MethodUtils.getAnnotation(testMethod, Nonnull.class, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//==&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/span&gt;}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;the method&#160;MethodUtils.getAnnotation() should be modified as souch:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(using&#160;&lt;b&gt;MethodUtils.getMatchingMethod&lt;/b&gt;/&lt;b&gt;MethodUtils.getMatchingAccessibleMethod&lt;/b&gt; instead of&#160;&lt;b&gt;getDeclaredMethod&lt;/b&gt;/&lt;b&gt;getMethod&lt;/b&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &amp;lt;A &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; Annotation&amp;gt; A getAnnotation(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Method method, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;A&amp;gt; annotationCls,
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; searchSupers, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; ignoreAccess) {

	Validate.isTrue(method != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The method must not be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
	Validate.isTrue(annotationCls != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The annotation &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;must not be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!ignoreAccess &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !MemberUtils.isAccessible(method)) {
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
	}

	A annotation = method.getAnnotation(annotationCls);

	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (annotation == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; &amp;amp;&amp;amp; searchSupers) {
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; mcls = method.getDeclaringClass();
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;?&amp;gt;&amp;gt; classes = getAllSuperclassesAndInterfaces(mcls);
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; acls : classes) {
			Method equivalentMethod = (ignoreAccess
					? MethodUtils.getMatchingMethod(acls, method.getName(), method.getParameterTypes())
					: MethodUtils.getMatchingAccessibleMethod(acls, method.getName(), method.getParameterTypes()));
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (equivalentMethod == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
				&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;continue&lt;/span&gt;;
			}
			annotation = equivalentMethod.getAnnotation(annotationCls);
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (annotation != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
				&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;break&lt;/span&gt;;
			}
		}
	}

	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; annotation;
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1514] Test may fail due to a different iteration order</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1514</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Test `testGetAllFieldsList` in `FieldUtilsTest` checks if method `getAllFields` returns correct fields of a certain class.  `getAllFields` depends on `java.lang.class.getDeclaredFields` to use reflection to get the fields. However, `java.lang.class.getDeclaredFields` does not guarantee any specific order of fields returned. Therefore, test will fail if the order returned by the API is different.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13280418">LANG-1514</key>
            <summary>Test may fail due to a different iteration order</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1501] Test may fail due to a different order of fields returned by reflection API</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1501</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Tests in MultilineRecursiveToStringStyleTest.java, RecursiveToStringStyleTest.java, ToStringBuilderTest.java depends on ReflectionToStringBuilder.appendFieldsIn. It appends the fields returned by java.lang.Class.getDeclaredFields. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, java.lang.Class.getDeclaredFields does not guarantee any specific order and thus, test can fail if the order is different, (i.e., it generates a different hash code). &quot;The elements in the returned array are not sorted and are not in any particular order&quot; (reference: &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#getDeclaredMethods--&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#getDeclaredMethods--&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13270277">LANG-1501</key>
            <summary>Test may fail due to a different order of fields returned by reflection API</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="contextshuffling">contextshuffling</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 23 Nov 2019 22:52:39 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 16 May 2020 14:54:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 24 Nov 2019 02:53:17 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>3.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.builder.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1500] Test may fail due to a different order of fields returned by reflection API</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1500</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Tests in &lt;em&gt;HashCodeBuilderTest&lt;/em&gt; depends on &lt;em&gt;HashCodeBuilder.reflectionHashCode&lt;/em&gt;. The logic of &lt;em&gt;reflectionHashCode&lt;/em&gt; appends the fields returned by &lt;b&gt;&lt;em&gt;java.lang.Class.getDeclaredFields&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/b&gt;. The order of fields being appended will affect the calculated HashCode.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, &lt;em&gt;&lt;b&gt;java.lang.Class.getDeclaredFields&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/em&gt; does not guarantee any specific order and thus, test can fail if the order is different, (i.e., it generates a different hash code). &quot;The elements in the returned array are not sorted and are not in any particular order&quot; (reference:&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#getDeclaredMethods--&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#getDeclaredMethods--)&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This affects &lt;em&gt;HashCodeBuilderTest.testReflectionHashCodeExcludeFields&lt;/em&gt; and &lt;em&gt;HashCodeBuilderTest.testReflectionHierarchyHashCode&lt;/em&gt; as they depend on the order of fields returned by the api.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13270124">LANG-1500</key>
            <summary>Test may fail due to a different order of fields returned by reflection API</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="contextshuffling">contextshuffling</reporter>
                        <labels>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1499] Equals transitivity is violated in EqualsBuilder</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1499</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals() does not hold transitivity when comparing two subclasses extending a common superclass. For example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Given that both class D and E are subclasses of class C, C == D and C == E should imply D == E. However EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals(D, E) returns &lt;b&gt;false&lt;/b&gt; when both EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals(C, D) and&#160;EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals(C, E) return true.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A junit test is provided as attachment.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Ubuntu 18.04&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JDK 1.8.0_221&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Commons Lang 3.9-RC2&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JUnit 5.4&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13269945">LANG-1499</key>
            <summary>Equals transitivity is violated in EqualsBuilder</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Cap_JR">Zhiqiang Zang</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>Equals()</label>
                            <label>EqualsBuilder</label>
                            <label>transitivity</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 21 Nov 2019 20:45:50 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 11 Jun 2020 00:55:17 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.9</version>
                                                    <component>lang.builder.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17023818" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 26 Jan 2020 14:55:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The test seems invalid to me.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Given that the equals() method of the C class returns false unless the the two classes are identical, it seems to me that an instance of C should never equal an instance of D or an instance of E; likewise an instance of D can never equal an instance of E.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Whilst I agree that the result of equals() should be transitive, that depends on the correctness of the other equalities.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If there is a bug here, it seems to me that instances of C and D should not be considered equal.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17023822" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 26 Jan 2020 15:08:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The code for EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals() does not check whether the classes are the same:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/xref/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/EqualsBuilder.html#L452&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/xref/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/EqualsBuilder.html#L452&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However the class Javadoc says it should:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/xref/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/EqualsBuilder.html#L56&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/xref/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/EqualsBuilder.html#L56&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is a disconnect here, which could be the cause of the lack of transitivity.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think this issue needs some more analysis before any fixes can be identified.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17023886" author="cap_jr" created="Sun, 26 Jan 2020 17:36:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=sebb&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;sebb&quot;&gt;Sebb&lt;/a&gt;&#160;Thank you for your comments. Thank you for pointing out some inconsistency between Javadoc and code, which should be inspected, too. I want to share more findings such that this issue makes more sense.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;equals() method should be able to return true when comparing two different classes sharing a common superclass, such as LinkedList and ArrayList. Actually Java built-in equals() method supports this case.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The code for&#160;EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals() does check if one class is a superclass of the other but it simply returns false for all other cases, which is the cause of the issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/xref/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/EqualsBuilder.html#L522&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/xref/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/EqualsBuilder.html#L522&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;One potential fix could be to have another else if branch to check if two classes share a common superclass.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17023894" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 26 Jan 2020 18:17:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Surely all classes share a common superclass, i.e. Object?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think one would need to check that the parent class has the same variables.&lt;br/&gt;
Or rather, none of the descendants of the common parent can add any value components.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17023913" author="cap_jr" created="Sun, 26 Jan 2020 20:13:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, you&apos;re right. But the descendants can also share the same added fields. More analysis needs to be done here. I hope more people can join the discussion.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17130575" author="swingguy1024@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 10 Jun 2020 11:54:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is a valid issue, but the test case has problems. It relies on an equals method that doesn&apos;t use EqualsBuilder. Here&apos;s a better test case:  &lt;span class=&quot;nobr&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13005363/13005363_EqualTransitivityTest2.java&quot; title=&quot;EqualTransitivityTest2.java attached to LANG-1499&quot;&gt;EqualTransitivityTest2.java&lt;sup&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;rendericon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/link_attachment_7.gif&quot; height=&quot;7&quot; width=&quot;7&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17130582" author="swingguy1024@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 10 Jun 2020 12:00:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve always been uncomfortable with ReflectionEquals for this reason. I have written my own way of using reflection to generate an equals method that doesn&apos;t have this problem. It also runs faster because it does all the reflective inspection when the class loads, instead of when equals() is called. And it has a way to do what EqualsBuilder does, but by using method references. You can check it out at &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/SwingGuy1024/DogTags&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/SwingGuy1024/DogTags&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17130650" author="swingguy1024@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 10 Jun 2020 13:00:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I should add that any subclass that overrides the equals() method of its base class will fail the transitivity and symmetry tests, unless the overridden method does exactly the same thing as its super method. And the EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals class effectively overrides the base class equals method. It may be possible to fix this by looking for a common base class that&apos;s not Object.class, but it&apos;s also not clear if that&apos;s what the end user would want.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17132766" author="swingguy1024@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 10 Jun 2020 22:30:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m just brainstorming here, so please nit-pick. But here&apos;s one possible fix: Allow the user to specify which parent class to use for doing the comparison. So, for the revised test case, the C.equals() method would look more like this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    @Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; equals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; o) {
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; == o) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;;
      }
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!(o &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; C)) { &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// implicit test &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/span&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
      }
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; EqualsBuilder.reflectionEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;, o, C.class); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; parameter to solve &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; problem.
&lt;/span&gt;    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Here, if the equals() method is called from an instance of D or E, or any subclass of C, it still knows to do the reflection from class C instead of this.getClass().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This assumes that whoever wrote class C knows that it will be subclassed, and that subclasses should still use the equals() method of class C. Zhiqiang Zang&apos;s point about LinkedList and ArrayList is a good example of where the author of the base class would know this about its subclasses.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, this fix doesn&apos;t address the opposite case where class C is a generic base class, and the author expects subclasses to use their own properties in the equals method. On my last job, our JPA entity classes were written this way. As far as I know, it didn&apos;t cause a problem, because the code probably didn&apos;t compare objects of different types, but I can&apos;t be sure about that.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s another problem with my proposed approach. The reflectionEquals() method is already overloaded, with one alternate taking a class instance named reflectUpTo. We would need a way to clearly distinguish this new starting point from the reflectUpTo, which is an ending point.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17132811" author="swingguy1024@yahoo.com" created="Thu, 11 Jun 2020 00:55:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;On 26-Jan-20,&#160;Zhiqiang Zang had this idea:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;One potential fix could be to have another else if branch to check if two classes share a common superclass.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
Here&apos;s a problem with this idea. On a past project, we had a base class that implemented equals() using reflectionEquals(), and all our entity classes extended it. If we adopt&#160;Zhiqiang Zang&apos;s suggestion, all entity classes of different types would test equal to each other.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1488] Possible serialization failed</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1488</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Pair&lt;/b&gt; fails to properly constrain the generic parameters, requiring them to implement the &lt;b&gt;Serializable&lt;/b&gt; interface, which may cause serialization to fail.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;A { }

@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testSerialization() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; Exception {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; ImmutablePair&amp;lt;A, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; origPair = ImmutablePair.of(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; A(), &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; ByteArrayOutputStream baos = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ByteArrayOutputStream();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; ObjectOutputStream out = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ObjectOutputStream(baos);
        out.writeObject(origPair);

        out.close();
        baos.close();
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13255615">LANG-1488</key>
            <summary>Possible serialization failed</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tai">Tai Dupree</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 9 Sep 2019 11:47:53 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 10 Sep 2019 13:11:40 +0000</updated>
                                                            <fixVersion>4.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.tuple.*</component>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16925700" author="tai" created="Mon, 9 Sep 2019 13:37:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;May need to remove &lt;b&gt;Pair&lt;/b&gt; serialization support?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16925735" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 9 Sep 2019 14:26:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In the &lt;em&gt;long&lt;/em&gt; run this should happen since Java Serialization has fallen out of favor, but that cannot happen until a &lt;em&gt;major&lt;/em&gt; release is done like 4.0.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16926242" author="guoping1" created="Tue, 10 Sep 2019 01:44:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The Class A should implements Serializable, if Class A is a inner class, the outer class also must implements Serializable.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16926594" author="joehni" created="Tue, 10 Sep 2019 12:44:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is normal behaviour. A HashMap is also declared as serializable, but is not restricted to serializable objects. The same applies for Pair. If you want to serialize a Pair, you have to ensure yourself that its members are serializable.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16926623" author="tai" created="Tue, 10 Sep 2019 13:11:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So it seems that this is no longer a problem? We can only hope that users will follow the rules themselves.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1484] NumberUtils.isParsable returns false for strings ending with .</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1484</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;From the Javadocs:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;Parsable numbers include those Strings understood by ... Double.parseDouble(String).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;Double.parseDouble(&quot;100.&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt; returns a valid double (it does not throw a&#160;&lt;tt&gt;NumberFormatException&lt;/tt&gt;); however, &lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.isParsable(&quot;100.&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt; returns &lt;tt&gt;false&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Tested on Linux with OpenJDK 10.0.2 and Windows with Oracle Java 8 Update 201.&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13254489">LANG-1484</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils.isParsable returns false for strings ending with .</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="seniorquico">Kyle Dodson</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>

                            <comment id="16925597" author="saksham63" created="Mon, 9 Sep 2019 11:16:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am working on this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16965401" author="ramesh dhungel" created="Sat, 2 Nov 2019 15:18:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In the test class&#160;NumberUtils.isParsable there is a assert false for 64. in line 1457. So&#160;NumberUtils.isParsable(&quot;100.&quot;) will return false because of that line. So you could either have a new code that would eliminate last char of that argument and then pass it in to the method&#160;withDecimalsParsing which would return 100.0 or 64.0. Thus it would be true an matches Double.parseDouble(). But you cant have one test case that returns false with similar or exact argument and then have another test case that should return true with the same argument. So I think what we can do is take out one of the test case and decide which one to keep because all the other test cases pass.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16975604" author="saksham63" created="Sat, 16 Nov 2019 06:17:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=Ramesh+Dhungel&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;Ramesh Dhungel&quot;&gt;Ramesh Dhungel&lt;/a&gt; I did not understand your point. <item>
            <title>[LANG-1482] Functions </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1482</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The implementation of the methods &lt;tt&gt;asRunnable()&lt;/tt&gt;, &lt;tt&gt;asConsumer()&lt;/tt&gt;, &lt;tt&gt;asCallable()&lt;/tt&gt;, &lt;tt&gt;asBiConsumer()&lt;/tt&gt; etc. is redundant and copy-paste. They are implemented with the structure (example from &lt;tt&gt;asRunnable()&lt;/tt&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; () -&amp;gt; {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
                pRunnable.run();
            } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (Throwable t) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; rethrow(t);
            }
        };
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This try-catch structure is already implemented in the class and can be used here simplifying the method to &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; () -&amp;gt; run(pRunnable);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, the tests for &lt;tt&gt;asPredicate()&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;asBiPredicate()&lt;/tt&gt; are missing.&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13252998">LANG-1482</key>
            <summary>Functions </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1480] ClassUtils. getAbbreviatedName(String ,int) returns too long result</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1480</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In some cases, the algorithm decides incorrectly when to which package names to abbreviate. For example, abbreviating&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.lang3.ClassUtils&lt;/tt&gt; to the length 18 will result &lt;tt&gt;o.a.c.lang3.ClassUtils&lt;/tt&gt; (22 characters) instead of &lt;tt&gt;o.a.c.l.ClassUtils&lt;/tt&gt; (18 characters as requested). The reason for this is that the algorithm starts from the right and goes to the left abbreviating the packages and starts to abbreviate the packages when it runs out of the available space.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Instead, the algorithm should start from the left and abbreviate all packages that would result in a too-long string without abbreviating the package name.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Environment independent.&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13252358">LANG-1480</key>
            <summary>ClassUtils. getAbbreviatedName(String ,int) returns too long result</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kinow">Bruno P. Kinoshita</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="peter@verhas.com">Peter Verhas</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 22 Aug 2019 11:03:29 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 12 Oct 2019 19:20:38 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 12 Oct 2019 19:20:38 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="86400">24h</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="55200">15h 20m</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="31200">8h 40m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16915110" author="kinow" created="Sat, 24 Aug 2019 23:59:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;See comment for &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1478&quot; title=&quot;ClassUtils getAbbreviatedName uses len one character shorter&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1478&quot;&gt;LANG-1478&lt;/a&gt;, on whether this should go in 4.x release line, or 3.x. The answer for that in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1478&quot; title=&quot;ClassUtils getAbbreviatedName uses len one character shorter&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1478&quot;&gt;LANG-1478&lt;/a&gt;, applies here as well IMO.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915506" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Mon, 26 Aug 2019 06:10:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Here more than there. This is a change that, imho, should NOT go into 3.x This is a major functionality change even though this is closer to the behavior described by the documentation and thus the current implementation is the &quot;more faulty&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915513" author="kinow" created="Mon, 26 Aug 2019 06:21:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Peter, if this is fixing the code, and bringing the code closer to the documentation, then it should be good to go in the next release.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think I left some comments in the pull request. If you could go through them and make sure the Travis build is passing, I will re-read the documentation and see if we can include in the next release.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915664" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Mon, 26 Aug 2019 10:07:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I updated the code to contain only the changes that are related to the issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The fact that the coverage in terms of percentage decreased is a good thing. Think about it. I replaced a 100% covered but a complex and unnecessarily long method with a shorter, but also 100% covered one. If nothing else changes and the coverage of the whole project is less than 100% then the overall coverage will decrease. E.g.: you have a 200 LOC project. Coverage is 50%. You replace a 20 LOC/100% covered method with a 10 LOC/100% covered one. The coverage will decrease to 47.36%.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915675" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Mon, 26 Aug 2019 10:19:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As for the Travis issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I fixed the import * to the original as part of the accidental reformatting.&lt;br/&gt;
The other Travis issues are related to Functions.java that contains tabs instead of spaces, which is not part of this pull request. I did not change that. Seems like some error in the master. PLEASE HELP&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: Fact is that the change in Functions.java was suggested by me. But I did not develop it. Somebody else of the team developed it and not the way I suggested and it still got merged into the master. When I will have time I will open a separate ticket, make the code simpler and create a pull request, but that is a totally different issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16931253" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Tue, 17 Sep 2019 09:50:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Is there anything I should do to get this pull request merged?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16939674" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Fri, 27 Sep 2019 18:39:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The code reviewer (garydgregory) insists that the unit tests should be consistent having all unit test methods and classes the same visibility. And he is right.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;On the other hand, I cannot ignore Robert C. Martin&apos;s instruction that says &quot;Do not ship shit.&quot; So instead of degrading the new or modified unit test applying an outdated pattern that has no relevance any more just for the sake of consistency I created the change in the linked issue to achieve the consistency first and then there will be no blocking to make this bug fix merged.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16939675" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Fri, 27 Sep 2019 18:40:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;One code reviewer (garydgregory) insists that the unit tests should be consistent having all unit test methods and classes the same visibility. And he is right.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;On the other hand, I cannot ignore Robert C. Martin&apos;s instruction that says &quot;Do not ship shit.&quot; So instead of degrading the new or modified unit test applying an outdated pattern that has no relevance any more just for the sake of consistency I created the change in the linked issue to achieve the consistency first and then there will be no blocking to make this bug fix merged.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1478] ClassUtils getAbbreviatedName uses len one character shorter</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1478</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The &lt;tt&gt;ClassUtils&lt;/tt&gt; method &lt;tt&gt;getAbbreviatedName&lt;/tt&gt; calculates the required lenght one character short. That way&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; ANY_CLASS_FULL_NAME = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;....&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;

assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;ANY_CLASS_FULL_NAME &quot;&lt;/span&gt;, ClassUtils.getAbbreviatedName(ANY_CLASS_FULL_NAME , ANY_CLASS_FULL_NAME .length()));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;will abbreviate the class name, although we are asking exactly the same number of characters as they are there. The solution is that &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (availableSpace &amp;gt; 0) {
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;has to be modified to&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (availableSpace &amp;gt;= 0) {
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;since the value zero means that we exactly used up the available character width.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is just a quick fix for this issue, but generally, the algorithm is faulty. It runs many times out of the desired length. It actually uses the len parameter, not as the desired final length but rather a length for which what is out of the range on the left that has to be abbreviated. For that, the code could be much simpler. (See &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1480&quot; title=&quot;ClassUtils. getAbbreviatedName(String ,int) returns too long result&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1480&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1480&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13252170">LANG-1478</key>
            <summary>ClassUtils getAbbreviatedName uses len one character shorter</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/inprogress.png" description="This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.">In Progress</status>
                    <statusCategory id="4" key="indeterminate" colorName="yellow"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kinow">Bruno P. Kinoshita</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="peter@verhas.com">Peter Verhas</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 21 Aug 2019 16:21:50 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 14 Oct 2019 15:07:16 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.9</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="4200">1h 10m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16913278" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Thu, 22 Aug 2019 12:29:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Issue 1480 suggest the change of the code more drastically that makes this change invalid.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16913280" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Thu, 22 Aug 2019 12:30:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The issue &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1480&quot; title=&quot;ClassUtils. getAbbreviatedName(String ,int) returns too long result&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1480&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1480&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; suggests a total rewrite of the method (there is also a pull request) that makes this request moot if &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1480&quot; title=&quot;ClassUtils. getAbbreviatedName(String ,int) returns too long result&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1480&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1480&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; is accepted and merged.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915106" author="kinow" created="Sat, 24 Aug 2019 23:34:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Oh, I see what you mean.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(ClassUtils.getAbbreviatedName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;ab.de.Ghij&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, className.length())); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// 10
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// prints a.de.Ghij &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;So when you get the abbreviated name passing the exact length of the class name, it is indeed one character short. I agree it is annoying having to use `className.length() + 1`... but I suspect we could have some users using it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I will approve the PR, but will ask in the mailing list before merging it first, to check whether we will need to wait for a major release - as this could break someone else&apos;s code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915109" author="kinow" created="Sat, 24 Aug 2019 23:52:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sent a message to the mailing list, asking whether this needs to go in 4.x, or if we can include in the next 3.x release.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915505" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Mon, 26 Aug 2019 06:09:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It is not only that case. It is in every case where `a.b.c.ddd. ...` would be OK and just exactly the required length (`a`, `b`, `c` are abbreviated in this sample, but `ddd` is not). The current algorithm will abbreviate it to `a.b.c.d. ...` abbreviating `ddd` unnecessarily.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I agree with you that a change like that may not be introduced in a minor release, but it does not seem to a strict policy. My project was broken upgrading from 3.4 to 3.9 as `isAnyEmpty(null)` changed from true to false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the decision is that we have to wait for a major release then I suggest NOT TO IMPLEMENT this change, but rather the one I suggested in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1480&quot; title=&quot;ClassUtils. getAbbreviatedName(String ,int) returns too long result&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1480&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1480&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What is your opinion about that?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16915512" author="kinow" created="Mon, 26 Aug 2019 06:20:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It was pointed in the mailing list that this is actually fixing the behavior of the class, and matching with what is described in the documentation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So once the PR comments are addressed, it&apos;s ready to be included in the next release.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1477] Implement castToXXX in Functions class</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1477</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Proposal to implement functional interface conversion functions in the class&#160;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.lang3.Functions&lt;/tt&gt; that convert&#160;&lt;tt&gt;FailableXXX&lt;/tt&gt; to &lt;tt&gt;XXX&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example, the FailableRunnable can be converted with the method:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &amp;lt;K &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; Throwable&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Runnable&lt;/span&gt; castToRunnable(FailableRunnable&amp;lt;K&amp;gt; s) {
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; () -&amp;gt; run(s);
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13251828">LANG-1477</key>
            <summary>Implement castToXXX in Functions class</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="jochen@apache.org">Jochen Wiedmann</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="peter@verhas.com">Peter Verhas</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>newbie</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 20 Aug 2019 12:35:24 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 23 Aug 2019 13:12:53 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 22 Aug 2019 20:11:35 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="604800">168h</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="604800">168h</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="16913661" author="jochen@apache.org" created="Thu, 22 Aug 2019 20:10:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Is this, what you had in mind?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=commons-lang.git;a=commit;h=bc16e0109a30b819c50895e157830fe9b3f8e93f&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=commons-lang.git;a=commit;h=bc16e0109a30b819c50895e157830fe9b3f8e93f&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16914252" author="peter@verhas.com" created="Fri, 23 Aug 2019 13:12:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, and no. This is the functionality I was looking for, but the implementation is copy-paste. The same structure already exists in the static method &lt;tt&gt;Functions.run(FailableRunnable&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; pRunnable)&lt;/tt&gt;. Therefore the implementation of the functions has to be&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &amp;lt;K &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; Throwable&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Runnable&lt;/span&gt; castToRunnable(FailableRunnable&amp;lt;K&amp;gt; s) {
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; () -&amp;gt; run(s);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And when I realized that the implementation is so simple, I am now less convinced that we need this &lt;tt&gt;asRunnable(FailableRunnable&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; pRunnable)&lt;/tt&gt; function /and the similar others/ at all.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Even though I suggested this change in the first place I would vote not to implement it into the class &lt;tt&gt;Functions&lt;/tt&gt; increasing the footprint of the API. Instead, I would go for extending the documentation explaining that the already available methods, like &lt;tt&gt;run(FailableRunnable&amp;lt;T&amp;gt; pRunnable)&lt;/tt&gt; can be used as &lt;tt&gt;()-&amp;gt;run(pRunnable)&lt;/tt&gt; to convert a &lt;tt&gt;FailableRunnable&lt;/tt&gt; to a &lt;tt&gt;Runnable&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
