<item>
            <title>[LANG-1476] Use synchronise on a set created with Collections.synchronizedSet before iterating</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1476</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Placeholder for PR created in GitHub.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Link to Java docs:&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/util/Collections.html#synchronizedSet-java.util.Set-&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/util/Collections.html#synchronizedSet-java.util.Set-&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt;It is imperative that the user manually synchronize on the returned collection when traversing it via &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/util/Iterator.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;Iterator&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/util/Spliterator.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;Spliterator&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt; or &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/util/stream/Stream.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;Stream&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;</description>

                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1474</link>

                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The behavior of &lt;tt&gt;isAnyBlank&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;isAnyEmpty&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;has changed for &lt;tt&gt;null&lt;/tt&gt; argument from version 2.5 to 3.9. The documentation, however, was not changed. It still says&lt;/p&gt;

            <title>[LANG-1473] Illegal reflective access to ArrayList.serialVersionUID</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1473</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following warning appears in our logs. We&apos;re not actively accessing ArrayList.SerialVersionUID:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred
WARNING: Illegal reflective access by org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.FieldUtils (file:/C:/Workspaces/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.apache.commons/commons-lang3/3.9/122c7cee69b53ed4a7681c03d4ee4c0e2765da5/commons-lang3-3.9.jar) to field java.util.ArrayList.serialVersionUI
WARNING: Please consider reporting &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; to the maintainers of org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.FieldUtils
WARNING: Use --illegal-access=warn to enable warnings of further illegal reflective access operations

&lt;/pre&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1472] SystemUtils.getHostName()&#33719;&#21462;&#31995;&#32479;hostname&#20026;null</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1472</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;SpringBoot &#39033;&#30446;&#33719;&#21462;&#31995;&#32479; hostname &#20026; null &#23548;&#33268; java.lang.NullPointerException &#12290;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#37096;&#20998;&#20195;&#30721;&#65306;&lt;br/&gt;
   private static Long getDataCenterId(){&lt;br/&gt;
        int[] ints = StringUtils.toCodePoints(SystemUtils.getHostName());&lt;br/&gt;
        int sums = 0;&lt;br/&gt;
        for (int i: ints) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            sums += i;
        }
&lt;p&gt;        return (long)(sums % 32);&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;/p&gt;</description>

	&lt;li&gt;&#25805;&#20316;&#31995;&#32479;&#65306;&#38463;&#37324;&#20113;&#25552;&#20379;&#30340;Ubuntu 16.04&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;del&gt;Execute the &lt;b&gt;env&lt;/b&gt; command on your machine to get the environment variables.&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#22312;&#20320;&#30340;&#26381;&#21153;&#22120;&#19978;&#25191;&#34892; &lt;b&gt;env&lt;/b&gt;&#160;&#21629;&#20196;&#20320;&#20250;&#33719;&#24471;&#29615;&#22659;&#21464;&#37327;&#21015;&#34920;&#12290;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                            <comment id="16906010" author="michael-o" created="Tue, 13 Aug 2019 09:34:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The method relies on environment variables. The variable &lt;tt&gt;HOSTNAME&lt;/tt&gt; is not set. Therefore the NPE.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16906019" author="tai" created="Tue, 13 Aug 2019 09:49:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=VioletKiss&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;VioletKiss&quot;&gt;wangrubao&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The &lt;b&gt;getHostName&lt;/b&gt; method works on the non-Widnwos platform depending on the &lt;b&gt;HOSTNAME&lt;/b&gt; environment variable, but there is no definition in your current environment variable, so getting &lt;font color=&quot;#FF0000&quot;&gt;null&lt;/font&gt; is normal.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    /**
     * Gets the host name from an environment variable.
     *
     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;
     * If you want to know what the network stack says is the host name, you should use {@code InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName()}.
     * &amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
     *
     * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; the host name.
     * @since 3.6
     */
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; getHostName() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; IS_OS_WINDOWS ? &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getenv(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;COMPUTERNAME&quot;&lt;/span&gt;) : &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.getenv(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;HOSTNAME&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;You can see in the program through the &lt;b&gt;System.getenv()&lt;/b&gt; method that the environment name of the &lt;b&gt;HOSTNAME&lt;/b&gt; is not registered in the program instance.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16906046" author="violetkiss" created="Tue, 13 Aug 2019 10:15:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have added the HOSTNAME in the system environment, and the program run exactly. I am to careless, thank you very much.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1465] DateUtils.parseDate backward Incompatibility bug</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1465</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following code snippets throw a ParseException when trying to parse the time. It works well before commons-lang 3.4. When I update commons-lang to 3.5 or newer versions, it failed.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
	@Test
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void Demo() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; ParseException {
		assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Tue Jun 11 15:06:11 CDT 2019&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, DateUtils.parseDate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;2019-06-11T15:06:11.716-0500&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ss.SSSZZ&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
		
	}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;System:&#160;Linux testinglab 4.4.0-131-generic #157~14.04.1-Ubuntu&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Java version &quot;1.8.0_191&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_191-b12)&lt;br/&gt;
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.191-b12, mixed mode)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1463] StringUtils abbreviate returns String of length greater than maxWidth</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1463</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In the JavaDoc of StringUtils.abbreviate(final String str, final String abbrevMarker, final int maxWidth) is written, that the method in no case will return a String of length greater than maxWidth. This doesn&apos;t hold, if abbrevMarker is an empty string.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Expected behaviour:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;abbreviate(&quot;much too long text&quot;, &quot;&quot;, 13).equals(&quot;much too long&quot;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Actual behaviour:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;abbreviate(&quot;much too long text&quot;, &quot;&quot;, 13).equals(&quot;much too long text&quot;)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13238759">LANG-1463</key>
            <summary>StringUtils abbreviate returns String of length greater than maxWidth</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="twessendorf">Thomas Wessendorf</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 11 Jun 2019 12:39:06 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 4 Nov 2019 23:07:54 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 4 Nov 2019 23:02:06 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.9</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16891886" author="oota" created="Wed, 24 Jul 2019 14:07:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am not good at English and I use a translation site.&lt;br/&gt;
StringUtils.abbreviate behaves the same as NULL if the second argument abbrevMarker is empty.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16965426" author="ramesh dhungel" created="Sat, 2 Nov 2019 17:10:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In StringUtils.abbreviate in line 335 you are checking if the string is empty or the abbreviation marker is empty and if one of them is true its returning the original string. This means that for the string &quot;much too long text&quot; it is not empty however it is returning the exact string without the abbreviation because the abbreviation is empty. You can fix this by checking if only the string is empty and returning the string then add another if statement to check if the abbreviation is empty or null if it is then you would return the string abbreviated. However this causes an issue due to incorrect test case in line 305 in StringUtilsTest. It states that the max width is 10 and passes in the string&quot;paranaguacu&quot; which is a 11 letter string. However the excepted string is &quot;paranaguacu&quot; rather than &quot;paranaguac&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16967078" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 4 Nov 2019 23:02:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In git master. Please verify and close.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16967083" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 4 Nov 2019 23:07:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=Ramesh+Dhungel&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;Ramesh Dhungel&quot;&gt;Ramesh Dhungel&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you for your detailed feedback. Please feel free to submit a PR on GitHub.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12310220" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate">

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1462] After version Commons-lang3.4 DateFormatUtils has a bug</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1462</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The code is as follows &#65306;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Calendar cale = Calendar.getInstance();&lt;br/&gt;
 System.out.println(&quot;Old time is &quot; + DateFormatUtils.format(cale, &quot;yyyyMMddHHmmss&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
 cale.setTimeZone(TimeZone.getTimeZone(&quot;JST&quot;));&lt;br/&gt;
 System.out.println(&quot;New time is &quot; + DateFormatUtils.format(cale, &quot;yyyyMMddHHmmss&quot;));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The results of commons-lang3 3.4&#65306;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Old time is 20190605144536&lt;br/&gt;
New time is 20190605154536&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The results of the version after commons-lang3 3.4:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Old time is 20190605144536&lt;br/&gt;
New time is 20190605144536&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We found that the time zone setting was invalidated when it was formatted&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13237655">LANG-1462</key>
            <summary>After version Commons-lang3.4 DateFormatUtils has a bug</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="elunlng">Lijun Liang</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 5 Jun 2019 06:49:22 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 12 Nov 2020 08:09:16 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.5</version>
                    <version>3.6</version>
                    <version>3.7</version>
                    <version>3.8</version>
                    <version>3.9</version>
                    <version>3.8.1</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>7</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16882631" author="aavanathan" created="Thu, 11 Jul 2019 03:38:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Alternatively, you could use this method post 3.4&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Alternatively you could use &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; &quot;&lt;/span&gt;+DateFormatUtils.format(cale,&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyyMMddHHmmss&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, TimeZone.getTimeZone(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;JST&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)));&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16882633" author="aavanathan" created="Thu, 11 Jul 2019 03:39:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Result:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Old time is 20190710203809
New time is 20190710203809
Alternatively you could use &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; 20190711123809&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16882642" author="aavanathan" created="Thu, 11 Jul 2019 04:15:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=britter&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;britter&quot;&gt;Benedikt Ritter&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory1&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory1&quot;&gt;Gary Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&#160;In DateFormatUtils.java, we have this&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; format(Calendar calendar, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; pattern) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; format((Calendar)calendar, pattern, (TimeZone)&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;, (Locale)&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;We could replace it with&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; format(Calendar calendar, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; pattern) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; format((Calendar)calendar, pattern, calendar.getTimeZone(), (Locale)&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Let me know what you guys think &amp;amp; if you agree, I could open a PR.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16883486" author="elunlng" created="Fri, 12 Jul 2019 02:58:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Avanathan, I think it&apos;s the best solution.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16896989" author="tai" created="Wed, 31 Jul 2019 09:37:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=aavanathan&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;aavanathan&quot;&gt;Arun Avanathan&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;tt&gt;calendar.getTimeZone()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/b&gt; may get it &lt;font color=&quot;red&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;NullPointerException&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think we should leave exceptions to concrete method Implement instead of throwing them too early, thus losing internal details.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; format(Calendar calendar, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; pattern) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; format(calendar, pattern, (calendar == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; ? &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; : calendar.getTimeZone()), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16923034" author="guoping1" created="Thu, 5 Sep 2019 03:48:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The TimeZone parameter of the format method is used to create an instance of FastDateFormat with an empty default value, so I don&apos;t think this is a BUG.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Just need to modify the method description.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17230387" author="arturobernalg" created="Thu, 12 Nov 2020 06:47:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=elunlng&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;elunlng&quot;&gt;Lijun Liang&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Could you check the problem? I&apos;m sure that solve in the new versions&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Calendar cale = Calendar.getInstance();
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Old time is &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + DateFormatUtils.format(cale, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyyMMddHHmmss&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
 cale.setTimeZone(TimeZone.getTimeZone(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;JST&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;New time is &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + DateFormatUtils.format(cale, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyyMMddHHmmss&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The result that I get seems correct&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Old time is 20201112073806&lt;br/&gt;
 New time is 20201112073806&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17230411" author="elunlng" created="Thu, 12 Nov 2020 08:09:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Arturo Bernal,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160; &#160;&#160;The result of code execution before and after setting the time zone is the same, and we expect to be able to set the time zone correctly. thank you for your feedback&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

            <title>[LANG-1460] Trivial: year of release for 3.9 says 2018, should be 2019</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1460</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/release-history.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Release History&lt;/a&gt; says &lt;tt&gt;2018-04-09&lt;/tt&gt; for version 3.9, but the correct year is &lt;tt&gt;2019&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Change submitted in &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/427&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;PR#427&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1454] ToStringStyle.appendClassName() should use isUseShortClassName()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1454</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I tried to implement a custom &lt;tt&gt;ToStringStyle&lt;/tt&gt; and I wanted to get the short class name in the printed text. My first thought was to override the method &lt;tt&gt;isUseShortClassName&lt;/tt&gt; in the subclass to make it returns always &lt;tt&gt;true&lt;/tt&gt;, but unexpectedly this didn&apos;t work, as the &lt;tt&gt;protected&lt;/tt&gt; method &lt;tt&gt;appendClassName(final StringBuffer buffer, final Object object)&lt;/tt&gt; doesn&apos;t use the boolean getter and directly access the &lt;tt&gt;private boolean useShortClassName&lt;/tt&gt; member.&lt;br/&gt;
I think the &lt;tt&gt;appendClassName&lt;/tt&gt; method should act the same way, for example, the method &lt;tt&gt;appendIdentityHashCode&lt;/tt&gt; does, i.e. accessing the &lt;tt&gt;private boolean useIdentityHashCode&lt;/tt&gt; by its getter. &lt;br/&gt;
Thank you.&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13230625">LANG-1454</key>
            <summary>ToStringStyle.appendClassName() should use isUseShortClassName()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="gvespucci">Giorgio Vespucci</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 29 Apr 2019 07:43:32 +0000</created>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1453] StringUtils.removeIgnoreCase(&quot;&#304;a&quot;, &quot;a&quot;) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1453</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;try&lt;/b&gt; &lt;/p&gt;
{

String s = StringUtils._removeIgnoreCase_(&quot;&#304;a&quot;, &quot;a&quot;);

}
&lt;p&gt; &lt;b&gt;catch&lt;/b&gt; (Exception e) &lt;/p&gt;
{

e.printStackTrace();

}

&lt;p&gt;output&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: start 3, end 2, s.length() 2&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(AbstractStringBuilder.java:539)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13229876">LANG-1453</key>
            <summary>StringUtils.removeIgnoreCase(&quot;&#304;a&quot;, &quot;a&quot;) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="neerup">Thomas Neerup</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 24 Apr 2019 13:28:23 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 11 Sep 2019 18:51:13 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 11 Sep 2019 18:50:33 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.8.1</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.text.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>5</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="9600">2h 40m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16827739" author="alanmehio" created="Sat, 27 Apr 2019 20:12:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is also verified on&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JDK 12.0.1&#160; under window 10&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;on commons-lang3 version&#160;3.10-SNAPSHOT&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have adding&#160; the below line to StringUtilsTest&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;@Test&lt;br/&gt;
 public void testRemoveIgnoreCase_String()&lt;/p&gt;

{ &#160; .... assertEquals(&quot;&#304;&quot;, StringUtils.removeIgnoreCase(&quot;&#304;a&quot;, &quot;a&quot;)); }

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The method fails&#160; with the same exception reported as above.&#160; &#160;I wonder about the character set for &quot;&#304;&quot; is not &quot;i&quot;&#160; or &quot;I&quot;.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16835215" author="gtorres" created="Wed, 8 May 2019 00:31:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I figured out the cause of this bug and&#160;found a solution.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In StringUtils.replace the replacement process is performed based on the indexes of the substrings on the lowercase version of the input strings. When we have this String &#8220;&#304;a&#8221; (&lt;a href=&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dotted_and_dotless_I&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Dotted uppercase &#8220;I&#8221;&lt;/a&gt; followed by an &#8220;a&#8221;) and try to get the lowercase version of this String something weird occurs. As dotted lowercase &#8220;I&#8221; doesn&#8217;t exist a lowercase &#8220;i&#8221; and a &lt;a href=&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_(diacritic)&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;dot&lt;/a&gt; is returned (&#8220;i&#183;a&#8221;). As you noticed the input is 2 characters length and the output have 3 characters length, so when the &#8220;a&#8221; is tried to be removed from the original string &#8220;&#304;a&#8221; the index of the &#8220;a&#8221; is taken as 2 as it is on the lowercase version &#8220;i&#183;a&#8221; but that index is out of the bounds of the original string and the exception is thrown. Also, with these parameters StringUtils.removeIgnoreCase(&quot;&#304;ash&quot;, &quot;a&quot;) the exception won&#8217;t happen instead of, &#160;the next string will be returned &#8220;&#304;ah&#8221; that is totally wrong because the length of the normal string and the lowercase version are different.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This character &#8220;&#304;&#8221; is the only one from this list &lt;a href=&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_(diacritic)&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_(diacritic)&lt;/a&gt; that makes that the Strings that contain this character causes that the toLowerCase method returns a string with a bigger size but toUpperCase method returns a String with the same size.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I already send a pull request changing the following lines of the replace method:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;From:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if (ignoreCase)&lt;/p&gt;

{ &#160; &#160; searchText = text.toLowerCase(); &#160; &#160; searchString = searchString.toLowerCase(); }

&lt;p&gt;To:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;if (ignoreCase)&lt;/p&gt;

{ &#160; &#160; searchText = text.toUpperCase(); &#160; &#160; searchString = searchString.toUpperCase(); }

&lt;p&gt;I had some problems adding the test, this character &#8220;&#304;&#8221; was uploaded as a question mark, I asked for help in a GitHub comment on the commit.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16835223" author="chtompki" created="Wed, 8 May 2019 00:56:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There are some curiosities when dealing with Unicode characters that are outside the standard UTF-8 character set. I&#8217;m working on a separate set of UnicodeStringUtils due to the slow running nature of dealing with &#8220;surrogate pairs.&#8221;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16835855" author="gtorres" created="Wed, 8 May 2019 19:48:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This issue is the same that &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1406&quot; title=&quot;StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase()&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1406&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1406&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; and realized that the solution&#160;I found doesn&apos;t work. There are more characters that have the same problem when are converted to lowercase&#160;or uppercase.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16923235" author="guoping1" created="Thu, 5 Sep 2019 09:42:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Since case mappings are not always 1:1 char mappings, the resulting may be a different length than the original&#65292; so&#160;String#toUpperCase &amp;amp; String#toLowerCase can&apos;t be used with&#160; String#indexOf which to find position.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;How to fix this problem? I think we should use regex. I will try it later.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16923376" author="guoping1" created="Thu, 5 Sep 2019 12:33:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;      Add replace method in RegExUtils.java&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; replace(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; text, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; regex, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; replacement, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; max,
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; ignoreCase) {
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (text == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; || regex == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; || replacement == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; || max == 0) {
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; text;
		}
		Pattern pattern = ignoreCase ? Pattern.compile(regex, Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE) : Pattern.compile(regex);
		Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(text);

		&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; result = matcher.find();

		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!result) {
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; text;
		}

		&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;StringBuffer&lt;/span&gt; sb = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;StringBuffer&lt;/span&gt;();
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;do&lt;/span&gt; {
			matcher.appendReplacement(sb, replacement);
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (--max == 0) {
				&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;break&lt;/span&gt;;
			}
			result = matcher.find();
		} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (result);
		matcher.appendTail(sb);
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; sb.toString();
	}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;       Modify the replace method in StringUtils.java &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; replace(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; text, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; searchString, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; replacement, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; max, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; ignoreCase) {
             &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (isEmpty(text) || isEmpty(searchString) || replacement == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; || max == 0) {
                   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; text;
             }
             &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; RegExUtils.replace(text, searchString, replacement, max, ignoreCase);
         }
         
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;         Let&apos;s test it together.&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="16923740" author="gtorres" created="Thu, 5 Sep 2019 21:24:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;See&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1406&quot; title=&quot;StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase()&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1406&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1406&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&#160;last comments, this is the same issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16926722" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 10 Sep 2019 15:16:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note that this is related to the issues that calling toLowerCase() and toUpperCase() without using a target Locale leads to unexpected results in some cases, please see &lt;a href=&quot;https://garygregory.wordpress.com/2015/11/03/java-lowercase-conversion-turkey/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://garygregory.wordpress.com/2015/11/03/java-lowercase-conversion-turkey/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think I will create a PR to help with this kind of conversion and add null-safe APIs as &lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.toRootLowerCase(String) and&#160;&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.toRootUpperCase(String)&lt;/tt&gt;{{}}&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16927355" author="guoping1" created="Wed, 11 Sep 2019 08:03:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi, &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
It doesn&apos;t work either.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;String#toUpperCase &amp;amp; String#toLowerCase are not always 1:1 char mappings, the resulting may be a different length than the original.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16927898" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 11 Sep 2019 18:50:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In git master, please verify and close.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1452] MultilineRecursiveToStringStyle produces wrong output for BigDecimal</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1452</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Class has 2 BigDecimal fields:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
BigDecimal biddecimal123 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;123&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
BigDecimal biddecimal456 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;456&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;MultilineRecursiveToStringStyle produces this output:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;BDToString@36baf30c[&lt;br/&gt;
 biddecimal123=java.math.BigDecimal@7adf9f5f[&lt;br/&gt;
 intVal=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&lt;br/&gt;
 scale=0&lt;br/&gt;
 ],&lt;br/&gt;
 biddecimal456=java.math.BigDecimal@63961c42[&lt;br/&gt;
 intVal=&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&lt;br/&gt;
 scale=0&lt;br/&gt;
 ]&lt;br/&gt;
 ]&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ToStringStyle.MULTI_LINE_STYLE doesn&apos;t have this problem. It was introduced with method&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Override
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void appendDetail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;StringBuffer&lt;/span&gt; buffer, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fieldName, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;of MultilineRecursiveToStringStyle. It doesnt&apos;n treat BigDecimal as a primitive type. So I had to do the following to solve my issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;FixedMultilineRecursiveToStringStyle &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; MultilineRecursiveToStringStyle{
    @Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void appendDetail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;StringBuffer&lt;/span&gt; buffer, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fieldName, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; value) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!BigDecimal.&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class.&lt;/span&gt;equals(value.getClass())){
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.appendDetail(buffer, fieldName, value);
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
            buffer.append(value);
        }
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1448] Commons-Lang3; StringUtils JavaDoc page wrong for containsOnly and containsNone</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1448</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;TLDR: &apos;xxx&apos; is not java and can never compile.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The descriptions of the&#160;containsOnly(&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/CharSequence.html?is-external=true&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;CharSequence&lt;/a&gt;&#160;cs, char...&#160;valid) and containsNone(&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/CharSequence.html?is-external=true&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;CharSequence&lt;/a&gt;&#160;cs, char...&#160;valid) methods contain incorrect examples.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;One such bad example:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.containsOnly(&quot;abab&quot;, &apos;abc&apos;) = true&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is not Java code&#160;and can never compile.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The description of the containsAny(&lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/CharSequence.html?is-external=true&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;CharSequence&lt;/a&gt;&#160;cs, char...&#160;valid) method does contain correct examples.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;One such correct example:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.containsAny(&quot;zzabyycdxx&quot;,&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;#39;z&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;a&amp;#39;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;) = true&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13227478">LANG-1448</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1445] NumberUtils.createNumber() incorrectly creates BigDecimal when a double type is specified</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1445</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.createNumber(Double.valueOf(Double.MIN_VALUE).toString() + &quot;D&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.createNumber(Double.valueOf(Double.MIN_VALUE).toString() + &quot;F&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;are incorrectly creating BigDecimals.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is due to a bug:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;if (!(d.isInfinite() || d.floatValue() == 0.0D &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !allZeros)) {&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;which should be:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;if (!(d.isInfinite() || d.doubleValue() == 0.0D &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !allZeros)) {&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A patch has been attached.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13226856">LANG-1445</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils.createNumber() incorrectly creates BigDecimal when a double type is specified</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1444] NumberUtils.createNumber() does not create BigDecimal for decimal fractions tending to zero</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1444</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following code demonstrates the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.1&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.00001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.0000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.00000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.0000000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.000000000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.00000000000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.0000000000000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.000000000000000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;System.out.println(NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;1.00000000000000000000001&quot;).getClass().getName());&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;will print:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Double&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Double&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Double&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Double&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Float&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It seems the problem is towards the bottom of the createNumber method that compares the float to double string representation:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;f.toString().equals(d.toString())&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For the misbehaving tests, the string &quot;1.0&quot;.equals(&quot;1.0&quot;)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13226614">LANG-1444</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils.createNumber() does not create BigDecimal for decimal fractions tending to zero</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="costat">Costa Theodosiou</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 8 Apr 2019 04:28:32 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 26 Feb 2021 11:07:34 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.8.1</version>
                                                    <component>lang.math.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="6600">1h 50m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16812672" author="chtompki" created="Mon, 8 Apr 2019 18:09:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This happens because &lt;tt&gt;Double.valueOf(&quot;1.000000000000001&quot;) = 1.000000000000001&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;Double.valueOf(&quot;1.0000000000000001&quot;) = 1.0&lt;/tt&gt;. In the latter case because we&apos;ve lost the precision, it no longer matters whether we store the number as a Double or a Float, so we use a Float because it&apos;s been truncated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1440] Predefined  ISO_8601_EXTENDED_* patterns use wrong timezone offset formatter</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1440</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;As observed in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1439&quot; title=&quot;FastDateParser throws NumberFormatException when parsing a long number based on a ISO8601 string&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1439&quot;&gt;LANG-1439&lt;/a&gt;, the offset formatters must be &lt;tt&gt;XXX&lt;/tt&gt; instead of &lt;tt&gt;ZZ&lt;/tt&gt; to be ISO 8601 compliant. This is purely my bad, it was renamed in pre-Java 7 which did not have &lt;tt&gt;XXX&lt;/tt&gt;. This must be fixed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13224981">LANG-1440</key>
            <summary>Predefined  ISO_8601_EXTENDED_* patterns use wrong timezone offset formatter</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="michael-o">Michael Osipov</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="michael-o">Michael Osipov</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:11:11 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:16:18 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:16:18 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.8.1</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1439] FastDateParser throws NumberFormatException when parsing a long number based on a ISO8601 string</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1439</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Given this piece of code:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testParseLongNumber() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; DateParser fdf = getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ssZZ&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        fdf.parse(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;999999999999&quot;&lt;/span&gt;); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// NFE here
&lt;/span&gt;    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Internally, the &lt;b&gt;FastDateParser.NumberStrategy::parse&lt;/b&gt; method parses the year from that number (without maxWidth because the next part is not a number) using &lt;b&gt;Integer::parseInt&lt;/b&gt; thus leading to a NumberFormatException.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A quick fix for this would be catching the NFE then return false after setting the error position so that the FastDateParse::Parse method can throw a ParseException correctly.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Edit: the suggested patch is attached below&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13222295">LANG-1439</key>
            <summary>FastDateParser throws NumberFormatException when parsing a long number based on a ISO8601 string</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="foly">Nghia Nguyen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 18 Mar 2019 11:48:09 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:25:26 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.8.1</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16795007" author="michael-o" created="Mon, 18 Mar 2019 13:21:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The given format is not ISO 8601 compliant. &lt;tt&gt;999999999999&lt;/tt&gt; is larger than &lt;tt&gt;Integer.MAX_VALUE&lt;/tt&gt;. I just checked the standard, chapter 3.5 says that &quot;Year&quot; must be a four-digit value. By mutual agreement between parties it can be negative or &amp;gt; 9999 (which we don&apos;t have here). So the parse is broken here. Simply wrapping the exception is wrong.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16795043" author="foly" created="Mon, 18 Mar 2019 14:03:01 +0000"  >&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;The given format is not ISO 8601 compliant&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;It is not the ISO 8601 extended format ? FYI I took that pattern from the DateFormatUtils class&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    /**
     * ISO 8601 formatter &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; date-time with time zone.
     *
     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;
     * The format used is {@code yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ssZZ}. This format uses the
     * &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;default&lt;/span&gt; TimeZone in effect at the time of loading DateFormatUtils class.
     * &amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
     *
     * @since 3.5
     */
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; FastDateFormat ISO_8601_EXTENDED_DATETIME_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT
            = FastDateFormat.getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ssZZ&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;So the parse is broken here. Simply wrapping the exception is wrong.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Yeah I thought so, I&apos;ll try to investigate further&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16795138" author="michael-o" created="Mon, 18 Mar 2019 16:00:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for pointing out. &lt;tt&gt;ZZ&lt;/tt&gt; is plain wrong. It must be &lt;tt&gt;XXX&lt;/tt&gt;. I will revise the code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16805772" author="michael-o" created="Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:16:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;ZZ&lt;/tt&gt; is correct. Is has different semantics compared to &lt;tt&gt;SimpleDateFormat&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16805777" author="michael-o" created="Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:25:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I just checked the code. One code switch to &lt;tt&gt;Long&lt;/tt&gt;, but the entire code is built around ints. It would also require an &lt;tt&gt;ISO_YEAR_STRATEGY&lt;/tt&gt; to enforce bounds.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                <issuelinks>
                            <issuelinktype id="10030">

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1433] MethodUtils will throw a NPE if invokeMethod() is called for a var-args method</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1433</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Whenever calling a var-args method using invokeMethod() of MethodUtils it will throw a NPE if the last parameter value is null. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example: Given is the following class with var-args method&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;MyClass {
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; myMethod(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;... args) {
      ...
   }

   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; myMethod(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;... args) {
      ...
   }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The following code will work:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
MethodUtils.invokeMethod(myObject, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;myMethod&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;c&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;But this will throw a NPE:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
MethodUtils.invokeMethod(myObject, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;myMethod&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;b&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Further more it is not deterministic which method of the two will be called if the method search of invokeMethod() can not find a single unique match. So the code&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
MethodUtils.invokeMethod(myObject, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;myMethod&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt;[] {&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;});
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;might call any of the two methods of MyClass and it might change with each and every invocation. The search is not deterministic due to Class.getMethods () is not deterministic.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I would categorize such a method call as a bug, due to it should not be the intention of the developer to just pick any of the methods. However, debugging such an issue is really hard if the &quot;right&quot; method is called &quot;sometimes&quot; and it can be solved by just doing a sort, which should be no big deal I belive.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13216841">LANG-1433</key>
            <summary>MethodUtils will throw a NPE if invokeMethod() is called for a var-args method</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>

                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="cfranzen">Christian Franzen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 20 Feb 2019 08:44:33 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 17 Feb 2020 17:57:09 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 17 Feb 2020 17:57:09 +0000</resolved>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1432] FastDateFormat doesn&apos;t parse time string with timezone correctly</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1432</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FastDateFormat doesn&apos;t parse the pattern correctly :&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;EEE MMM dd HH:mm:ss zzz yyyy&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The test code is as following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// code placeholder
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;TestFastDateFormat {
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; ParseException {
    Date d = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Date();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; dstr = d.toString();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(dstr);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; pattern = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;EEE MMM dd HH:mm:ss zzz yyyy&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
    FastDateFormat fdf = FastDateFormat.getInstance(pattern,
        Locale.US);
    Date d1 = fdf.parse(dstr);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(d1);

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Use SimpleDateFormat to parse string
&lt;/span&gt;    SimpleDateFormat sdf = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; SimpleDateFormat(pattern);
    Date d2 = sdf.parse(dstr);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(d2);
  }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The test result example:&lt;br/&gt;
 Tue Feb 12 16:07:53 CST 2019&#160; &#160; /// this is origin result&lt;br/&gt;
 Wed Feb 13 06:07:53 CST 2019&#160; &#160;/// this is result of FastDateTime.parse()&lt;br/&gt;
 Tue Feb 12 16:07:53 CST 2019&#160; &#160; /// this is result of SimpleDateFormat.parse()&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;jdk 1.8&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13215176">LANG-1432</key>
            <summary>FastDateFormat doesn&apos;t parse time string with timezone correctly</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="simon_xianyu">Simon Xianyu</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 12 Feb 2019 08:21:35 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:01:57 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.8.1</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16793930" author="ph26" created="Fri, 15 Mar 2019 20:41:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Precondition (implicit in submitter&apos;s example):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;default&#160;timezone China (which has an ambiguous abbreviation CST)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Expected by submitter:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;FastDateTime.parse interprets a CST date as China Standard Time (UTC+8)&lt;br/&gt;
like SimpleDateFormat.parse apparently does.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Found:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;FastDateTime.parse interprets a CST date as Central&#160;Standard Time (UTC-6).&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;What might&#160;be best&#160;for&#160;an ambiguous timezone like CST:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;choose the most likely&#160;interpretation if the parser&apos;s timezone is in the same region?&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;choose a consistent interpretation if the parser&apos;s&#160;timezone is in another region?&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;throw an exception because the parse is ambiguous?&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;make it depend on whether the parse is strict or lenient?&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;use whatever java.time does since Java 8 instead?&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16795676" author="simon_xianyu" created="Tue, 19 Mar 2019 04:53:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, I&apos;m in China and the default timezone is Asia/Shanghai.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&#160;think &quot;&#160;choose the most likely&#160;interpretation if the parser&apos;s timezone is in the same region&quot; is better&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16805769" author="michael-o" created="Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:01:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;d be inclined to closed to this one because using &lt;tt&gt;zzz&lt;/tt&gt; is a plain broken approach and those three-letter codes are ambigious. Use, wherever you can, ISO 8601 along with &lt;tt&gt;XXX&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
