<item>
            <title>[LANG-1430] ExceptionUtils#getRootCause(Throwable t)  does not work as documented in javadoc</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1430</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In version 3.8 the following bugfix was introduced:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1364&quot; title=&quot;ExceptionUtils#getRootCause(Throwable t) should return t if no lower level cause exists&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1364&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1364&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: ExceptionUtils#getRootCause(Throwable t) should return t if no lower level cause exists Thanks to Zheng Xie.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In general I agree with the consistency it brings, but now the javadocs is not agreeing with the way it actually works.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
/**
168 * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Introspects the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;Throwable&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to obtain the root cause.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
169 *
170 * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;This method walks through the exception chain to the last element,
171 * &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;root&quot;&lt;/span&gt; of the tree, using {@link Throwable#getCause()}, and
172 * returns that exception.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
173 *
174 * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;From version 2.2, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; method handles recursive cause structures
175 * that might otherwise cause infinite loops. If the throwable parameter
176 * has a cause of itself, then &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; will be returned. If the throwable
177 * parameter cause chain loops, the last element in the chain before the
178 * loop is returned.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
179 *
180 * @param throwable the throwable to get the root cause &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt;, may be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;
181 * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; the root cause of the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;Throwable&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;,
182 * &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; throwable input
183 */

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The sentence&#160;at line 175/176 should be something like:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
If the throwable parameter has a cause of itself, then itself will be returned.&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;As the method will not return null, but itself instead, as of the fix &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1364&quot; title=&quot;ExceptionUtils#getRootCause(Throwable t) should return t if no lower level cause exists&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1364&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1364&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13210166">LANG-1430</key>
            <summary>ExceptionUtils#getRootCause(Throwable t)  does not work as documented in javadoc</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="fverhoef">Frans Verhoef</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 17 Jan 2019 14:24:08 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 17 Jan 2019 14:26:40 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.8</version>
                    <version>3.8.1</version>
                                                    <component>lang.exception.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>

                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1429] Behavioral inconsistencies across different wrap length</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1429</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Method name:&#160;WordUtils.wrap&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The behavior is inconsistent across the two tests about whether the&lt;br/&gt;
leading space of string should be retained or not while wrapping. The&lt;br/&gt;
string &#8220; This is a sentence with leading whitespace.&#8221; retains the leading&lt;br/&gt;
whitespace over wrap length 50, but removes it at a wrap length 30.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, the trailing spaces are not preserved while wrapping, as shown below:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; nl = &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.lineSeparator();
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Did you say &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + nl + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\&quot;&lt;/span&gt;supercalifr&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; + nl + &quot;&lt;/span&gt;agilisticexp&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; + nl + &quot;&lt;/span&gt;ialidocious?&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; + nl + &quot;&lt;/span&gt;\&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; How &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;do&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + nl + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;you spell&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + nl + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;that odd&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + nl + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;word,&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + nl + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;anyways?&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, WordUtils.wrap(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Did you say \&quot;&lt;/span&gt;supercalifragilisticexpialidocious?\&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; How &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;do&lt;/span&gt; you spell that odd word, anyways?&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, 12,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// fails&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13206937">LANG-1429</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1426] JavaDoc issue on StringUtils.truncate</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1426</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Two of the examples on the method StringUtils.truncate(String, int, int) are incorrect:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;StringUtils.truncate(&quot;abcdefghijklmno&quot;, Integer.MIN_VALUE, 10) = &quot;abcdefghij&quot;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;StringUtils.truncate(&quot;abcdefghijklmno&quot;, Integer.MIN_VALUE, Integer.MAX_VALUE) = &quot;abcdefghijklmno&quot;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Both of the above actually throw IllegalArgumentException&apos;s.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13203536">LANG-1426</key>
            <summary>JavaDoc issue on StringUtils.truncate</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

                            <comment id="16794293" author="brower" created="Sat, 16 Mar 2019 15:49:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=suraj+gautam&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;suraj gautam&quot;&gt;Suraj Gautam&lt;/a&gt; I am aware of that. I am saying that the JavaDoc for the two examples above claim that the method will&#160;&lt;b&gt;not&lt;/b&gt; throw an exception, but it is obvious that they&#160;&lt;b&gt;should&lt;/b&gt; throw an exception. <item>
            <title>[LANG-1425] DateUtils.parseDateStrictly() is not parsing millisecond value</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1425</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We need to parse String to java.util.Date and are having multiple Date formats.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Snippet for this is &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java.util.Date dt = DateUtils.parseDateStrictly(verificationDate.get_value(),
&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;Locale.ENGLISH,
&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] { &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ss.SSSSSSSXXX&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm::ss.SSSSSSS&quot;&lt;/span&gt; });&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;2018-11-13T08:03:41.2860000-06:00 is not being parsed correctly. On troubleshooting, we discovered that 2018-11-13T08:03:41.0000286-06:00 is parsing fine.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;How to handle this?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13199145">LANG-1425</key>
            <summary>DateUtils.parseDateStrictly() is not parsing millisecond value</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="VamsiBhagi">Vamsi Krishna Bhagi</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 18 Nov 2018 06:59:59 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 18 Nov 2018 09:29:56 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.7</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16690846" author="michael-o" created="Sun, 18 Nov 2018 09:28:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There are several issues here:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;How close is our parsing pattern to &lt;tt&gt;SimpleDateFormat&lt;/tt&gt;? Not properly documented&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;Date&lt;/tt&gt; is millisecond precision: &lt;tt&gt;SSSSSSS&lt;/tt&gt; cannot and will not work.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;S&lt;/tt&gt; alreay implies upto three decimal places while parsing, during formatting it shall add trailing null at most, as far as I remember.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I guess we need to improve docs and tests. I stumbled upon this some time ago too.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also look here: &lt;a href=&quot;https://stackoverflow.com/a/19223267/696632&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://stackoverflow.com/a/19223267/696632&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you really need more precision, consider using new Java Time API.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1420] TypeUtils.isAssignable returns wrong result for GenericArrayType and ParameterizedType</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1420</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;TypeUtils.isAssignable returns a wrong result when checking whether a ParameterizedType is assignable to a GenericArrayType that has the same ParameterizedType as component type.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
ParameterizedType componentType = TypeUtils.parameterize(java.lang.reflect.Constructor.class, java.awt.Insets.class);
GenericArrayType arrayType = TypeUtils.genericArrayType(componentType);&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In this case,&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
TypeUtils.isAssignable(arrayType, componentType) &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;returns true, but this should be false (the component type should not be assignable to the array type - the Java compiler complains about this).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It seem that the problem is that the method:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; isAssignable(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Type type, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; ParameterizedType toParameterizedType, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Map&amp;lt;TypeVariable&amp;lt;?&amp;gt;, Type&amp;gt; typeVarAssigns)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;only&#160;compares the type parameters, since method getTypeArguments retrieves the component type using&#160;getGenericComponentType. There seems to be no check whether an array type is being assigned to a non-array in the first place.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13184815">LANG-1420</key>
            <summary>TypeUtils.isAssignable returns wrong result for GenericArrayType and ParameterizedType</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="gofraser">Gordon Fraser</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 13 Sep 2018 08:05:46 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 15 Nov 2020 16:50:22 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 15 Nov 2020 16:50:22 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.7</version>
                    <version>3.8</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.12.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.reflect.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="3000">50m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16713451" author="rosti-il" created="Sat, 8 Dec 2018 01:01:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Adding following check into the suspected method fixes it:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (type &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; GenericArrayType) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
        }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Is it the right fix and should this check also be added into other private &lt;tt&gt;isAssignable()&lt;/tt&gt; methods where the second parameter isn&apos;t &lt;tt&gt;GenericArrayType&lt;/tt&gt; ?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16713825" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 9 Dec 2018 00:49:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=gofraser&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;gofraser&quot;&gt;Gordon Fraser&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you for your report. Feel free to provide a PR on GitHub. Ideally, it should come with a unit test that fails without changes to the main code tree.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1419] Restore BundleSymbolicName / regression in version 3.8.0</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1419</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In contrast to version 3.7.0 the BundleSymbolicName changed erroneously in 3.8.0 to:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
org.apache.commons.commons-lang3&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As this breaks existing installations the change should be reverted and a new version with OSGi support should be released.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1418] Incorrect Javadoc for StringUtils.isAnyBlank(null)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1418</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;As of &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html#isAnyBlank-java.lang.CharSequence...-&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html#isAnyBlank-java.lang.CharSequence...-&lt;/a&gt;&#160;isAnyBlank((String) null) -&amp;gt;&#160;true&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But test isAnyBlank((String) null) -&amp;gt; false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As the result incorrect description for the other methods that used isAnyBlank&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13183306">LANG-1418</key>
            <summary>Incorrect Javadoc for StringUtils.isAnyBlank(null)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Veshtard">Andrei</reporter>

                            <comment id="16657736" author="oleg.chubaryov" created="Sat, 20 Oct 2018 05:10:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;How does this test pass?&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;public class StringUtilsEmptyBlankTest {...&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;&#160; &#160; @Test&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;&#160; &#160; public void testIsAnyBlank() {&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; assertTrue(StringUtils.isAnyBlank((String) null));&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;...&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Most likely bug in Intellij IDEA.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16794259" author="ph26" created="Sat, 16 Mar 2019 13:57:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Refactor Extract Method and Evaluate Expression to call the extracted method produces result = true.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So it looks&#160;like the javaDoc is correct after all, and that it is just a bug in IntelliJ IDEA Evaluate Expression. I suspect&#160;it is passing null as&#160;the array of a variable number of String arguments instead of as the only String in a variable argument list. When the call is extracted as a method, javac evaluates it as expected.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1414] commons.componentId is incorrectly set to lang3</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1414</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;It looks like the property commons.componentId&#160;should be set to lang and not to lang3. See &lt;a href=&quot;https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/304129bf7d25a2118ee3f324214c04e1e8f0846e7ee43a57b100a26e@%3Cdev.commons.apache.org%3E&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/304129bf7d25a2118ee3f324214c04e1e8f0846e7ee43a57b100a26e@%3Cdev.commons.apache.org%3E&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We need to find out whether this breaks something and then change the componentId.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13180545">LANG-1414</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1409] Crashes when testing StringUtils and CharSequenceUtils</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1409</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The attached test suites for&#160;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils.java&lt;/tt&gt; and&#160;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.lang3.CharSequenceUtils.java&lt;/tt&gt; come from a prototype I have been working on which combines static analysis and automated test generation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The prototype analyses a specified dependency of a project to identify risky API calls which may potentially lead to runtime exceptions. Runtime exceptions may occur either because&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;an API lacks sufficient documentation,or&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;usage of the API does not conform to the specification, or&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;API wrapper does not indicate the API specification as part of its own specification.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;


&lt;p&gt;The prototype then automatically generates test cases which show how such exceptions may be triggered.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Observation:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For &lt;tt&gt;commons-lang&lt;/tt&gt;,&#160;&lt;tt&gt;JDK APIs&lt;/tt&gt; were analyzed. It seems that the failing methods do not handle the potential runtime exceptions which may or may not have been declared/documented for the JDK APIs they invoke.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Possible fixes:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The failing methods under test could add internal checks on the values they forward to the &lt;tt&gt;JDK APIs&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The failing methods could handle the exceptions by adding relevant try/catch blocks.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The failing methods under test could specify the potential exceptions by adding &lt;tt&gt;@throws&lt;/tt&gt; in their documentation/method signatures.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS, and McOs High Sierra-10.13.5 &lt;br/&gt;
 Junit-4.12&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13178123">LANG-1409</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1406] StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1406</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;STEPS TO REPRODUCE:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\u0130x&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;x&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &quot;&quot;)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;EXPECTED: &quot;\u0130&quot; is returned.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ACTUAL: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This happens because the replace method is assuming that text.length() == text.toLowerCase().length(), which is not true for certain characters.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13176106">LANG-1406</key>
            <summary>StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="michaelryan">Michael Ryan</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 1 Aug 2018 12:21:29 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 1 Jun 2020 06:39:41 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 11 Sep 2019 13:44:19 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>3.10</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="14400">4h</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16573108" author="hiukwok" created="Wed, 8 Aug 2018 12:01:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi all,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;After a bit of research, it seem to be a&#160;known issue&#160;when unicode is contained on a String object (&lt;a href=&quot;https://www.quora.com/Is-Javas-toLowercase-string-method-reliable-for-Unicode&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;ref&lt;/a&gt; ),&#160;String.toLowerCase() would produce a incorrect result.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In this case&#160;&quot;\u0130&quot; would become a String object with three char which are &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&#160;i, &#160;&#775;, x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; instead of &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&#160;&#304;, x&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So by given a incorrect result from .toLowCase() method,&#160;StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase end attempt to access the segment of string which is not exist which is 3 in this case while str.length() is 2.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The fixture I come up with is replacing the .toLowcase() to .toUpperCase() in order to avoid the mis-interprettion on .toLowerCase while performing case-insensitive comparisons.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16573123" author="githubbot" created="Wed, 8 Aug 2018 12:13:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user HiuKwok opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1406&quot; title=&quot;StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase()&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1406&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1406&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;  StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Fix for Lang-1406 to avoid any exception while performing String.UTils.replaceIgnoreCase() against uniCode String object. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Plz let me if there have any extra things need to be done for this PR since I am the first timer for commons-lang project( add more test case?).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    All the best&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/HiuKwok/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/HiuKwok/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; master&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    This closes #340&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;p&gt;commit e0f6c7802b5e721019a602bf30b31c79dbf6d233&lt;br/&gt;
Author: Hiu Kwok &amp;lt;hiufkwok@...&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Date:   2018-08-08T11:44:51Z&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    toUpperCase() &amp;gt; toLowerCase() to avoid unicode string length miscalculation&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;commit 590f90889bf61a5570bd98b78e73410a07d7410b&lt;br/&gt;
Author: Hiu Kwok &amp;lt;hiufkwok@...&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Date:   2018-08-08T11:46:29Z&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Assertion for example mentioned on &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1406&quot; title=&quot;StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase()&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1406&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1406&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; Description&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16573137" author="githubbot" created="Wed, 8 Aug 2018 12:22:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user coveralls commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    [!&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Coverage Status&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://coveralls.io/builds/18383289/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/18383289&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://coveralls.io/builds/18383289/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/18383289&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Coverage decreased (-0.04%) to 95.243% when pulling *&lt;b&gt;590f90889bf61a5570bd98b78e73410a07d7410b on HiuKwok:master&lt;/b&gt;* into *&lt;b&gt;a36c903d4f1065bc59f5e6d2bb0f9d92a5e71d83 on apache:master&lt;/b&gt;*.&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="16573168" author="githubbot" created="Wed, 8 Aug 2018 12:45:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user kinow commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    I&apos;m surprised by this bug. Had no idea something like this could happen. Will debug later and see if I can understand why that happens (might have to train my brain to default to always use uppercase instead of lowercase?). Thanks for the pull request, we will review the code and if everything looks OK a committer will merge it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16574490" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 9 Aug 2018 08:45:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user kinow commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Oh, that does make sense now. So the first visible character we see is the &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;&amp;quot;Latin Capital Letter I with Dot Above&amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://unicode-table.com/en/#0130&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://unicode-table.com/en/#0130&lt;/a&gt;) (see also &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;this other link&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dotted_and_dotless_I&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dotted_and_dotless_I&lt;/a&gt;)), and the second an `x`. And doing `toUpperCase()` simply won&apos;t change it as it&apos;s considered already upper case.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    When doing a `toLowerCase`, it gets translated into two visible characters. The second is the normal `x`. While the first contains two codepoints. I tested in Python, and got the lower case `i` (`print(u&quot;\u0069&quot;)`) followed by a character invisible by itself (`print (u&quot;\u0307&quot;)`).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    The special/invisible character, is visible when coming after certain letters.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    ```python&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; print(u&quot;\u0307&quot;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; print(u&quot;\u0069\u0307&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
    i&#775;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; print(u&quot;\u0068\u0307&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
    h&#775;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; print(u&quot;\u0067\u0307&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
    g&#775;&lt;br/&gt;
    &amp;gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; print(u&quot;\u0067\u0307&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
    ```&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    When we get these invisible characters, as we have one code point more, the length returned is not 2, but 3. Resulting in exception in this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    I don&apos;t believe the fix here would fix the reverse case, where we had a lower case, single codepoint, unicode; that would be represented by a two code codepoint. The exception could happen again (I haven&apos;t investigated whether such case exist, but I&apos;m assuming there could be such case - if not now, maybe a character could still be added in future editions).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    What do you think @HiuKwok ? Any suggestions? I&apos;m not sure if there&apos;s any easy way to fix this case, except by adding a note to the documentation saying that the method is not intended to be used with unicode strings, as it doesn&apos;t handle supplementary characters well. Or maybe we could try to remove the `length()` call around the `StringBuilder`&apos;s near the end of the method...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16574494" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 9 Aug 2018 08:47:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user kinow commented on a diff in the pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340#discussion_r208851249&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340#discussion_r208851249&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;#8212; Diff: src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java &amp;#8212;&lt;br/&gt;
    @@ -5596,8 +5596,8 @@ private static String replace(final String text, String searchString, final Stri&lt;br/&gt;
              }&lt;br/&gt;
              String searchText = text;&lt;br/&gt;
              if (ignoreCase) {&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;searchText = text.toLowerCase();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;searchString = searchString.toLowerCase();&lt;br/&gt;
    +             searchText = text.toUpperCase();&lt;br/&gt;
    +             searchString = searchString.toUpperCase();
	&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;End diff &amp;#8211;&lt;/li&gt;

	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    Just leaving a comment here too to have a review here in GitHub. While your example works, as the character is considered already in upper case, the reverse case would still fail after changing from `toLowerCase` to `toUpperCase`. So I think we should find another solution or update the documentation stating how the code works with unicode.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16578129" author="githubbot" created="Mon, 13 Aug 2018 11:24:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user HiuKwok commented on a diff in the pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340#discussion_r209574053&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340#discussion_r209574053&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Hi @kinow, yes you are right after I did try to come up with a draft java main to generate all || most unicode in string and compare it&apos;s length between original, toLowerCase() and to UpperCase().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    !&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;image&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37996731/44028895-032488d4-9f2e-11e8-839b-c1259a182b8e.png&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37996731/44028895-032488d4-9f2e-11e8-839b-c1259a182b8e.png&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    It&apos;s seem like no matter which one we pick (toLowerCase || toUpperCase), it would still tend to come up with a incorrect length.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Just a quick question what you mean by remove the ```length( )``` mean? Would you mind to specify more on that? &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Thanks, &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16578196" author="githubbot" created="Mon, 13 Aug 2018 12:20:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user kinow commented on a diff in the pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340#discussion_r209587514&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340#discussion_r209587514&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;#8212; Diff: src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java &amp;#8212;&lt;br/&gt;
    @@ -5596,8 +5596,8 @@ private static String replace(final String text, String searchString, final Stri&lt;br/&gt;
              }&lt;br/&gt;
              String searchText = text;&lt;br/&gt;
              if (ignoreCase) {&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;searchText = text.toLowerCase();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;searchString = searchString.toLowerCase();&lt;br/&gt;
    +             searchText = text.toUpperCase();&lt;br/&gt;
    +             searchString = searchString.toUpperCase();
	&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;End diff &amp;#8211;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    Oohh, great testing @HiuKwok ! Thanks for sharing here.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;gt;Just a quick question what you mean by remove the length( ) mean? Would you mind to specify more on that?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Sure. I think there could be a possibility to fix the issue by addressing how the length of the lower&apos;ed/upper&apos;ed text is used &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/590f90889bf61a5570bd98b78e73410a07d7410b/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java#L5603&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/590f90889bf61a5570bd98b78e73410a07d7410b/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java#L5603&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    So maybe there could be another way to work around the way we use the strings lengths, and avoid the exception.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                            <comment id="16604572" author="githubbot" created="Wed, 5 Sep 2018 15:32:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user HiuKwok commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/340&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    To whom who interested in this issue, here is some founding that I discovered throughout this month of issue solving. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Problem:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The exception would happened when any String object passed in with unicode character. In order to achieve ignore case replacement, the internal logic would first transform both `text` and `SearchString` to lowerCase( ) for comparaition.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;However if anyone passion enough to digger deeper into the src logic of `.toLowerCase( )`. Certain unicode character would be denormalized. In this way the result String length would tend to longer than original length().  Example like:  !&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;image&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37996731/45103213-efec8780-b161-11e8-8370-88a7edacfc42.png&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37996731/45103213-efec8780-b161-11e8-8370-88a7edacfc42.png&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;br/&gt;
    So making use of the transformed String, Out bound exception would happen when trying to access the index that doesn&apos;t access at all (3 in this case vs 2 in length before lowerCase).&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    Flow:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;So the first thought into my mind is, why dun just normalize both `text` and `searchString` before performing ignore case comparation? In this way the String length would always stay consistence no matter `toLowerCase( )` or `toUpperCase( )` 3 -&amp;gt; 3.  However the another problem would emerged, as you may noticed, while the String mentioned above denormalize, it would turn into a UpperCase I and a dot sign.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;But what happen if the search pattern emerge into searchText in decompose form. In this case let say I am trying to match a upper &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;I&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;. Then mismatch would happen and this is certain not the desire behavior of this method I believe.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    BTW I Drafted a simple main method to demonstrate how mismatch would happen in here.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/HiuKwok/commons-lang/blob/master/src/main/java/com/hiukwok/test.java#L10-L20&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/HiuKwok/commons-lang/blob/master/src/main/java/com/hiukwok/test.java#L10-L20&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

</comment>
                            <comment id="16604694" author="michaelryan" created="Wed, 5 Sep 2018 17:19:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve been thinking - how do case-insensitive regular expressions handle this? Theoretically these should do the same thing:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
StringUtils.replaceIgnoreCase(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\u0130x&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;x&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &quot;&quot;);
Pattern.compile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;x&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE).matcher(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\u0130x&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).replaceAll(&quot;&quot;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The Matcher.replaceAll(String) method does not throw an exception.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So what is the difference? The Pattern.newSingle(int) method is the key thing to look at. It uses Character.toUpperCase(char) and Character.toLowerCase(char), which do not have the same behavior as String.toUpperCase() and String.toLowerCase(). The Character class produces a single character.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So I think a possible naive solution to this would be to call Character.toLowerCase() on each character in the String and then append the characters together into a new String.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; text = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;char&lt;/span&gt;[] chars = text.toCharArray();
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; i = 0; i &amp;lt; chars.length; i++) {
    chars[i] = &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Character&lt;/span&gt;.toLowerCase(chars[i]);
}
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; lowerText = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;(chars);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16604916" author="githubbot" created="Wed, 5 Sep 2018 20:40:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user kinow commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

So will try to help here if you haven&apos;t found a way to solve it yet.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16615623" author="hiukwok" created="Sat, 15 Sep 2018 06:57:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=michaelryan&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;michaelryan&quot;&gt;Michael Ryan&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have try to implement your idea into the actual codebase against it. According to the theory the out of bound exception should be fixed.&lt;br/&gt;
 As one to one mapping is performed during the .toLowerCase process. It&apos;s guaranteed to always give back the same length of String in return.&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/HiuKwok/commons-lang/commit/a998e3de65a59d0859157f99e6cdf99469aa009f&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Here&lt;/a&gt;&#160;is the commit btw.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However on certain situation seems would leads to mismatch, which I listed the fail case on the same commit as well.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                            <comment id="16692232" author="githubbot" created="Mon, 19 Nov 2018 20:39:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user PascalSchumacher commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/381&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/381&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="16839056" author="gtorres" created="Tue, 14 May 2019 03:53:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This error happens in StringUtils.replace and can be fixed using StringUtils.indexOfIgnoreCase instead of converting first to lower case with the native String method and using the String native indexOf method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The method StringUtils.indexOfIgnoreCase resolves the problem because converts and compare the characters individually.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But will be some consequences to using indexOfIgnoreCase because is not Locale sensitive, it uses Character.toLowerCase() that is not Locale sensitive as String.toLowerCase().&#160;Thus Turkish words or other language words could be treated incorrectly.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The solution I pose is to change the use of Character.toLowerCase to String.toLowerCase and upperCase in order to handle the Strings with a Locale.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I created this&#160;pull request &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/422&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/422&lt;/a&gt;. I invite you to check it and give some feedback.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16839786" author="gtorres" created="Tue, 14 May 2019 20:57:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I created another pull request&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/423&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/423&lt;/a&gt;&#160;focused on resolving only this issue. In the method replace I removed the conversion of text and searchString to lowercase, also instead of using text.indexOf() I put a ternary operator to use StringUtils.indexofIgnorecase if the ignoreCase flag is true otherwise is used StringUtils.indexOf. I think this is a good solution because replace now uses some methods already implemented on StringUtils, this commit removes the use of the&#160;auxiliary variable that makes some characters indexes were different.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16927576" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 11 Sep 2019 13:44:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=michaelryan&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;michaelryan&quot;&gt;Michael Ryan&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=gtorres&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;gtorres&quot;&gt;Gerardo Torres Ontiveros&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In git master now. Please verify and close.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you!&lt;br/&gt;
Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1401] Typo in JavaDoc for lastIndexOf</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1401</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Typo in Java doc for lastIndexOf.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You could check on following page:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html#lastIndexOf-java.lang.CharSequence-java.lang.CharSequence-int-&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html#lastIndexOf-java.lang.CharSequence-java.lang.CharSequence-int-&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In example of execution two last row have same arguments but result differ:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.lastIndexOf(&quot;aabaabaa&quot;, &quot;ba&quot;, 2) = -1&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.lastIndexOf(&quot;aabaabaa&quot;, &quot;ba&quot;, 2) = 2&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1399] Split fails on word boundaries</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1399</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.split does not behave correctly when the split is to be performed on word boundary characters (&quot;\b&quot;). Steps to produce the bug:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;String string = &quot;foo&amp;lt;bar&amp;gt;foofoo&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
String[] st=StringUtils.split(string, &quot;\b&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Expected o/p:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;foo&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;&lt;br/&gt;
bar&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
foofoo&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Actual o/p:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;foo&amp;lt;bar&amp;gt;foofoo&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The issue seems to be with how zero-width separators are being handled. Note that Java library&apos;s String.split&#160;gives the expected output.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Produced on&#160;v3.7 with Java 8, running Windows. But this may be produced in any environment&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13165258">LANG-1399</key>
            <summary>Split fails on word boundaries</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="devson">devson</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 11 Jun 2018 07:39:40 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 11 Jun 2018 14:22:11 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 11 Jun 2018 14:22:11 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.x</version>
                                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16508122" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 11 Jun 2018 14:22:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.split treats the separator as a String, not a regular expression.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So &quot;\b&quot; does not mean word-boundary.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1397] WordUtils.wrap throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException when wrapLength is Integer.MAX_VALUE</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1397</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This is the sample code.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; max = &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.MAX_VALUE;&#160; &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// 2147483647
&lt;/span&gt;WordUtils.wrap(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;foobar&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, max, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\n&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and the error log.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Exception in thread &quot;main&quot; java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -2147483648
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1967)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.WordUtils.wrap(WordUtils.java:291)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.WordUtils.wrap(WordUtils.java:179)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Seems WordUtils in commons-text has the same bug. I will file it on commons-text side later.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13159640">LANG-1397</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1396] JsonToStringStyle does not escape string names</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1396</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;JSON objects consist of a string : value pair.&lt;br/&gt;
The string part can contain &apos;&quot;&apos; and &apos;\&apos; etc provided it is properly escaped.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is not currently supported.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13158451">LANG-1396</key>
            <summary>JsonToStringStyle does not escape string names</summary>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1395] JsonToStringStyle does not escape double quote in a string value</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1395</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;From the user mailing list &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;:&lt;br/&gt;
JsonToStringStyle does not escape double quote in a string value&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JSON requires double-quote to be escaped with a back-slash.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This does not happen currently.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Nor does the code translate control characters such as NL and FF correctly.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;AFAICT the code is only guaranateed to process alphanumeric strings correctly.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/10bb632e86c473d58656431ad2702e058c58585e1a2edf1bf4a46824@%3Cuser.commons.apache.org%3E&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/10bb632e86c473d58656431ad2702e058c58585e1a2edf1bf4a46824@%3Cuser.commons.apache.org%3E&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13158142">LANG-1395</key>
            <summary>JsonToStringStyle does not escape double quote in a string value</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 9 May 2018 09:35:57 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 21 Aug 2018 13:08:57 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 9 May 2018 17:29:31 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>3.8</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16468620" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 9 May 2018 09:49:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It looks like the code needs to use the (now deprecated) StringEscapeUtils#escapeJson() method to transform strings&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16469153" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 9 May 2018 17:29:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1395&quot; title=&quot;JsonToStringStyle does not escape double quote in a string value&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1395&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1395&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; - JsonToStringStyle does not escape double quote in a string&lt;br/&gt;
value&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/commit/e7d16c27&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/commit/e7d16c27&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1391] Improve Javadoc for StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null) </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1391</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null) method returns an incorrect value from what is specified in the javadoc.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JAVADOC:&#160; &#160;StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null) = true&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Test:&#160;System.out.println(&quot;&quot; + StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null));&#160; --&amp;gt;&#160;false&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13151952">LANG-1391</key>
            <summary>Improve Javadoc for StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null) </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="smatulli">Sauro Matulli</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 12 Apr 2018 12:14:34 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 30 Apr 2018 09:38:30 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 18 Apr 2018 18:28:00 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.7</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.8</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>

                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16441686" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 17 Apr 2018 23:57:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;That does not make sense based on the tests we have the behavior with other params:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null)&lt;/tt&gt; is the same as &lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;null&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;)&lt;/tt&gt;, an array with one element, a null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that&#160;&lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;null, &amp;quot;foo&amp;quot;&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;) returns {{true&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You might be confusing:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;StringUtils.isAnyEmpty((String[]) null) return false, this actually passes a null&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null)&lt;/tt&gt; is the same as &lt;tt&gt;StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;null&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;)&lt;/tt&gt;, an array with one element, a null&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;

</comment>
                            <comment id="16441706" author="oleg.chubaryov" created="Wed, 18 Apr 2018 00:35:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Maybe better to specify this behavior&#160;appropriately&#160;in javadoc. Because it&apos;s confusing at the moment.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16443000" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 18 Apr 2018 18:28:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I updated the Javadoc in git master. Please verify and close.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If anyone of you would like to participate and volunteer to improve the Javadoc for the other methods in this class, please provide a PR on GitHub at &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16451344" author="githubbot" created="Tue, 24 Apr 2018 22:34:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user coms opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/326&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/326&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1391&quot; title=&quot;Improve Javadoc for StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(null) &quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1391&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1391&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; Improve Javadoc for StringUtils methods&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Improved Javadoc for null cases. Methods: StringUtils.isNoneEmpty, StringUtils.isAnyBlank, StringUtils.isNoneBlank.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/coms/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/coms/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; master&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/326.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/326.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    This closes #326&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1386] Ambiguous method call error when using BooleanUtils.and</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1386</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When using `BooleanUtils.and` as per described in the method&apos;s javadoc, ambiguous method call error is thrown. I&apos;m using version 3.4 with Java 8.&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s a StackOverflow question related to this issue. &lt;a href=&quot;https://stackoverflow.com/q/49252638/1433665&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://stackoverflow.com/q/49252638/1433665&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13144679">LANG-1386</key>
            <summary>Ambiguous method call error when using BooleanUtils.and</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="TheKojuEffect">Kapil Koju</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 13 Mar 2018 10:27:54 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 21 Jun 2019 22:48:08 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.4</version>
                                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16397817" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 13 Mar 2018 23:12:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Please specify which version of Commons Lang you are using.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16397954" author="thekojueffect" created="Wed, 14 Mar 2018 01:30:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;~garydgregory&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&#160;I am using version 3.4 with Java 8. Updated the ticket.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you,&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16398543" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 14 Mar 2018 12:59:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The StackOverflow question has an answer that explains it all in great detail.&lt;br/&gt;
It also explains how to avoid the warning by using a suitably typed array.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;AFAICT the only way that Commons Lang could avoid this problem is to remove and replace one or both of the methods.&lt;br/&gt;
This will break compatibility.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Given that there is an easy work-round, I don&apos;t think that is warranted.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It might be worth adding some Javadoc to show how avoid the warning.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16869933" author="toka" created="Fri, 21 Jun 2019 22:48:08 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;SO answer does provide easy workaround, but that&apos;s no longer true for Java 9 and higher, where Boolean constructor is deprecated. Static alternative Boolean.valueOf() does raise ambiguous errors. We can use deprecated object constructor or primitive constructor. Either way there is no need for keeping both method calls. Autoboxing was introduced in Java 1.5, so removing primitive or object method call for and / xor / or operations would break backwards compatibility for Java 1.4 and lower.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                            <attachment id="12914245" name="BooleanUtils.and javadoc.png" size="119752" author="TheKojuEffect" created="Tue, 13 Mar 2018 10:27:41 +0000"/>

                            <attachment id="12914243" name="possible use case.png" size="15619" author="TheKojuEffect" created="Tue, 13 Mar 2018 10:27:39 +0000"/>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1385] NumberUtils.createNumber() throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException  instead of NumberFormatException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1385</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Test case:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;NumberUtils.createNumber(&quot;L&quot;)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Expected: &lt;tt&gt;NumberFormatException&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Got:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 0
at java.lang.String.charAt(String.java:658)
 at org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtils.createNumber(NumberUtils.java:528)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13144118">LANG-1385</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils.createNumber() throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException  instead of NumberFormatException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
