<item>
            <title>[LANG-1353] NumberUtils.isNumber bug</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1353</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>
&lt;p&gt;hi,I used to NumberUtils.isNumber()&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;version:3.6&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; find this error, this error is mainly caused by method isCreatable() in the 723 line of code&#12290;&lt;br/&gt;
See below for details:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            String str = &quot;0927&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
            System.out.println(NumberUtils.isNumber(str));&lt;br/&gt;
            &lt;font color=&quot;red&quot;&gt;//result:false&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;            String str1 = &quot;9027&quot;;&lt;br/&gt;
            System.out.println(NumberUtils.isNumber(str1));&lt;br/&gt;
            //result:true&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13102489">LANG-1353</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils.isNumber bug</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10004">Not A Bug</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="yusw">yusw</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 15 Sep 2017 07:07:33 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 19 Sep 2017 14:32:52 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 15 Sep 2017 23:05:09 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.math.*</component>
                        <due></due>

                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16168657" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 15 Sep 2017 23:05:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The leading 0 means octal.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;09 is not valid octal&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16171670" author="yusw" created="Tue, 19 Sep 2017 13:22:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is a trap, if you do not see the specific implementation of the method, who do not know will be treated as octal. I do not think it&apos;s a good practice.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16171791" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 19 Sep 2017 14:32:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The behaviour is clearly explained in the Javadoc:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/math/NumberUtils.html#isNumber-java.lang.String-&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/math/NumberUtils.html#isNumber-java.lang.String-&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1350] ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(Class, Object...) regression</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1350</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;As of &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1115&quot; title=&quot;Add support for varargs in ConstructorUtils, MemberUtils, and MethodUtils&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1115&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1115&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, the following test program no longer works:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;public class ConstructorUtilsTest {
	@Test
	public void test() throws Exception {
		ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(TestCtor.class, new A() {}, new B[0]);
	}

	public static class TestCtor {
		public TestCtor(A a, B... b) {}
	}

	public static class A {}
	public static class B {}
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13094842">LANG-1350</key>
            <summary>ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(Class, Object...) regression</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="bjkail">Brett Kail</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 15 Aug 2017 19:25:05 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 10 Nov 2017 16:41:08 +0000</updated>

                                    <version>3.5</version>

                        <due></due>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16134212" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 19 Aug 2017 18:10:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patches welcome &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16134520" author="githubbot" created="Sun, 20 Aug 2017 18:26:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user bjkail opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/283&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/283&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1350&quot; title=&quot;ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(Class, Object...) regression&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1350&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1350&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Fix varargs array invokeConstructor&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    If ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(Class, Object...) is invoked with an array of arguments whose classes do not match a constructor exactly (for example, a subclass is used) and an array is used for a varargs parameter, then the array is not matched to the varargs parameter type.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/bjkail/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/bjkail/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1350&quot; title=&quot;ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(Class, Object...) regression&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1350&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1350&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/283.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/283.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    This closes #283&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;p&gt;commit a54613f4c8774c34a9942b3ffe93d803fcc452cd&lt;br/&gt;
Author: Brett Kail &amp;lt;bjkail@gmail.com&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Date:   2017-08-20T18:25:41Z&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1350&quot; title=&quot;ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(Class, Object...) regression&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1350&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1350&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Fix varargs array invokeConstructor&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    If ConstructorUtils.invokeConstructor(Class, Object...) is invoked with&lt;br/&gt;
    an array of arguments whose classes do not match a constructor exactly&lt;br/&gt;
    (for example, a subclass is used) and an array is used for a varargs&lt;br/&gt;
    parameter, then the array is not matched to the varargs parameter type.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1348] StackOverflowError on TypeUtils.toString(...) for a generic return type of Enum.valueOf</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1348</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following code&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Method method = Enum.&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class.&lt;/span&gt;getMethod(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;valueOf&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Class&lt;/span&gt;.class, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;.class);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; typeText = TypeUtils.toString(method.getGenericReturnType());
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;throws the following&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-none&quot;&gt;Exception in thread &quot;main&quot; java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at sun.reflect.generics.reflectiveObjects.ParameterizedTypeImpl.getRawType(ParameterizedTypeImpl.java:126)

	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.typeVariableToString(TypeUtils.java:1775)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1672)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.appendAllTo(TypeUtils.java:1846)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.parameterizedTypeToString(TypeUtils.java:1803)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1666)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.appendAllTo(TypeUtils.java:1846)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.typeVariableToString(TypeUtils.java:1775)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1672)

	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.typeVariableToString(TypeUtils.java:1775)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtils.toString(TypeUtils.java:1672)

&lt;/pre&gt;

            <summary>StackOverflowError on TypeUtils.toString(...) for a generic return type of Enum.valueOf</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

                <created>Wed, 9 Aug 2017 14:31:50 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 10 Nov 2017 16:41:10 +0000</updated>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16134216" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 19 Aug 2017 18:14:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patches welcome &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16178269" author="markdacek" created="Sun, 24 Sep 2017 16:25:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I started poking into this. It&apos;s a sweet circular call. &lt;br/&gt;
You wind up at TypeUtils, Line 1672. This calls typeVariableToString, into the if block.&lt;br/&gt;
This, line 1775, calls the appendToAll method. You will hit line 1846... which calls the same toString function that you called in the first place. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t have a remediation plan. But maybe that will help!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16184861" author="mbusso" created="Thu, 28 Sep 2017 20:59:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m working on a patch trying to stop the circular call.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

            <title>[LANG-1347] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.util.Objects on android &lt; API 19</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1347</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The app is throwing a runtime error, as I understand, because the java.util.Objects is not available on Android below API 19.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;         AndroidRuntime  E  FATAL EXCEPTION: main
                         E  java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java.util.Objects
                         E      at org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair.equals(Pair.java:134)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Android API level below 19&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13093079">LANG-1347</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1343] StringUtils#abbreviate breaks up surrogate pairs</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1343</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If the last char in the remaining substring is the first char of a surrogate pair, the resulting string has an illegal surrogate pair with the second char of the surrogate pair being the first char of the ellipsis.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;StringUtils.abbreviate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\uD83D\uDCA9\uD83D\uDCA9\uD83D\uDCA9&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, 4); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// returns &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\uD83D...&quot;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In my case this breaks further along when the string is transformed to UTF-8 for a SOAP request.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Should this at least be mentioned in the Javadoc?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13083411">LANG-1343</key>
            <summary>StringUtils#abbreviate breaks up surrogate pairs</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1342] JavaVersion is not consistent with JEP-223</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1342</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://openjdk.java.net/jeps/223&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;JEP 223: New Version-String Syntax&lt;/a&gt; introduces a new syntax for version strings. &lt;br/&gt;
This syntax is sort-of not incompatible with JavaVersion in 3.5, but this is likely to change as soon as someone finds a bug in JDK 9 after it&apos;s released.  There is a third specified version number component for security releases. Unlike the rest of the full version string, this component is significant for ordering, and cannot reliably be mapped to float. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JEP 223 defines some regular expressions.  It also defines an api class (java.lang.Runtime.Version).  This class can&apos;t be used directly (since it&apos;s new with JDK-9), and the  API can&apos;t be directly emulated, as it requires java.lang.Optional.  However, it&apos;s not rocket science  (it is however regular expressions, so now you have problems 2.0).    &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ll take a crack at a class implementing JEP-223 Versions and try to get them to play with JavaVersion.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The existing mapping to float is unsuited to minor versions, so there has to be some new hackery  for java 9 even for two components.  ( JDK 9.11 should be &amp;gt;  JDK 9.2 )&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since there&apos;s no java minor releases yet, there&apos;s a bit of freedom.  If the range of minor and patch versions is restricted to values between 0 and 99 there should be a way to make things work. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Ideally the floaty stuff can be deprecated for removal before that matters. &lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13082937">LANG-1342</key>
            <summary>JavaVersion is not consistent with JEP-223</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sesuncedu">Simon Spero</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 27 Jun 2017 20:47:33 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 27 Jun 2017 21:22:18 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.6</version>
                                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16065494" author="sesuncedu" created="Tue, 27 Jun 2017 21:22:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Of course, JEP 223 is a little non-semantic-versiony on the semantics of specification.version .  A minor version may include non-breaking api changes from MR of specifications, but those versions aren&apos;t specification versions.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Minor&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;p&gt;$MINOR &amp;#8212; The minor version number, incremented for a minor update release that may contain compatible bug fixes, revisions to standard APIs mandated by a Maintenance Release of the relevant Platform Specification, and implementation features outside the scope of that Specification such as new JDK-specific APIs, additional service providers, new garbage collectors, and ports to new hardware architectures.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Major (GA)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;  java.version                    1.9.0         9
  java.runtime.version            1.9.0-b100    9+100
  java.vm.version                 1.9.0-b100    9+100
  java.specification.version      1.9           9
  java.vm.specification.version   1.9           9
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Minor #1 (GA)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;  java.version                    1.9.0_20      9.1.2
  java.runtime.version            1.9.0_20-b62  9.1.2+62
  java.vm.version                 1.9.0_20-b62  9.1.2+62
  java.specification.version      1.9           9
  java.vm.specification.version   1.9           9
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1341] equalsBuilder.appendSuper() has incorrect behavior if the object you call equals() on is a direct supertype of Object</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1341</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If you use EqualsBuilder.appendSuper(super.equals(Object)) on an Object whose direct supertype is Object, it will succeed if and only if the two references are the same (because that&apos;s what Object.equals does).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Reading it out loud, this is obvious, but I think the Javadoc for EqualsBuilder encourages you to make this mistake. In particular, here&apos;s some text in the summary of the Javadoc:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;Typical use for the code is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; equals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; obj) {
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (obj == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) { &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;; }
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (obj == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;) { &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;; }
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (obj.getClass() != getClass()) {
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
   }
   MyClass rhs = (MyClass) obj;
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; EqualsBuilder()
                 .appendSuper(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.equals(obj))
                 .append(field1, rhs.field1)
                 .append(field2, rhs.field2)
                 .append(field3, rhs.field3)
                 .isEquals();
  }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There&apos;s also no mention of this in the javadocs for the appendSuper() method itself.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My suggestion is to fix the example at the beginning. The way HashCodeBuilder does this, which I think is the best, is to leave appendSuper out of the example and adds this line after: &lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;If required, the superclass hashCode() can be added using appendSuper(int).&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;For completeness, here&apos;s a snippet of code that illustrates this problem.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Thing {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; text;

    @Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; equals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Object&lt;/span&gt; other) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (other == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (other == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;;
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (other.getClass() != getClass()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Thing thing = (Thing) other;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; EqualsBuilder()
                .appendSuper(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.equals(other))
                .append(text, thing.text)
                .isEquals();
    }
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13082158">LANG-1341</key>
            <summary>equalsBuilder.appendSuper() has incorrect behavior if the object you call equals() on is a direct supertype of Object</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="KBinswanger">Kevin Binswanger</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 23 Jun 2017 15:39:26 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 20 Aug 2018 17:22:07 +0000</updated>
                                                                                <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>

&lt;p&gt;    The issues also suggested to add some documentation to `appendSuper(boolean)` making clear the implications of calling `super.equals(object)` when the class is a direct subclass ob `java.lang.Object`. I think we should add this.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16586252" author="githubbot" created="Mon, 20 Aug 2018 17:22:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user britter commented on a diff in the pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/343#discussion_r211341588&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/343#discussion_r211341588&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;#8212; Diff: src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/EqualsBuilder.java &amp;#8212;&lt;br/&gt;
    @@ -58,14 +58,17 @@&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;}&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;MyClass rhs = (MyClass) obj;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;return new EqualsBuilder()&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;*                 .appendSuper(super.equals(obj))&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;.append(field1, rhs.field1)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;.append(field2, rhs.field2)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;.append(field3, rhs.field3)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;.isEquals();&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;}&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;/pre&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
      *&lt;br/&gt;
    + * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    + * If required, the superclass &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;appendSuper()&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; can be added using 
{@link #appendSuper}
&lt;p&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
	&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;End diff &amp;#8211;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    Better use a JavaDoc Link here: `&lt;/p&gt;
{@link #appendSuper(boolean)}
&lt;p&gt;`&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1337] Fix test failures in IBM JDK 8 for ToStringBuilderTest</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1337</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;From the 3.6 thread RC2. We had issues in the release. Two tests failed. One of these tests happened on IBM JDK 8, and was related to time zones. Gary Gregory quickly pointed that the very latest IBM JDK 8 released did not had this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Indeed, I grabbed a JDK 8 from IBM and had this issue, and then after looking for the latest version, I had only one test failing. This test in question was ToStringBuilderTest#testReflectionHierarchyArrayList.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Debugging the test in Eclipse, with the JDK pointing to IBM JDK 8 (and taking care to not let the Eclipse maven integration change it), there is a part of the code that receives an ArrayList object to create a String with reflection.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In Oracle JDK 7, the object contains the default 10 empty positions, and thus the generated String is.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.util.ArrayList@761a4a3d[elementData={&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;,&amp;lt;null&amp;gt;},size=0,modCount=0]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But with IBM JDK 8, the ArrayList is empty, nada, and then I get the following in the Eclipse debugger.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.util.ArrayList@761a4a3d[elementData={},size=0,modCount=0]
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The test is - as commented in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-727&quot; title=&quot;ToStringBuilderTest.testReflectionHierarchyArrayList fails with IBM JDK 6&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-727&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-727&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; - a bit flaky. However, the expected string assumes ArrayList will have an initial 10 null values. So the pull request in this issue simply creates an ArrayList with 10 initial capacity &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; a na&#239;ve approach, but that I believe fixes this test.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The changes in the pull request linked to this issue have all tests passing with the following set-ups:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Apache Maven 3.3.9 (bb52d8502b132ec0a5a3f4c09453c07478323dc5; 2015-11-11T05:41:47+13:00)
Maven home: /opt/maven
Java version: 1.7.0_80, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: /usr/lib/jvm/java-7-oracle/jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: &quot;linux&quot;, version: &quot;4.4.0-78-generic&quot;, arch: &quot;amd64&quot;, family: &quot;unix&quot;
---
java version &quot;1.7.0_80&quot;
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_80-b15)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.80-b11, mixed mode)

Apache Maven 3.3.9 (bb52d8502b132ec0a5a3f4c09453c07478323dc5; 2015-11-11T05:41:47+13:00)

Java version: 1.8.0, vendor: IBM Corporation
Java home: /home/kinow/Development/java/ibm-java-x86_64-80/jre

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;java version &quot;1.8.0&quot;&lt;br/&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Apache Maven 3.3.9 (bb52d8502b132ec0a5a3f4c09453c07478323dc5; 2015-11-11T05:41:47+13:00)&lt;br/&gt;

                            <comment id="16038689" author="githubbot" created="Tue, 6 Jun 2017 11:43:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user kinow opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1337&quot; title=&quot;Fix test failures in IBM JDK 8 for ToStringBuilderTest&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1337&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1337&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Fix test failures in IBM JDK 8 for ToStringBuilderTest by specifying the ArrayList initial capacity.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    See &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1337&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1337&lt;/a&gt; for issue description and explanation of the changes here.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    In summary, we specify the ArrayList&apos;s initial capacity, this way the String built through reflection has the expected value. Tested with Oracle JDK 7 and 8, and IBM JDK 8.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/kinow/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/kinow/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1337&quot; title=&quot;Fix test failures in IBM JDK 8 for ToStringBuilderTest&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1337&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1337&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    This closes #269&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="16039036" author="githubbot" created="Tue, 6 Jun 2017 14:59:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user andyklimczak commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    probably related to &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;this&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://stackoverflow.com/a/34250231)?&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://stackoverflow.com/a/34250231)?&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16039038" author="githubbot" created="Tue, 6 Jun 2017 15:00:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user andyklimczak commented on a diff in the pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269#discussion_r120386094&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/269#discussion_r120386094&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;#8212; Diff: src/test/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/ToStringBuilderTest.java &amp;#8212;&lt;br/&gt;
    @@ -316,7 +316,7 @@ public void testReflectionHierarchyArrayList() {&lt;br/&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;gt;If the test fails when the initial size arg is omitted, does that not also affect the behaviour of the method being tested?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Not really. The test simply checks the string built for an arraylist through reflection. The issue was caused for believing that the lazy initialization (as @andyklimczak) would work in the same independent of the JVM.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    What the test is verifying is correct, the current approach could be improved to make the test less flaky.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>9223372036854775807</customfieldvalue>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1333] ThresholdCircuitBreaker checkState method contradicts javadoc/interface</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1333</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/concurrent/ThresholdCircuitBreaker.java&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;ThresholdCircuitBreaker impl &lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
does not seem to comply with the interface. The &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/concurrent/AbstractCircuitBreaker.html#checkState--&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;checkState &lt;/a&gt; method should return whether the circuit is closed or not. However, it returns isOpen(). This contradicts what&apos;s given in the java doc example &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ThresHoldCircuitBreaker breaker = new ThresholdCircuitBreaker(10L);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;breaker.incrementAndCheckState(9L) returns false meaning the circuit is closed and the requests should pass through. The checkState method should return true for below example in javadoc to be correct&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;/**
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void handleRequest(Request request) {
 *     &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; memoryUsed = estimateMemoryUsage(request);
 *     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (breaker.incrementAndCheckState(memoryUsed)) {
 *         &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// actually handle &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; request
&lt;/span&gt; *     } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
 *         &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;do&lt;/span&gt; something &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt;, e.g. send an error code
&lt;/span&gt; *     }
 * }
*/&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;java 8&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13072406">LANG-1333</key>
            <summary>ThresholdCircuitBreaker checkState method contradicts javadoc/interface</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kinow">Bruno P. Kinoshita</assignee>

                            <comment id="16051165" author="kinow" created="Thu, 15 Jun 2017 22:24:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Indeed, good points. We are going to probably re-work some of the circuit breakers for upcoming Java 9 module system. So we might as well update this one too, either adjusting documentation or code. Will think about for a while and re-read the code of all circuit breakers during the next days.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks for reporting a clear and detailed issue.&lt;br/&gt;
Bruno&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1329] ClassUtils.getClass Bug</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1329</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When you use ClassUtils.getClass(&quot;void&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
it will return ClassNotFoundException.&lt;br/&gt;
because the abbreviationMap contains &quot;void&quot; with &quot;V&quot;.&lt;br/&gt;
but in Java, [V or void[].class was not existed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13070252">LANG-1329</key>
            <summary>ClassUtils.getClass Bug</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1328] FastDateFormat does not support &apos;EEE&apos; and &apos;MMM&apos; abbreviations for pt_PT</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1328</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;For the following statement:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;FastDateFormat.getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;MMM&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, timeZone, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Locale(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)).format(1494115200);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The outcome will be &quot;dormingo&quot; instead of &quot;dor&quot; in Portugese (pt_PT). I expect this to be a bug since the only reason for FastDateFormat to not abbreviate the weekdays would be that Portugese does not allow it, not very likely.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Android&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13069097">LANG-1328</key>
            <summary>FastDateFormat does not support &apos;EEE&apos; and &apos;MMM&apos; abbreviations for pt_PT</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/reopened.png" description="This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.">Reopened</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="par.nils.amsen@gmail.com">P&#228;r Nils Amsen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 4 May 2017 10:41:13 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 30 Mar 2019 11:03:54 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.3.2</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15996553" author="kinow" created="Thu, 4 May 2017 11:07:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hello  &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=par.nils.amsen%40gmail.com&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;par.nils.amsen@gmail.com&quot;&gt;P&#228;r Nils Amsen&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt;The outcome will be &quot;dormingo&quot; instead of &quot;dor&quot; in Portugese (pt_PT)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Actually, with 3.3.2 or 3.5, I&apos;m getting the following from using pretty much your code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; s = FastDateFormat.getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;MMM&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, TimeZone.getDefault(), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Locale(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)).format(1494115200);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(s);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gives me:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;jan
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As M is the month of the year, and MMM is the three letter abbreviation for it. In Portuguese, MMM -&amp;gt; jan is correct (janeiro abbreviated as jan).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Using EEE, with either 3.5 or 3.3.2:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; s = FastDateFormat.getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;EEE&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, TimeZone.getDefault(), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Locale(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)).format(1494115200);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(s);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gives me:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Dom
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Which is again correct, as Domingo gets correctly abbreviated as Dom.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15996558" author="par.nils.amsen@gmail.com" created="Thu, 4 May 2017 11:13:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for your superfast and thorough reply &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=kinow&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;kinow&quot;&gt;Bruno P. Kinoshita&lt;/a&gt;! Give me a minute and I will make a test in another context than the production code I&apos;m working on, I&apos;ll close this if it works.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15996562" author="kinow" created="Thu, 4 May 2017 11:15:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sure &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=par.nils.amsen%40gmail.com&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;par.nils.amsen@gmail.com&quot;&gt;P&#228;r Nils Amsen&lt;/a&gt;, happy to re-open if we identify a bug/improvement with your new test.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15996594" author="par.nils.amsen@gmail.com" created="Thu, 4 May 2017 11:36:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=kinow&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;kinow&quot;&gt;Bruno P. Kinoshita&lt;/a&gt; I&apos;m able to reproduce it in a fresh project! &lt;br/&gt;
Here&apos;s a simple repo demonstrating the issue on &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/paramsen/fastdateformatissue&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Github&lt;/a&gt; (Android). In &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/paramsen/fastdateformatissue/blob/master/app/src/main/java/com/paramsen/fastdateformatissue/MainActivity.java#L18&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;MainActivity#18&lt;/a&gt; the formatting happens, which produces &quot;Domingo&quot; instead of &quot;Dom&quot; on Android, the two relevant lines:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; formatted = FastDateFormat.getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;EEE&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, TimeZone.getTimeZone(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UTC&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Locale(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;pt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)).format(1494115200);
((TextView) findViewById(R.id.dateFormat)).setText(formatted);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The result is &quot;Domingo&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15996598" author="kinow" created="Thu, 4 May 2017 11:48:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I still get Dom. Will re-open the issue, as I suspect this could be caused by some difference in Android JVM implementation.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15996787" author="par.nils.amsen@gmail.com" created="Thu, 4 May 2017 14:16:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=kinow&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;kinow&quot;&gt;Bruno P. Kinoshita&lt;/a&gt; Yes I suspect that it is &lt;em&gt;device specific&lt;/em&gt; aswell, the abbreviations/weekdays are provided by the system right? My teammate tested on a couple of different devices:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Samsung S3:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
PT_br: OK (Dor)&lt;br/&gt;
PT_pt: OK (Dor)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Google Pixel:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
PT_br: OK (Dor)&lt;br/&gt;
PT_pt: NOK (Dormingo)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Generic Android emulator&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
PT_br: OK (Dor)&lt;br/&gt;
PT_pt: NOK (Dormingo)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Seems like the localization is provided by the device manufacturer or smth.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15999233" author="kinow" created="Sat, 6 May 2017 02:49:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hello,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Downloaded Android Studio (latest version), added Commons Lang 3.5 via Gradle, added your code minus the Android specific line, and then put a breakpoint to see what&apos;s happening.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In my case, I&apos;m getting for pt_PT domingo for the EEE mask. Same code in Oracle JVM gives me dom for EEE. I&apos;m guessing the extra R that appears for you is a typo? Or are you really seeing Dor and Dormingo? Dormingo does not exist in Portuguese (except as a slang, recently created).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Debugging, I could see that my Oracle JDK was using a ResourceBundle to load the Locale specific strings, while in Android, it was using ICU (import libcore.icu.LocaleData). Attaching some images from my IDE&apos;s with breakpoints around where I think the code differs.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tried reproducing the issue with Oracle JDK + ICU here &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/kinow/commons-sandbox/blob/master/src/main/java/br/eti/kinoshita/commons/LangDateTests.java&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/kinow/commons-sandbox/blob/master/src/main/java/br/eti/kinoshita/commons/LangDateTests.java&lt;/a&gt;, but I still get Dom for Oracle JDK, and dom with IBM ICU4J (tried recent versions, and the oldest I tried was 4.0.1).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I wonder if the following excerpt from Google&apos;s libcore helps:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;From: &lt;a href=&quot;https://android.googlesource.com/platform/libcore/+/5d930ca/luni/src/main/java/java/util/Locale.java&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://android.googlesource.com/platform/libcore/+/5d930ca/luni/src/main/java/java/util/Locale.java&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Note that locale data is not necessarily available for any of the locales pre-defined as&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;constants in this class except for en_US, which is the only locale Java guarantees is always&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;available.&lt;br/&gt;
 *&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;p&amp;gt;It is also a mistake to assume that all devices have the same locales available.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;A device sold in the US will almost certainly support en_US and es_US, but not necessarily&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;any locales with the same language but different countries (such as en_GB or es_ES),&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;nor any locales for other languages (such as de_DE). The opposite may well be true for a device&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;sold in Europe.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Versions of ICU:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Here are the versions of ICU (and the corresponding CLDR and Unicode versions) used in&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;various Android releases:&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;table BORDER=&quot;1&quot; WIDTH=&quot;100%&quot; CELLPADDING=&quot;3&quot; CELLSPACING=&quot;0&quot; SUMMARY=&quot;&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 1.5 (Cupcake)/Android 1.6 (Donut)/Android 2.0 (Eclair)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;ICU 3.8&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-1-5&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 1.5&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode5.0.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 5.0&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 2.2 (Froyo)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;ICU 4.2&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-1-7&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 1.7&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode5.1.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 5.1&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 2.3 (Gingerbread)/Android 3.0 (Honeycomb)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;ICU 4.4&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-1-8&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 1.8&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode5.2.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 5.2&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://site.icu-project.org/download/46&quot;&amp;gt;ICU 4.6&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-1-9&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 1.9&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.0.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 6.0&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://site.icu-project.org/download/48&quot;&amp;gt;ICU 4.8&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-2-0&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 2.0&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.0.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 6.0&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 4.3 (Jelly Bean MR2)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://site.icu-project.org/download/50&quot;&amp;gt;ICU 50&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-22-1&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 22.1&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.2.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 6.2&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 4.4 (KitKat)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://site.icu-project.org/download/51&quot;&amp;gt;ICU 51&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-23&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 23&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.2.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 6.2&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;Android 4.? (STOPSHIP)&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://site.icu-project.org/download/53&quot;&amp;gt;ICU 53&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-25&quot;&amp;gt;CLDR 25&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;a href=&quot;http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.3.0/&quot;&amp;gt;Unicode 6.3&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;/table&amp;gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Before trying anything, it would be helpful to have some code &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=par.nils.amsen%40gmail.com&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;par.nils.amsen@gmail.com&quot;&gt;P&#228;r Nils Amsen&lt;/a&gt;. Code that can be imported into an IDE, as well as detailed instructions to reproduce the issue. Then someone would need to dig a bit deeper than I did, and understand why the differences for the abbreviated week day name.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t see what could be done in &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;lang&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, and believe we will be able to find something missing in Android/libcore/icu for pt_PT, and then users will simply need to update their dependencies, without any change here in &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;lang&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1327] org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateFormatUtils.formatUTC (10L, &quot;&quot;) throws java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException exception</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1327</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I am calling method formatUTC() of class&lt;br/&gt;
org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateFormatUtils&lt;br/&gt;
as in this code:&lt;br/&gt;
java.lang.String var2 = org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateFormatUtils.formatUTC (10L, &quot;&quot;)&lt;br/&gt;
In version 3.4, the call is throwing a&lt;br/&gt;
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException exception.&lt;br/&gt;
But in version 3.5 it returns an empty string (&quot;&quot;).&lt;br/&gt;
According the documentation, the parameter patter can not be null.&lt;br/&gt;
Is correct this method accept empty string as pattern parameter?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;JRE 8&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13068441">LANG-1327</key>
            <summary>org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateFormatUtils.formatUTC (10L, &quot;&quot;) throws java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException exception</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="glebrito">Gleison Brito Batista</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 2 May 2017 14:23:04 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 3 May 2017 05:36:37 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 3 May 2017 05:26:39 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.4</version>
                    <version>3.5</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15994296" author="charles_honton@intuit.com" created="Wed, 3 May 2017 05:26:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Empty format is legal, even if non-sensical. Since there are no format specifiers, the output should be an empty string. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15994301" author="kinow" created="Wed, 3 May 2017 05:36:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(was writing probably at the same time &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=chonton&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;chonton&quot;&gt;Charles Honton&lt;/a&gt; closed the issue. Agree with his comment, but will leave mine here too FWIW)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Looks like that changed indeed from 3.4 to 3.5, but not in DateFormatUtils, but in FastDatePrinter. See:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;git diff LANG_3_4 master src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/time/FastDatePrinter.java&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Instead of simply calling the format method, now it&apos;s checking which rules it can apply, and in your case not applying anything, and simply returning an empty String.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Adding a note to DateFormatUtils#format(Long, String) for that, would mean adding a note to all other methods that receive a pattern argument iff the behaviour is consistent (i.e. if for all these methods, passing an empty pattern, returns an empty string). However, I would argue that it would make more sense to document an exception, such as StringIndexOutOfBoundsException, rather than document that we won&apos;t throw an exception, and instead will return empty.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Passing an empty pattern, users might guess that they will receive an empty date. I would be fine if the consensus was to document all methods stating that an empty pattern will return an empty formatted date but, my preferred solution is to close this as Won&apos;t Fix. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1326] StringUtils#isAllEmpty and #isAllBlank should return false for an empty array</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1326</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If the description of &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1271&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1271&lt;/a&gt; is what is the agreed behavior, then I believe isAllEmpty and isAllBlank method should be updated as well. Please let me know if i&apos;m missing something on this.  &lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13067949">LANG-1326</key>
            <summary>StringUtils#isAllEmpty and #isAllBlank should return false for an empty array</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="arshad0789">Arshad Basha</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 29 Apr 2017 19:17:16 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 14 Nov 2020 18:18:48 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 14 Nov 2020 15:30:47 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.6</version>
                                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>5</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="6000">1h 40m</timespent>

                            <comment id="17231289" author="arshad0789" created="Fri, 13 Nov 2020 09:23:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=arturobernalg&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;arturobernalg&quot;&gt;Arturo Bernal&lt;/a&gt; - apologies I lost track of this Jira. I would very much want my PR to be merged instead&#160;&lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;, I will rebase: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/267&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/267&lt;/a&gt;&#160; right away..&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17231335" author="arshad0789" created="Fri, 13 Nov 2020 09:53:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve successfully completed the rebase &amp;amp; resolved the conflicts of my PR:&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/267&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;#267&lt;/a&gt;&#160;That said, I would greatly appreciate it if you can close yours.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17231873" author="garydgregory" created="Fri, 13 Nov 2020 23:15:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;IMO this ticket is wrong and the change for &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1271&quot; title=&quot;StringUtils#isAnyEmpty and #isAnyBlank should return false for an empty array&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1271&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1271&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; was not thought all the way through in the context of our existing APIs.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Let&apos;s start with the primitive operations &lt;tt&gt;isBlank(CharSequence)&lt;/tt&gt; and&#160; &lt;tt&gt;isEmpty(CharSequence)&lt;/tt&gt; and note that these APIs consider null to be the same as an empty string. IOW, a null sequence of character is the same as an empty array (size 0).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This lets me validate input and make sure input exists for my app. As currently defined, the methods above will do the job and return false if null or &quot;&quot; are given as input.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So far so good.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now, let&apos;s consider&#160;isAnyEmpty(CharSequence...):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The answer to&#160;&lt;tt&gt;isAnyEmpty(CharSequence1, CharSequence1)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;better be the same as:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;isEmpty(CharSequence1) ||&#160;isEmpty(CharSequence2)&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We&apos;re still good.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The answer to&#160;&lt;tt&gt;isAnyEmpty(null)&lt;/tt&gt; is still &lt;tt&gt;true&lt;/tt&gt;, good. I can still tell the user/provider that he needs to provide input or my app will break.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But now &lt;tt&gt;isAnyEmpty((String[]) null)&lt;/tt&gt; return false? Whaaaaat? My app&apos;s error checking saying null input is not empty? Someone my app can proceed with null input?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That&apos;s wrong and this ticket is wrong for the same reason IMO.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;In fact I would hope to revert &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1271&quot; title=&quot;StringUtils#isAnyEmpty and #isAnyBlank should return false for an empty array&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1271&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1271&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17231969" author="arturobernalg" created="Sat, 14 Nov 2020 08:58:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;HI &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I hadn&apos;t thought of it that way. I think you&apos;re right.&lt;/p&gt;
