<item>
            <title>[LANG-1285] NullPointerException in FastDateParser$TimeZoneStrategy</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1285</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;It seems that after &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1186&quot; title=&quot;NullPointerException in FastDateParser$TimeZoneStrategy&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1186&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1186&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; was fixed, and before 3.5 went out, the bug was re-introduced.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;One of my customers is getting the following error (I am actually not able to reproduce it) with 3.5:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser$TimeZoneStrategy.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(FastDateParser.java:869)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser.getLocaleSpecificStrategy(FastDateParser.java:637)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser.getStrategy(FastDateParser.java:606)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser.access$100(FastDateParser.java:73)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser$StrategyParser.letterPattern(FastDateParser.java:234)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser$StrategyParser.getNextStrategy(FastDateParser.java:220)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser.init(FastDateParser.java:167)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateParser.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(FastDateParser.java:153)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(FastDateFormat.java:394)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(FastDateFormat.java:378)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat$1.createInstance(FastDateFormat.java:100)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat$1.createInstance(FastDateFormat.java:97)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FormatCache.getInstance(FormatCache.java:81)
        at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat.getInstance(FastDateFormat.java:128)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Centos 7, en_GB locale&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13021044">LANG-1285</key>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1284] RandomStringUtils&apos; random method goes into an infinite loop</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1284</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following code goes into an infinite loop.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;RandomStringUtils.random(1, 0, 0, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;char&lt;/span&gt;[]{ &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;a&apos;&lt;/span&gt; })
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I know it doesn&apos;t make sense to pass letters=false and then a letter array, but a bug in the caller&apos;s code will make him fall into this trap.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13020016">LANG-1284</key>
            <summary>RandomStringUtils&apos; random method goes into an infinite loop</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="anedumar">Arul Nedumaran</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 11 Nov 2016 03:45:05 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 25 May 2017 12:58:36 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 25 May 2017 12:58:36 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.5</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>

                            <comment id="15659193" author="dmjones500" created="Sat, 12 Nov 2016 07:13:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure if this can be prevented without very inefficient scanning of the input array. Perhaps the best approach here is a warning in the Javadocs.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The Javadocs need a clean up anyway, I can&apos;t really understand the opening paragraphs:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;If start and end are both 0, start and end are set to &apos; &apos; and &apos;z&apos;, the ASCII printable characters, will be used, unless letters and numbers are both false, in which case, start and end are set to 0 and Integer.MAX_VALUE.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If set is not null, characters between start and end are chosen.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15671911" author="eltonnunes" created="Wed, 16 Nov 2016 22:44:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Maybe the better is a warning in the Javadoc.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16024701" author="pascalschumacher" created="Thu, 25 May 2017 12:58:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;RandomStringUtils will be deprecated in commons-lang 3.6 in favor of RandomStringGenerator from commons-text. Please use &lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-text/javadocs/api-release/org/apache/commons/text/RandomStringGenerator.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;RandomStringGenerator&lt;/a&gt; instead.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1283] RecursiveToStringStyle does not handle nested Maps correctly</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1283</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When using &lt;tt&gt;RecursiveToStringStyle&lt;/tt&gt; to include all member fields of all nested objects, it works for simple Maps, but as soon as I have Maps as values inside another Map, the contents is not included any more, but only a Object.toString() seems to be appended for the objects instead.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A possible fix would be to add  the following to RecursiveToStringStyle, although there might be a better way to fix this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;        @Override
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; void appendDetail(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;StringBuffer&lt;/span&gt; buffer, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fieldName, Map&amp;lt;?, ?&amp;gt; map) {
            appendClassName(buffer, map);
            appendIdentityHashCode(buffer, map);
            appendDetail(buffer, fieldName, map.entrySet());
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See the attached unit-test for a reproducer.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please also note that &lt;tt&gt;RecursiveToStringStyleTest&lt;/tt&gt; in commons-lang seems to mostly work on the DefaultStyle instead, see &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/RecursiveToStringStyleTest.java#L38&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/builder/RecursiveToStringStyleTest.java#L38&lt;/a&gt;, only one method, &lt;tt&gt;testPerson()&lt;/tt&gt;, seems to actually do a real test here!&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13019545">LANG-1283</key>
            <summary>RecursiveToStringStyle does not handle nested Maps correctly</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1282] StringUtils#normalizeSpace normalizeSpace should not replace non-breaking spaces with normal whitespace</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1282</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;As of 3.4 StringUtils#normalizeSpace does not normalize non-breaking whitespace anymore. Therefore it shouldn&apos;t replace a non-breaking whitespace white breaking whitespace, but both assertions succeed:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a b&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, StringUtils.normalizeSpace(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a\u00A0b&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a  b&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, StringUtils.normalizeSpace(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a\u00A0 b&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;source: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/184&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/184&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13017830">LANG-1282</key>
            <summary>StringUtils#normalizeSpace normalizeSpace should not replace non-breaking spaces with normal whitespace</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 3 Nov 2016 21:25:07 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 14 Nov 2017 17:41:13 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>3.5</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15719574" author="dmjones500" created="Sun, 4 Dec 2016 08:35:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I agree with this. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If &lt;tt&gt;Character.isWhitespace()&lt;/tt&gt; is the test, then the Javadocs also need to be updated to make this crystal clear. The current documentation waffles on a bit about XML vs Java white-space conventions; IMO we should just concisely explain what this method does.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16251808" author="dh_gis" created="Tue, 14 Nov 2017 17:41:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;IMO StringUtils#normalizeSpace should be idempotent, i.e.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; s = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a\u00A0 b&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
assertEquals(StringUtils.normalizeSpace(s), StringUtils.normalizeSpace(StringUtils.normalizeSpace(s)));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Hence non-breaking spaces should not be replaced by normal spaces. Simply remove the replacement in the following line&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
newChars[count++] = (actualChar == 160 ? 32 : actualChar);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1281] Javadoc of StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf is contradictory.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1281</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Javadoc of StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf states the following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;The code increments the starting index by one, rather than by the length of the match string, so matches may overlap.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But then gives the following example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf(&quot;aabaabaa&quot;, &quot;&quot;, 2) = 0&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;which clearly indicates that it does &lt;b&gt;not&lt;/b&gt; increment the starting index by one in case of the empty string.&lt;/p&gt;

</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13017670">LANG-1281</key>
            <summary>Javadoc of StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf is contradictory.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="aioobe">Andreas Lundblad</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 3 Nov 2016 14:57:00 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Jun 2017 12:04:53 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 6 Nov 2016 11:20:58 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.5</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.6</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15634101" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 3 Nov 2016 20:15:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user PascalSchumacher opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1281&quot; title=&quot;Javadoc of StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf is contradictory.&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1281&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1281&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Javadoc of StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf is contradictory&lt;/p&gt;

with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

Author: pascalschumacher &amp;lt;pascalschumacher@gmx.net&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Date:   2016-11-03T20:14:36Z&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1281&quot; title=&quot;Javadoc of StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf is contradictory.&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1281&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1281&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Javadoc of StringUtils.ordinalIndexOf is contradictory&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15634407" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 3 Nov 2016 21:52:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user kinow commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    +1&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15634414" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 3 Nov 2016 21:55:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user aioobe commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    But the implementation of the method does NOT increment by 1 if given the empty string. So this change causes the documentation to contradict the implementation.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15634459" author="kinow" created="Thu, 3 Nov 2016 22:09:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I had voted +1 for the pull request, but then read the Javadoc again, and now I&apos;m not sure about it &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt;&quot;The code increments the starting index by one, rather than by the length of the match string, so matches may overlap.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure if there&apos;s anything wrong with the above statement for StringUtils#ordinalOf.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;gt; But the implementation of the method does NOT increment by 1 if given the empty string. So this change causes the documentation to contradict the implementation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Given the empty string, as far as I can tell, the implementation returns (as in the doc) &quot;the n-th index of the search CharSequence&quot;, which is 0. It never increments the starting index (which is done here &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/ff4497aff8cc9de4e0b2c6e5e23e5b6550f76f29/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java#L1477&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/ff4497aff8cc9de4e0b2c6e5e23e5b6550f76f29/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java#L1477&lt;/a&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As it was given an empty string, this check in ordinalOf method returns the empty string: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/ff4497aff8cc9de4e0b2c6e5e23e5b6550f76f29/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java#L1466&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/ff4497aff8cc9de4e0b2c6e5e23e5b6550f76f29/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.java#L1466&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15634495" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 3 Nov 2016 22:19:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user PascalSchumacher commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    `...incrementing the starting index by one after each successful match, so matches may overlap.` For empty String there is no match, so no incrementing is done.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Please do not hesitate to suggest better solution for this issue. Thanks!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15634543" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 3 Nov 2016 22:36:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user PascalSchumacher commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    I guess we should hide the implementation details and just state `Note: Matches may overlap.`.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    What do you think?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15634579" author="githubbot" created="Thu, 3 Nov 2016 22:51:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user aioobe commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Of course there are matches for the empty string. a) there is both a leading and trailing empty string in &quot;a&quot; for instance. b) the implementation doesn&apos;t return INDEX_NOT_FOUND when given the empty string.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    As far as I can tell, the implementation increments the position with 1 each time a match is found, except if the sought string is the empty string, in which case it increments with 0 (conceptually that is; in practice it obviously returns 0 right away for that case, since if it increments by 0 each match, it will never move away from 0).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Personally I think the implementation is messy and hard to formalize. It would have been much better if the implementation consistently stuck the idea of incrementing by 1 for each match. This would not rule out the optimization because one would simply return n for the empty search string case.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Given the situation I guess it&apos;s not an option to change the implementation though, so the only option left is to adjust the documentation to reflect the current behavior. Here are two suggestions:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &quot;increments by 1 unless the search string is the empty string in which case the position is never incremented&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    or something like&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &quot;always returns 0 if the search string is the empty string, otherwise it increments the position by 1 for each match found&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15634769" author="githubbot" created="Fri, 4 Nov 2016 00:27:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user coveralls commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    [!&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Coverage Status&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;a href=&quot;https://coveralls.io/builds/8658876/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/8658876&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://coveralls.io/builds/8658876/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/8658876&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="15635009" author="githubbot" created="Fri, 4 Nov 2016 02:42:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user kinow commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    I like &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &quot;increments by 1 unless the search string is the empty string in which case the position is never incremented&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15636879" author="githubbot" created="Fri, 4 Nov 2016 16:23:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user PascalSchumacher commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Updated the pull request using &quot;increments by 1 unless the search string is the empty string in which case the position is never incremented&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15637400" author="githubbot" created="Fri, 4 Nov 2016 19:20:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user aioobe commented on the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1278] BooleanUtils javadoc issues</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1278</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;1.  Every instance of &lt;tt&gt;NOTE: This returns null and will throw a NullPointerException if autoboxed to a boolean.&lt;/tt&gt; needs to be fixed, for example: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/LANG_3_5/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/BooleanUtils.java#L51&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/LANG_3_5/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/BooleanUtils.java#L51&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;autoboxed&lt;/tt&gt; -&amp;gt; &lt;tt&gt;unboxed&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;reference: &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/data/autoboxing.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/data/autoboxing.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;2.  &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/LANG_3_5/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/BooleanUtils.java#L1025&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/blob/LANG_3_5/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/BooleanUtils.java#L1025&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The examples are duplicated: lines 1029~1031 are identical to lines 1026~1028.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1276] StrBuilder#replaceAll ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1276</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There is a bug in replace for StrBuilder, seems the use of nonupdated buffer and character count is off.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;new StrBuilder(&quot;Dear X, hello X.&quot;).replaceAll(StrMatcher.stringMatcher(&quot;X&quot;), &quot;012345678901234567&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;yields&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 49
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrMatcher$StringMatcher.isMatch(StrMatcher.java:372)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrBuilder.replaceImpl(StrBuilder.java:2115)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrBuilder.replace(StrBuilder.java:2088)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrBuilder.replaceAll(StrBuilder.java:2049)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13013460">LANG-1276</key>
            <summary>StrBuilder#replaceAll ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="skotsj">Andreas Skomedal</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 19 Oct 2016 10:17:36 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Jun 2017 12:04:50 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 23 Oct 2016 15:07:01 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.2.1</version>
                    <version>3.4</version>
                    <version>3.5</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.6</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.text.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1271] StringUtils#isAnyEmpty and #isAnyBlank should return false for an empty array</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1271</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;An empty array does not contain any empty/blank CharSequences, so isAnyEmpty/isAnyBlank should return false for an empty array.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13007688">LANG-1271</key>
            <summary>StringUtils#isAnyEmpty and #isAnyBlank should return false for an empty array</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 26 Sep 2016 20:05:11 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 1 Jun 2020 06:17:20 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 19 Oct 2016 16:55:55 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>3.6</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15589249" author="pascalschumacher" created="Wed, 19 Oct 2016 16:55:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Pull request merged. Thanks!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17117028" author="elabouve" created="Tue, 26 May 2020 20:33:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s some more context on the change:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;$ jshell --class-path ~/.m2/repository/org/apache/commons/commons-lang3/3.4/commons-lang3-3.4.jar&lt;br/&gt;
 jshell&amp;gt; import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;&lt;br/&gt;
 jshell&amp;gt; StringUtils.isAnyEmpty((String[])null)&lt;br/&gt;
 $2 ==&amp;gt; true&lt;br/&gt;
 jshell&amp;gt; StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(new String&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;);&lt;br/&gt;
 $3 ==&amp;gt; true&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;$ jshell --class-path ~/.m2/repository/org/apache/commons/commons-lang3/3.10/commons-lang3-3.10.jar&lt;br/&gt;
 jshell&amp;gt; import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;&lt;br/&gt;
 jshell&amp;gt; StringUtils.isAnyEmpty((String[])null)&lt;br/&gt;
 $2 ==&amp;gt; false&lt;br/&gt;
 jshell&amp;gt; StringUtils.isAnyEmpty(new String&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;);&lt;br/&gt;
 $3 ==&amp;gt; false&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1269] Wrong name or result of StringUtils::getJaroWinklerDistance</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1269</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The name of the method StringUtils::getJaroWinklerDistance is misleading.&lt;br/&gt;
Currently for equal strings &lt;tt&gt;1&lt;/tt&gt; is returned, for completely different strings &lt;tt&gt;0&lt;/tt&gt; is returned. That is a measure of similarity, not of a distance. A distance must be &lt;tt&gt;0&lt;/tt&gt; for equal strings. I read on the issues &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-591&quot; title=&quot;A more complex Levenshtein distance would be useful&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-591&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-591&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-944&quot; title=&quot;Add the Jaro-Winkler string distance algorithm to StringUtils &quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-944&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-944&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, that it was decided to have a similar name to StringUtils::getLevenshteinDistance, but that requires also the change of the methods result.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Could you please (1) rename the method to StringUtils::getJaroWinklerSimilarity or (2) change the method to return &lt;tt&gt;1 - currentResult&lt;/tt&gt;?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;First option has the disadvantage to lose the similar naming of the similar methods, second option implies the risk to unnoticed introduce bugs in depending code. So I think it is preferable to use the first option.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13006450">LANG-1269</key>
            <summary>Wrong name or result of StringUtils::getJaroWinklerDistance</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jmkeil">Jan Martin Keil</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 21 Sep 2016 10:19:27 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 19 Mar 2017 13:28:15 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 19 Mar 2017 13:28:15 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.3</version>
                    <version>3.4</version>
                    <version>3.5</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>5</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15518833" author="britter" created="Sat, 24 Sep 2016 10:27:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This probably also affects Commons Text&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15567947" author="kinow" created="Wed, 12 Oct 2016 07:45:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Indeed Benedikt. I&apos;ll file a ticket for &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;text&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If methods like this are going to be deprecated (and maybe removed in the 4.x release?) in &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;lang&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, then I&apos;d think we should just add the @deprecated annotation to the method. Other wise, I&apos;d be inclined to leave the method name as-is (so we keep binary compatibility), return 1 - currentResult as suggested by &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jmkeil&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;jmkeil&quot;&gt;Jan Martin Keil&lt;/a&gt;; and maybe update the Javadocs as well.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15597540" author="pascalschumacher" created="Sat, 22 Oct 2016 09:40:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;What about deprecating the current method (letting it stay as it is) and adding renamed copy (getJaroWinklerSimilarity). This ensures that we do not break any existing code. What do you think?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15597562" author="githubbot" created="Sat, 22 Oct 2016 09:56:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user PascalSchumacher opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1269&quot; title=&quot;Wrong name or result of StringUtils::getJaroWinklerDistance&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1269&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1269&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Wrong name or result of StringUtils#getJaroWinklerDistance&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1267] FastDateFormat does not support timezone X/XX/XXX in SimpleDateFormat</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1267</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;It sees &lt;tt&gt;FastDateFormat&lt;/tt&gt; does not support timezone &lt;tt&gt;X&lt;/tt&gt;/&lt;tt&gt;XX&lt;/tt&gt;/&lt;tt&gt;XXX&lt;/tt&gt; in &lt;tt&gt;SimpleDateFormat&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example, &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;FastDateFormat.getInstance(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;throws an exception as below:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Illegal pattern component: XXX
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal pattern component: XXX
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDatePrinter.parsePattern(FastDatePrinter.java:282)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDatePrinter.init(FastDatePrinter.java:149)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDatePrinter.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(FastDatePrinter.java:142)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;X&lt;/tt&gt;/&lt;tt&gt;XX&lt;/tt&gt;/&lt;tt&gt;XXX&lt;/tt&gt; are different with &lt;tt&gt;Z&lt;/tt&gt; or &lt;tt&gt;ZZ&lt;/tt&gt; as described in &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html#iso8601timezone&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html#iso8601timezone&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;del&gt;It supports to read all &lt;tt&gt;+0800&lt;/tt&gt;, &lt;tt&gt;+08&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;+08:00&lt;/tt&gt; whereas it seems there is no way to include those all.&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I looked though the documentation multiple times but I could not find the explicit mention about this.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13005609">LANG-1267</key>
            <summary>FastDateFormat does not support timezone X/XX/XXX in SimpleDateFormat</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="5">Cannot Reproduce</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="hyukjin.kwon">Hyukjin Kwon</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 17 Sep 2016 05:56:01 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 19 Sep 2016 08:55:28 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 19 Sep 2016 08:48:25 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.3.2</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>

                            <comment id="15502750" author="britter" created="Mon, 19 Sep 2016 08:48:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This works with the current code base. See  commit bdb074610c87a210ea4c0d91d579cb4558f4b19f&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15502766" author="hyukjin.kwon" created="Mon, 19 Sep 2016 08:55:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for your help.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15523233" author="bodewig" created="Mon, 26 Sep 2016 14:32:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Looks as if the changed default locale provider might be the root cause: &lt;a href=&quot;http://openjdk.java.net/jeps/252&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://openjdk.java.net/jeps/252&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15523262" author="stain" created="Mon, 26 Sep 2016 14:43:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I had similar issues in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEANUTILS-495&quot; title=&quot;DateConverterTestBase fails on M/d/yy in Java 9&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;BEANUTILS-495&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;BEANUTILS-495&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15525041" author="charles_honton@intuit.com" created="Tue, 27 Sep 2016 04:34:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;At least two of the failures are actually SimpleDateFormat problems:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;SimpleDateFormat failed: &lt;br/&gt;
locale=qu_EC format=GGGG/yyyy/MMMM/dddd/hhhh/mmmm/ss/aaaa/EEEE input=/2003/Hatun puquy/0010/0012/0000/00/a.m./S&#225;bado&lt;br/&gt;
locale=qu_EC format=G/y/M/d/h/a/m/s/E input=/2003/2/10/12/a.m./0/0/Sab&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15525113" author="charles_honton@intuit.com" created="Tue, 27 Sep 2016 05:24:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Quechua (Ecuador) locale does not have era information.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15530334" author="chtompki" created="Wed, 28 Sep 2016 17:37:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Based upon &lt;a href=&quot;https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/e034bf56aafeef278682b7c9cab2d47be39c61a3e9218b3375bcb3e8@%3Cdev.commons.apache.org%3E&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Dalibor&apos;s email&lt;/a&gt; to the ML, the following does work running the tests in java 9:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;mvn -Djava.locale.providers=JRE clean test
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15532752" author="stain" created="Thu, 29 Sep 2016 13:18:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So I guess the unit tests could use System.setProperty to make them pass.. but would this not just hide the problems that actual users of FastDateParser will struggle with because they have not set that provider?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15536764" author="chtompki" created="Fri, 30 Sep 2016 19:07:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Right, I&apos;m not entirely sure what we should do here. It feels like if SimpleDateFormat is indeed the root cause of the issue, which it seems to be, then we should open a ticket with Java to resolve its parsing issues.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15539132" author="charles_honton@intuit.com" created="Sat, 1 Oct 2016 20:43:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created bug report concerning timezone parsing for Oracle Ea 9, &lt;a href=&quot;http://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=JDK-8167143&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;JDK-8167143&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15540159" author="britter" created="Sun, 2 Oct 2016 10:32:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Setting this to 3.6 since we have the workaround with the locale provider.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15873757" author="pascalschumacher" created="Sun, 19 Feb 2017 17:15:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The FastDateFormat related failures do not occur with java 9 build 157.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are now test failures in FieldUtilsTest and ToStringBuilderTest related to much stricter restrictions on reflection. These disappear if you open up jdk modules for reflection. For example the tests pass when run with:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;mvn test -DargLine=&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;--add-opens java.base/java.lang.reflect=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The test failure &quot;LocaleUtilsTest.testParseAllLocales:578 &#187; IllegalArgument Invalid locale forma...&quot; remains.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Edit: The LocaleUtilsTest.testParseAllLocales test failure is caused by the String &quot;ji_001&quot;. This is actually a valid locale, I created &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1312&quot; title=&quot;LocaleUtils#toLocale does not support language followed by UN M.49 numeric-3 area code&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1312&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1312&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; for this.&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="15883202" author="githubbot" created="Fri, 24 Feb 2017 17:56:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user PascalSchumacher opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/244&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/244&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1265&quot; title=&quot;Build failures when building with Java 9 EA&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1265&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1265&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Build failures when building with Java 9 EA&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Fix build on Java 9 Build 157 by adding a java-9 maven profile. This is activated by default on Java 9 and opens up java.base classes for reflection which makes all unit tests pass.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/PascalSchumacher/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/PascalSchumacher/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; fix_build_on_java_9&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/244.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/244.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    This closes #244&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;p&gt;commit e0b8d45ac7d7f2f15d670298fe5e1d4762efbce2&lt;br/&gt;
Author: pascalschumacher &amp;lt;pascalschumacher@gmx.net&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Date:   2017-02-24T17:51:03Z&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1265&quot; title=&quot;Build failures when building with Java 9 EA&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1265&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1265&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: Build failures when building with Java 9 EA&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Fix build on Java 9 Build 157 by adding a java-9 maven profile. This is activated by default on Java 9 and opens up java.base classes for reflection which makes all unit tests pass.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1262] CompareToBuilder.append(Object,Object,Comparator) method is too big to be inlined</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1262</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Issue is the same as in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1218&quot; title=&quot;EqualsBuilder.append(Object,Object) is too big to be inlined, which prevents whole builder to be scalarized&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1218&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1218&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: CompareToBuilder.append(Object,Object,Comparator) is quite big, due to in-place arrays processing, and thus breaching inlining threshold (325 bytecodes):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;....
o.a.c.l.b.CompareToBuilder::append (346 bytes)   hot method too big
....
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This prevents CompareToBuilder object itself from being scalarized.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fix may be the same, as in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1218&quot; title=&quot;EqualsBuilder.append(Object,Object) is too big to be inlined, which prevents whole builder to be scalarized&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1218&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1218&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: extract arrays processing into separate method.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13001098">LANG-1262</key>
            <summary>CompareToBuilder.append(Object,Object,Comparator) method is too big to be inlined</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1261] ArrayUtils.contains returns false for instances of subtypes</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1261</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ArrayUtils.contains(Object[] array, Object objectToFind) wrongly returns false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;STEPS TO REPRODUCE&lt;br/&gt;
=========================================================&lt;br/&gt;
-Create a superclass &quot;Parent&quot; and override equals and hashcode based on some member id variable.&lt;br/&gt;
-Create a class &quot;Child&quot; extending &quot;Parent&quot;. Do not override equals nor hashcode.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-Let &quot;childrens&quot; be an array of type Child[] containing several instances.&lt;br/&gt;
Create an instance of Parent &quot;p&quot; with the same id as childrens&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, such that childrens&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.equals(p) returns true and p.equals(childrens&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;) returns true as well.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Because they are equals, ArrayUtils.contains(childrens, p) should return true. However it returns false.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;WHERE THE BUG IS LOCATED&lt;br/&gt;
=====================================================&lt;br/&gt;
-Go to ArrayUtils.class, line 1917. In the &quot;indexOf&quot; method implementation, before going into calling equals for each element of the input array, there is some sort of optimization check to make sure the instance to be found is an instance of the array type:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;} else if (array.getClass().getComponentType().isInstance(objectToFind)) {&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That line is wrong. In our case, the array contains elements of type &quot;Child&quot;, whereas the object to be found is of type &quot;Parent&quot;. They are equals according to the equals implementation of &quot;Parent&quot;, but obviously Children.class.isInstance(p) is false.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;EXPECTED BEHAVIOR&lt;br/&gt;
================================================&lt;br/&gt;
Since the method signature accepts an array of Object[] and an instance of Object, it should ignore the classes of the arguments. It should be possible to call &quot;ArrayUtils.contains(Child[] children, Parent p)&quot;, in fact it should be possible to do this with any combination of classes, not only the ones assignable from the class hierarchy.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Android&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12999139">LANG-1261</key>
            <summary>ArrayUtils.contains returns false for instances of subtypes</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="h0m3r_j4y">Homer Jay</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>array</label>
                            <label>equals</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 23 Aug 2016 08:33:12 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 19 Oct 2016 07:01:19 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 18 Sep 2016 16:02:58 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.5</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15433237" author="githubbot" created="Tue, 23 Aug 2016 17:24:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user PascalSchumacher opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/183&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/183&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1261&quot; title=&quot;ArrayUtils.contains returns false for instances of subtypes&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1261&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1261&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: ArrayUtils#contains ArrayUtils#indexOf should compare obje&#8230;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &#8230;cts with different types&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/PascalSchumacher/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/PascalSchumacher/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; LANG_1261&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/183.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/183.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    This closes #183&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;p&gt;commit 82a54681e2e7ffbb21fbc7de4b252f0749201f12&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1260] LocaleUtils.toLocale() produces arbitrary locales</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1260</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When passing an invalid locale string (&lt;tt&gt;len != 2 &amp;amp;&amp;amp; len != 5 &amp;amp;&amp;amp; len &amp;lt; 7&lt;/tt&gt;) to &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.lang3.LocaleUtils#toLocale(String)&lt;/tt&gt; the method would previously (3.1) throw an &lt;tt&gt;IllegalArgumentException&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;With version 3.4 the method will &#8211; at least for any string with &lt;tt&gt;len == 3&lt;/tt&gt; &#8211; create an arbitrary locale:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// GIVEN
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; localeString = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;xyz&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// WHEN
&lt;/span&gt;Locale xyz = LocaleUtils.toLocale(localeString);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// THEN
&lt;/span&gt;assertEquals(xyz.toString(), localeString); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// What?&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We are relying on this behaviour (&lt;tt&gt;IllegalArgumentException&lt;/tt&gt;) and were quite surprised to not find any mention in the changelog.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12998927">LANG-1260</key>
            <summary>LocaleUtils.toLocale() produces arbitrary locales</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pmundt">Philip Mundt</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>

                            <comment id="15433197" author="pascalschumacher" created="Tue, 23 Aug 2016 16:57:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The description of &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-915&quot; title=&quot;Wrong locale handling in LocaleUtils.toLocale()&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-915&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-915&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; claims:&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1252] NumberUtils.isNumber and NumberUtils.createNumber resolve inconsistently</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1252</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In considering the issues &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1060&quot; title=&quot;NumberUtils.isNumber assumes number starting with Zero is octal&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1060&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1060&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1040&quot; title=&quot;Javadoc for NumberUtils.isNumber() are not clear enough&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1040&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1040&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1038&quot; title=&quot;NumberUtils#isNumber() returns false for &amp;quot;+2&amp;quot; and true for &amp;quot;-2&amp;quot;&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1038&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1038&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, and &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-992&quot; title=&quot;NumberUtils#isNumber() returns false for &amp;quot;0.0&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;0.4790&amp;quot;, et al&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-992&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-992&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, it seems that there are times when &lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.isNumber&lt;/tt&gt; resolves to &lt;tt&gt;false&lt;/tt&gt; while &lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.createNumber&lt;/tt&gt;, given the same input, does not throw an exception, returning a valid &lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Number&lt;/tt&gt;. This inconsistency should be resolved either by making &lt;tt&gt;isNumber&lt;/tt&gt; more lenient or &lt;tt&gt;createNumber&lt;/tt&gt; more stringent.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12993216">LANG-1252</key>
            <summary>NumberUtils.isNumber and NumberUtils.createNumber resolve inconsistently</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="chtompki">Rob Tompkins</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="chtompki">Rob Tompkins</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 28 Jul 2016 11:33:31 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 19 Oct 2016 07:01:19 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 11 Sep 2016 20:36:38 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.5</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.math.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15397431" author="chtompki" created="Thu, 28 Jul 2016 11:35:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Linking issues that I think this issue generalizes.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15417332" author="chtompki" created="Thu, 11 Aug 2016 14:32:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Regarding &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1038&quot; title=&quot;NumberUtils#isNumber() returns false for &amp;quot;+2&amp;quot; and true for &amp;quot;-2&amp;quot;&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1038&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1038&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.isNumber(&quot;-2&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt; returns &lt;tt&gt;true&lt;/tt&gt;. However, &lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.isNumber(&quot;+2&quot;)&lt;/tt&gt; returns &lt;tt&gt;false&lt;/tt&gt;. Further, &lt;em&gt;in Java 1.6&lt;/em&gt;, the following throw exceptions:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Byte&lt;/span&gt;.parseByte(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.parseInt(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;.parseLong(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Short&lt;/span&gt;.parseShort(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;whereas the following succeed,&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Double&lt;/span&gt;.parseDouble(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Float&lt;/span&gt;.parseFloat(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note.&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/em&gt; Benedikt suggested that &lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.parseNumber(str)&lt;/tt&gt; should not throw a &lt;tt&gt;NumberFormatException&lt;/tt&gt; and return a valid &lt;tt&gt;java.lang.Number&lt;/tt&gt; if and only if &lt;tt&gt;NumberUtils.isParsable(str)&lt;/tt&gt; returns true for the same &lt;tt&gt;str&lt;/tt&gt;. This seems to not be the case as:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;NumberUtils.isParsable(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/span&gt;NumberUtils.parseNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// the value 2&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This may be because in Java 6 only Float and Double return with a Valid number without exception.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15480705" author="chtompki" created="Sun, 11 Sep 2016 00:24:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In Java 1.6 &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;NumberUtils.createNumber(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;throws the following exception&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;+2&quot;&lt;/span&gt;

	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
	at java.lang.&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.parseInt(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Integer&lt;/span&gt;.java:449)
	at java.math.BigInteger.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;(BigInteger.java:316)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtils.createBigInteger(NumberUtils.java:769)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtils.createNumber(NumberUtils.java:593)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In Java 1.7 the call succeeds.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15480780" author="githubbot" created="Sun, 11 Sep 2016 01:21:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user chtompki opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/186&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/186&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1252&quot; title=&quot;NumberUtils.isNumber and NumberUtils.createNumber resolve inconsistently&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1252&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1252&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;: rename isNumber, isCreatable. Accommodate for java 6 &quot;+&quot; handing.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Associated with: &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1252&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1252&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    @britter, do you have any thoughts on this. I think that it sufficiently covers the issue, but I wasn&apos;t sure about the mechanics about predicating functionality on java version. The main issue is that `new java.math.BigInteger(&quot;+2&quot;)` works for Java 1.7 and up, but not in Java 1.6. On the other hand `java.math.Float.valueOf(&quot;+2.0&quot;)` works on all versions of java. So I tried to accommodate for that in the `isCreatable` method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Based on your email about releases and my being slightly deadline driven person, I figured I&apos;d try to put something reasonable together for the 3.5 release candidate. That said, if the diff on the PR doesn&apos;t look solid enough, I&apos;m willing to work on the changes some more.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/chtompki/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/chtompki/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1252&quot; title=&quot;NumberUtils.isNumber and NumberUtils.createNumber resolve inconsistently&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1252&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1252&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/186.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/186.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    This closes #186&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;

                            <comment id="15482012" author="githubbot" created="Sun, 11 Sep 2016 16:33:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Github user britter commented on a diff in the pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/186#discussion_r78298119&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/186#discussion_r78298119&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &amp;#8212; Diff: src/main/java/org/apache/commons/lang3/math/NumberUtils.java &amp;#8212;&lt;br/&gt;
    @@ -1360,11 +1361,44 @@ public static boolean isDigits(final String str) {&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&amp;lt;p&amp;gt;&amp;lt;code&amp;gt;null&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; and empty/blank 
{@code String} will return&lt;br/&gt;
          * &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;false&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
          *&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Note, {@link #createNumber(String)} should return a number for every&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * input resuling in &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;true&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *&lt;br/&gt;
          * @param str  the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;String&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to check&lt;br/&gt;
          * @return &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;true&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; if the string is a correctly formatted number&lt;br/&gt;
    -     * @since 3.3 the code supports hex {@code 0Xhhh} and octal {@code 0ddd} validation&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * @since 3.3 the code supports hex {@code 0Xhhh} an&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *        octal {@code 0ddd} validation&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * @deprecated This feature will be removed in Lang 4.0,&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *             use {@link NumberUtils#isCreatable(String)} instead&lt;br/&gt;
          */&lt;br/&gt;
    +    @Deprecated&lt;br/&gt;
         public static boolean isNumber(final String str) {
    +        return isCreatable(str);
    +    }&lt;br/&gt;
    +&lt;br/&gt;
    +    /**&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Checks whether the String a valid Java number.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Valid numbers include hexadecimal marked with the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;0x&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; or&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;0X&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; qualifier, octal numbers, scientific notation and&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * numbers marked with a type qualifier (e.g. 123L).&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Non-hexadecimal strings beginning with a leading zero are&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * treated as octal values. Thus the string &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;09&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; will return&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;false&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;, since &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;9&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; is not a valid octal value.&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * However, numbers beginning with {@code 0.} are treated as decimal.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;&amp;lt;code&amp;gt;null&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; and empty/blank {@code String}
&lt;p&gt; will return&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;false&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * &amp;lt;p&amp;gt;Note, &lt;/p&gt;
{@link #createNumber(String)}
&lt;p&gt; should return a number for every&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * input resuling in &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;true&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
    +     *&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * @param str  the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;String&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to check&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * @return &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;true&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; if the string is a correctly formatted number&lt;br/&gt;
    +     * @since 3.3 the code supports hex &lt;/p&gt;
{@code 0Xhhh}
&lt;p&gt; and octal &lt;/p&gt;
{@code 0ddd}
&lt;p&gt; validation&lt;/p&gt;
	&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;
		&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
			&lt;li&gt;End diff &amp;#8211;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;/ul&gt;
		&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;    should be changed to simply `@since 3.5`&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
