<item>
            <title>[LANG-1178] ArrayUtils.removeAll(Object array, int... indices) should do the clone, not its callers</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1178</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method ArrayUtils.removeAll(Object array, int... indices) currently sorts the input indices array. Therefore the array needs to be cloned; this is currently done by the callers.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However the sort is an implementation detail of the method, so should be done by the method itself, not by the callers, which is fragile (easy to overlook when creating a new method) and unnecessary.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This would also allow the method to be more easily changed to a different implementation that does not need to sort the array (e.g. using BitSet)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12907645">LANG-1178</key>
            <summary>ArrayUtils.removeAll(Object array, int... indices) should do the clone, not its callers</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 24 Oct 2015 13:42:12 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 19 Oct 2016 07:00:52 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 28 May 2016 11:16:42 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.5</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1172] LocaleUtils.toLocale does not handle extensions</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1172</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The &lt;tt&gt;toLocale()&lt;/tt&gt; method is unable to handle locale strings that have custom extensions that are completely valid according to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#section-4&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;BCP47 spec&lt;/a&gt;. Oracle documentation for sub tag extensions can be &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/i18n/locale/extensions.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;found here&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;An example locale string with a custom extension might be &lt;tt&gt;fr-CA-x-nb&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This issue seems to have been introduced with ticket &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-915&quot; title=&quot;Wrong locale handling in LocaleUtils.toLocale()&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-915&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-915&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12902708">LANG-1172</key>
            <summary>LocaleUtils.toLocale does not handle extensions</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1170] Data Race in StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1170</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Calling StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml from many threads creates a data race in the methods:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] lookupTable() {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (lookupTable == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
                createLookupTable();
            }
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; lookupTable;
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here are the stacktraces from my test:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;com/anarsoft/MultiThreadedOneInstanceTemplate.run
com/anarsoft/mit/TestCommonsLang.exec
org/apache/commons/lang/StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities.escape
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities.escape
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities.entityName
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities$LookupEntityMap.name
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities$LookupEntityMap.lookupTable
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities$LookupEntityMap.createLookupTable 


com/anarsoft/MultiThreadedOneInstanceTemplate.run
com/anarsoft/mit/TestCommonsLang.exec
org/apache/commons/lang/StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities.escape
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities.escape
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities.entityName
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities$LookupEntityMap.name
org/apache/commons/lang/Entities$LookupEntityMap.lookupTable
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Data Race was found using &lt;a href=&quot;http://vmlens.com&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://vmlens.com&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows JDK 1.8&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12895726">LANG-1170</key>
            <summary>Data Race in StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ThomasKrieger">Thomas Krieger</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 23 Sep 2015 09:33:14 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 16 Oct 2015 22:36:35 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 16 Oct 2015 22:36:26 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.6</version>
                                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1166] FastDateFormat does not honour &apos;ZZ&apos; pattern</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1166</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;A date format of &quot;yyyy-MM-dd&apos;T&apos;HH:mm:ss.SSS ZZ&quot; returns &quot;2015-08-13T11:37:13.203  Z&quot; for UTC timezone in version 3.4.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Same format with version 3.3.2 returns &quot;2015-08-13T11:39:28.452 +00:00&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The code which i am using to test this is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.util.Date;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.util.TimeZone;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;FastDateFormatTest {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;         DATE_FORMAT    = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;T&apos;&lt;/span&gt;HH:mm:ss.SSS ZZ&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt;       FastDateFormat fastDateFormat = FastDateFormat.getInstance(DATE_FORMAT, TimeZone.getTimeZone(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UTC&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;fastDateFormat = &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + fastDateFormat.format(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Date()));
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12855826">LANG-1166</key>
            <summary>FastDateFormat does not honour &apos;ZZ&apos; pattern</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="chonton">Charles Honton</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="abg1979">Abhishek Gupta</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 13 Aug 2015 11:41:43 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 28 May 2016 16:19:24 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 26 Aug 2015 02:26:04 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.4</version>
                                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14712373" author="charles_honton@intuit.com" created="Wed, 26 Aug 2015 02:25:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;FastDatePrinter javadoc explicitly states:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt; 
Java 1.4 introduced a &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; pattern letter, {@code &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;Z&apos;&lt;/span&gt;}, to represent
time zones in RFC822 format (eg. {@code +0800} or {@code -1100}).
This pattern letter can be used here (on all JDK versions).

In addition, the pattern {@code &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;ZZ&apos;&lt;/span&gt;} has been made to represent
ISO 8601 full format time zones (eg. {@code +08:00} or {@code -11:00}).
This introduces a minor incompatibility with Java 1.4, but at a gain of
useful functionality.
 
 Starting with JDK7, ISO 8601 support was added using the pattern {@code &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;X&apos;&lt;/span&gt;}.
 To maintain compatibility, {@code &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;ZZ&apos;&lt;/span&gt;} will &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;continue&lt;/span&gt; to be supported, but using
 one of the {@code &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;X&apos;&lt;/span&gt;} formats is recommended.
 &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The SimpleDateFormat javadoc states:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;RFC 822 time zone: For formatting, the RFC 822 4-digit time zone format is used:
     RFC822TimeZone:
             Sign TwoDigitHours Minutes
     TwoDigitHours:
             Digit Digit
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;SimpleDateFormat will output +0000 whether &apos;Z&apos;, &apos;ZZ&apos;, &apos;ZZZ&apos;, or &apos;ZZZZ&apos; or however many &apos;Z&apos; are used. &lt;br/&gt;
FastDateFormat will output +0000 for &apos;Z&apos; and Z (ISO8601) for &apos;ZZ&apos;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s not just UTC that has the formatting difference.  In Paris, FastDateFormat will output +02:00 instead of +0200; and in Los Angeles, -07:00 instead of -0700.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So, for compatible with SimpleDateFormat use &apos;Z&apos;. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>

            <title>[LANG-1163] There are no tests for CharSequenceUtils.regionMatches</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1163</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There are no tests for CharSequenceUtils.regionMatches.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It ought to behave the same way as the String version.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This includes not failing with Index OOBE if the CharSequences are not long enough.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1162] StringUtils#equals fails with Index OOBE on non-Strings with identical leading prefix</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1162</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;From the Commons User mailing list:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.equals(cs1,cs2) delegates to CharSequence.regionMatches(...) in a way that causes IndexOutOfBounds when either of cs1/cs2 isn&apos;t a String.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Specifically, comparing &quot;foo&quot; and &quot;foobar&quot; for non-String CharSequences bombs due to CharSequenceUtils.regionMatches(cs1, false, 0, cs2, 0, Math.max(cs1.length(), cs2.length())) because regionMatches doesn&apos;t check for input exhaustion.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12853971">LANG-1162</key>
            <summary>StringUtils#equals fails with Index OOBE on non-Strings with identical leading prefix</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="sebb">Sebb</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 10 Aug 2015 21:11:38 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 19 Oct 2016 07:00:36 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 11 Aug 2015 13:28:00 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.5</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14680793" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 10 Aug 2015 21:26:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The equals(...) method could check that the lengths are equal before calling regionMatches(...) as there is no point checking the contents if they differ.&lt;br/&gt;
This is already done by the related equalsIgnoreCase(...) method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However the underlying method CharSequence.regionMatches(...) should ideally behave the same way as String.regionMatches(...), i.e. it should return false if the regions are different lengths.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14680816" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 10 Aug 2015 21:44:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed equals():&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Repository: commons-lang&lt;br/&gt;
Updated Branches:&lt;br/&gt;
  refs/heads/master fad946a1d -&amp;gt; 6849dfc8a&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1162&quot; title=&quot;StringUtils#equals fails with Index OOBE on non-Strings with identical leading prefix&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1162&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1162&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; StringUtils#equals fails with Index OOBE on non-Strings with&lt;br/&gt;
identical leading prefix&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Project: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/repo&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/repo&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Commit: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/commit/6849dfc8&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/commit/6849dfc8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Tree: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/tree/6849dfc8&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/tree/6849dfc8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Diff: &lt;a href=&quot;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/diff/6849dfc8&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-lang/diff/6849dfc8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;TODO: fix regionMatches?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14681794" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 11 Aug 2015 13:28:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Will deal with the CharSequenceUtils.regionMatches issues as part of &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1163&quot; title=&quot;There are no tests for CharSequenceUtils.regionMatches&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1163&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1163&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15401209" author="githubbot" created="Sun, 31 Jul 2016 15:57:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user RamAnvesh opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/181&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/181&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    Adding test cases for StringUtils.equals methods to cover &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1162&quot; title=&quot;StringUtils#equals fails with Index OOBE on non-Strings with identical leading prefix&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1162&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1162&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;/&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1239&quot; title=&quot;StringUtils.equals(&amp;quot;&amp;quot;,new StringBuffer(&amp;quot;foo&amp;quot;)) throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-1239&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;LANG-1239&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; etc&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    $ git pull &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/RamAnvesh/commons-lang&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/RamAnvesh/commons-lang&lt;/a&gt; master&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/181.patch&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/pull/181.patch&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch&lt;br/&gt;
with (at least) the following in the commit message:&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1158] StrSubstitutor - escape character not working just before a variable</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1158</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I tried to use the following, expecting &quot;...ick brown fox paid $20.00 to jump over the la&#8230;&quot;:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// In org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrSubstitutorTest.java locally
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// after cloning https://github.com/woonsan/commons-lang.
&lt;/span&gt;    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testReplaceEscapingDollarSign() {
        values.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;amount&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;20.00&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        doTestReplace(&quot;The quick brown fox paid $20.00 to jump over
the lazy dog.&quot;,
                      &quot;The ${animal} paid $$${amount} to jump over the
${target}.&quot;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;(I put double dollar signs like $$${amount} because $ is the default escape character.)
Because I put three dollar signs in total, it should give one dollar sign followed by the resolved amount value: &quot;$20.00&quot;.

But, the result was:&quot;...ick brown fox paid $${amount} to jump over the la&#8230;&quot;.
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I also tried using a different escape character like this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testReplaceEscapingDollarSign() {
        values.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;amount&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;20.00&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; StrSubstitutor sub = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StrSubstitutor(values);
        sub.setEscapeChar(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&amp;lt;&apos;&lt;/span&gt;);

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; replaceTemplate = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The &amp;lt;${animal} jumps over the ${target}.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; expectedResult = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The ${animal} jumps over the lazy dog.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; replacedResult = sub.replace(replaceTemplate);
        assertEquals(expectedResult, replacedResult);

        replaceTemplate = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The ${animal} paid &amp;lt;$${amount} to jump over the ${target}.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        expectedResult = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The quick brown fox paid $20.00 to jump over the lazy dog.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        replacedResult = sub.replace(replaceTemplate);
        assertEquals(expectedResult, replacedResult);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, it fails like this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Tests run: 41, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.048 sec &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE! - in org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrSubstitutorTest
testReplaceEscapingDollarSign(org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrSubstitutorTest)  Time elapsed: 0.009 sec  &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE!
org.junit.ComparisonFailure: expected:&amp;lt;...uick brown fox paid []$20.00 to jump over ...&amp;gt; but was:&amp;lt;...uick brown fox paid [&amp;lt;]$20.00 to jump over ...&amp;gt;
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:115)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrSubstitutorTest.testReplaceEscapingDollarSign(StrSubstitutorTest.java:182)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;The second assertion failed. So, it seems working in case of &quot;&amp;lt;${animal}&quot;, but not working in case of &quot;&amp;lt;$${amount}&quot;.
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think escape character handling is inconsistent.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12848585">LANG-1158</key>
            <summary>StrSubstitutor - escape character not working just before a variable</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="woon_san">Woonsan Ko</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 23 Jul 2015 14:33:52 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 23 Jul 2015 20:30:26 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 23 Jul 2015 20:30:26 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.4</version>
                                                        <due></due>

                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14638933" author="woon_san" created="Thu, 23 Jul 2015 14:50:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I also tried this one as a workaround, but it also fails:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testReplaceEscapingDollarSign() {
        values.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;amount&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;20.00&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        values.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;dollar&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;$&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        doTestReplace(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The quick brown fox paid $20.00 to jump over the lazy dog.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,
                      &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;The ${animal} paid ${dollar}${amount} to jump over the ${target}.&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;org.junit.ComparisonFailure: expected:&amp;lt;...ick brown fox paid $[20.00] to jump over the la...&amp;gt; but was:&amp;lt;...ick brown fox paid $[{amount}] to jump over the la...&amp;gt;
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:115)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrSubstitutorTest.doTestReplace(StrSubstitutorTest.java:643)
	at org.apache.commons.lang3.text.StrSubstitutorTest.testReplaceEscapingDollarSign(StrSubstitutorTest.java:171)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you set the &apos;amount&apos; variable with a dollar sign prefix, or if you put a space between dollar variable and amount variable, then it may look working, but it gives a big limitation in my use case.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14639447" author="woon_san" created="Thu, 23 Jul 2015 20:29:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Anthony gave a good explanation about what the escape character means and how I can circumvent the issue in the user@ list &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;The escape character just tells StrSubstitutor &quot;Ignore the following
variable reference.&quot; When you change the default escape character, you
don&apos;t need to use it get a dollar sign before a variable reference in your
interpolated string. Try the following:

@Test
    public void testReplaceEscapingDollarSign() {
        values.put(&quot;amount&quot;, &quot;20.00&quot;);

        final StrSubstitutor sub = new StrSubstitutor(values);
        sub.setEscapeChar(&apos;&amp;lt;&apos;);

        String replaceTemplate = &quot;The &amp;lt;${animal} jumps over the ${target}.&quot;;
        String expectedResult = &quot;The ${animal} jumps over the lazy dog.&quot;;
        String replacedResult = sub.replace(replaceTemplate);
        assertEquals(expectedResult, replacedResult);

        replaceTemplate = &quot;The ${animal} paid $${amount} to jump over
the ${target}.&quot;;
        expectedResult = &quot;The quick brown fox paid $20.00 to jump over
the lazy dog.&quot;;
        replacedResult = sub.replace(replaceTemplate);
        assertEquals(expectedResult, replacedResult);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Sorry, the second sentence in the first paragraph should read: &quot;When you
change the default escape character, you don&apos;t need to use it _to_ get a
dollar sign before a variable reference in your interpolated string.&quot;

To explain a little more, consider what happens to &quot; $${amount}&quot; when
you&apos;re using StrSubstitutor&apos;s default escape character. StrSubstitutor sees
that you&apos;ve got a variable reference (&quot;${amount}&quot;), and that you&apos;ve got the
escape character (&quot;$&quot;) before it, so it replaces &quot;$${amount}&quot; with
&quot;${amount}&quot;.

Now consider what happens to &quot; $${amount}&quot; when you&apos;ve set StrSubstitutor&apos;s
escape character to something other than the default. StrSubstitutor sees
the variable reference (&quot;${amount}&quot;), notes that the character (&quot;$&quot;) before
the variable reference is _not_ the user-defined escape character, and so
replaces &quot;${amount}&quot; with the appropriate value form the map.
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think I can live with using a different escape character for my use case. So I&apos;ll close this issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;http://markmail.org/message/6p74g52hxkdaswtv&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://markmail.org/message/6p74g52hxkdaswtv&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>

                        <customfieldname>Development</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>

                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1157</link>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-1152] FastDateFormat seems to behave differently with very large dates than simple date format</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-1152</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Inconsistent behaviour compared to SimpleDateFormat.&lt;br/&gt;
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException using one format and no exception when using another format. (both legal).&lt;br/&gt;
Different results when using another format.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Testcase:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;import org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.hamcrest.Matchers;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.junit.Assert;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.junit.Test;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;&lt;br/&gt;
import java.util.Date;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public class FastDateFormatBug {&lt;/p&gt;



&lt;p&gt;    @Test&lt;br/&gt;
    public void testFastFormatWitLongMaxValue()&lt;/p&gt;
{
        Date date = new Date(Long.MAX_VALUE);
        String dateAsString = FastDateFormat.getInstance(&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;).format(date);
        Assert.assertThat(dateAsString, Matchers.equalTo(&quot;292278994-08-17&quot;));
    }

&lt;p&gt;    @Test&lt;br/&gt;
    public void testWeirdResultWithMaxValue()&lt;/p&gt;
{
        Date date = new Date(Long.MAX_VALUE);
        String dateAsString = FastDateFormat.getInstance(&quot;dd/MM/yyyy&quot;).format(date);
        Assert.assertThat(dateAsString, Matchers.equalTo(&quot;292278994-08-17&quot;));
    }

&lt;p&gt;    @Test&lt;br/&gt;
    public void testSimpleFormatWithLongMaxValueWithLenientOff()&lt;/p&gt;
{
        Date date = new Date(Long.MAX_VALUE);
        SimpleDateFormat fft = new SimpleDateFormat(&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;);
        fft.setLenient(false);
        String dateAsString = fft.format(date);
        Assert.assertThat(dateAsString, Matchers.equalTo(&quot;292278994-08-17&quot;));
    }

&lt;p&gt;    @Test&lt;br/&gt;
    public void testSimpleFormatWithLongMaxValueWithLenientOn()&lt;/p&gt;
{
        Date date = new Date(Long.MAX_VALUE);
        SimpleDateFormat fft = new SimpleDateFormat(&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;);
        fft.setLenient(true);
        String dateAsString = fft.format(date);
        Assert.assertThat(dateAsString, Matchers.equalTo(&quot;292278994-08-17&quot;));
    }

&lt;p&gt;}&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;ANY&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12843211">LANG-1152</key>
            <summary>FastDateFormat seems to behave differently with very large dates than simple date format</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="chonton">Charles Honton</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pasfilip">Pas Filip</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 7 Jul 2015 15:11:10 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 19 Oct 2016 07:00:50 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 8 Jul 2015 04:16:17 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>3.x</version>
                                    <fixVersion>3.5</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.time.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
